name: Night Sky over Pennsic
description_book: Come learn about the night skies.
description_web: Enjoy viewing the night sky over Pennsic. A small telescope will be present. Bring chairs and blankets out near the fencing list at about dusk. Family-friendly.

name: PW for Parents of Youth with Special Needs
description_book: This class, run by a warranted youth officer and modern-world special education teacher, is aimed at Pennsic-going parents and their children.
description_web: Are you coming to Pennsic for the first time and not sure how to handle your child's circumstances? Is there a new diagnosis on the table that changes how you and your family need to approach Pennsic? Do you have questions? Do you have tips to share? This class with Mistress Kis Marika is designed just for you.

name: Range Set-Up
description_book: Set-up of thrown weapons range. Set-up will be divided between two days.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Coffee with Friends of Dr Bob and Bill
description_book: Morning open meeting for those in recovery.
description_web: Morning open meeting for those in recovery.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off-line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Enameling 101
description_book: Basic intro to enamel. Create a pendant; learn about wet inlay and layering of transparent glass through the sifting enamel technique.
description_web: Very basic intro to enameling. We'll address the techniques of wet inlay using heraldic colors and layering of transparent glass through the use of sifting enamels. Students will leave with a self-created pendant. Ages 12 and up preferred due to materials used in the class.
fee_itemization: Enamel 10 colors, 20 copper blanks, sifters, paper towels, water, eye droppers, spoons,

name: Beginning Bobbin Lace
description_book: Three-day class for a total of 9 hours. Learn the basic movements and make three basic projects. Start a period pattern.
description_web: This is a three-day class for a total of 9 hours of bobbin lace! First Day: Students will learn the basic movements of bobbin lace and begin a project. Second Day: Students will finish the project and learn some simple grounds. Third Day: Students will begin a period pattern from the *Nüw Modelbuch*.
fee_itemization: $30 – One-time fee for all three days. Includes pillow with cover, bobbin holder, 10 pair of bobbins, pins, handout, patterns

name: Range Set-Up
description_book: Set-up of thrown weapons range. Set-up will be divided between two days.

location: Good Friends Camp (usually N-01 on St. Lawrence Way)
name: 16th-Century Limp Book Binding (Chain Stitch)
description_book: An all-day class making a 16th-century limp vellum-covered book with decorative chain stitching on an exposed spine. Some embroidery skills required.
description_web:
A start-to-finish class to make a 16th-century limp vellum-covered  book with chain stitched decoration and attachment. Students are encouraged bring their own cutting board, rotary cutter/X-acto, 2 or 3 beads for ties, and metal ruler, if they have them. (Binding tools will be loaned, if needed, however.) A 30- to 45-min lunch break will be allowed. 

Fee includes vellum for the cover, a detailed color hand-out, paper for book, leather for spine, beads for ties, and linen thread.
fee_itemization: Fee ($15) includes vellum for the cover, a detailed color hand-out, paper for book, leather for spine, beads for ties, and linen thread.

name: Japanese Stab Binding: Make a Book in Under 1 Hour
description_book: Make two books in an hour using the stab binding method of Japan. No handout, as we will focus on the craft rather than the history.
description_web: Come make two books in no time at all using the ancient stab binding method of Japan. There is no handout, as we will focus on the craft rather than the history, but a card with reference sites will be available. Supplies are limited to 6.
fee_itemization: Beeswax, Paper for book pages, decorative paper for book covers and linen binding thread.

location: Speckulian (W10 - Roman Road - Next to the large ROME Camp.)
name: Meditation, Emotional Freedom and Self Empowerment
description_book: Learn simple proven meditation techniques for emotional freedom, joy, and self empowerment.
description_web: Learn simple proven meditation techniques for emotional freedom, joy, and self empowerment. Practical breathing, mindset, and self-actualization methods will be presented, along with a group practice and energy session.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Cloisonné 101
description_book: Basic intro to cloisonné. Create an enameled pendant and learn basics of wire forming and cloisonné technique.
description_web: Very basic intro to cloisonné technique of enameling. We'll address the techniques of wet inlay and wire forming of different shapes. Students will leave with a self-created pendant. Ages 12 and up preferred due to materials used in the class. Completion of a piece typically takes about 2-2.5 hours. The additional time is scheduled for "open studio time" if students need additional time to work.
fee_itemization: Enamel, copper blanks, cloisonné wire, scooper tools (for inlaying enamel),  paper towels, baby wipes, water, eye droppers, paint trays, spoons, pliers

name: Introduction to *Kumihimo*
description_book: Learn the ancient Japanese art of *kumihimo*. This is a hands-on beginner class and each kit contains all you need to complete a *kumihimo* cord.
fee_itemization: Fee covers the cost of a portable kumihimo kit.  The kit includes an instruction sheet, bobbins, counter weight, loom, and craft thread.

name: Tools of the Flame
description_book: Discussion course designed to aid the beginning beadworker. Includes the tools, equipment and materials needed to begin making glass beads.
description_web: Discussion course designed to aid the beginning beadworker. We will discuss the tools, equipment and materials needed to begin making glass beads. Perfect for someone who may be thinking of flamework as a hobby, but unsure of the tools needed and their costs.

name: Period Slavic Seed Beads: *Gerdan*
description_book: We will create a period ethnic necklace that was used as an amulet a long time ago in East Europe, Asia, and the Middle East.
fee_itemization:
Printed colored scheme and instructions
Cords
Czech seed beads

name: Middle Eastern Dance 101
description_book: An introductory series of classes that explore basic belly dance moves and choreography.
description_web: This series of classes goes back to the very basics of belly dancing, or Middle Eastern Dance. We'll learn about the foundations of Middle Eastern dance, its history, and cultural significance in the North Africa/Middle Eastern regions. Utilizing the "body dictionary" framework, we'll review movements and isolations for each part of the dancer's body, and explore costuming ideas for performing the dance in period. There will be printed handouts with information and belly dance resources for a nominal fee. We'll end the series of dance sessions with a short choreography that illustrates the various movements inherent in this timeless dance. This class is designed for the beginner student of dance.
fee_itemization: Handouts will include historical information, costuming suggestions and resources (reading, music, etc.) for dance students

name: A Peek Under the Yellow Veil
description_book: The courtesan in Italy: a brief overview of Italian courtesans, the scope of courtesans in the SCA, Q&A
description_web: An overview of Italian Renaissance courtesans with touches on elsewhere in place and period, followed by what courtesans are/do in the SCA, and then a Q&A. There will be a slide show, handouts with bibliography, and discussion of how you can support your local courtesan personas.

name: If Looks Could Kill: Evil Eye Amulets
description_book: The history of amulets used against the Evil Eye through many cultures and time periods.
description_web: The history of amulets used against the Evil Eye through many cultures and time periods. Discussion of the amulet types plus scholars' deductions of why those amulets are the size, shape or color and style. *Class for adults only.* Reason: Some amulets are phallic in nature. Some discussion of male and female anatomy. Photos and objects of a phallic nature.

name: Thorsberg Trousers: Pants That Last!
description_book: Tired of repairing pants that rip in unmentionable places? Then you’ll love these pants based on trousers from an Iron Age burial!
description_web: Tired of repairing pants that rip in unmentionable places? Then you’ll love these pants based on trousers from an Iron Age burial! Learn what you’ll need to make them yourself: fabrics, seams, pattern, and construction.
fee_itemization: Handout is 11 pages long.

name: Make Your Own Medallion Cord
description_book: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, cord-making described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. OK to be late.
description_web: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, a method for cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. *Slung* is also known as Viking whip-cording. It is not only useful but a lot of fun for all ages. Can be done as a children's activity or at demos. Bring a friend! People will be taking turns on a limited number of set-ups. Showing up late is perfectly fine.

name: Who Was Eleanor of Aquitaine?
description_book: If you have heard of the famous wife and queen of Henry II, but wanted to know more about her life, then join us for a brief history and discussion.
description_web: If you have heard of the famous wife and queen of Henry II, but wanted to know more about her life and times, then join us for a brief history and discussion. Did she really invent chivalry? Was she responsible for the birth of Arthurian literature? Could she have been the richest woman in the world (for her time)?
fee_itemization: handout (optional)

name: Introduction to Fire Tending
description_book: Practical training in how to properly and safely start and maintain a cook fire to assist your camp cook in making feast. Theory and demonstration.
description_web: Practical training in how to properly and safely start and maintain a cook fire to assist your camp cook in making feast. Theory and demonstration. Participants will learn basic fire safety, axe handling, hatchet handling, and how to lay and feed a fire.
fee_itemization: Printing

name: Less Familiar ECD Dances Continued
description_book: Learn some of the less common dances such as *Maiden Lane, Scotch Cap, Milk Mayds Bob*, and *Drive the Cold Winter Away*.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
fee_itemization: materials

name: Middle Eastern Dancing for All Shapes and Sizes
description_book: If you love to shake your shimmy or want to try dancing for the first time, come out and join us.

name: Intro to *Kanzashi* Flowers
description_book: This is an introductory class in making basic *Kanzashi* Flower traditional hair ornaments worn in Geisha hair styles.
description_web: This is an introductory class in making basic 6-petal *Kanzashi* Flowers traditional hair ornaments worn in Geisha hair styles. Each student will be provided with all necessary pre-prepared materials necessary to complete their very own *Kanzashi* Flower in this class.
fee_itemization: All necessary pre-prepared materials necessary to complete a 6 petal Kanzashi Flower in the traditional style.  All necessary tools will be provided.

name: The Heathen Soul: An Anglo-Saxon Perspective
description_book: Some Anglo-Saxon sources tell us that man is comprised of three parts: his mind, his body, and his soul.
description_web: Anglo-Saxon sources use a variety of terms to refer to the soul; *feorh*, *ferhð* (Old Norse *vørþ*), *gæst*, and *sawol* in the latter Anglo-Saxon period. *Feorh* was the most commonly used word for the soul but it was last used in Chaucer’s time.

name: Historical Uses of Poisons
description_book: A rundown of the weaponization of poisons in period, garnered from various resources.
description_web: A review of the weaponization of poisonous plants (and two rocks) as recorded in history. A summary garnered from various resources, the compilation paints a unique picture of warfare and weaponization techniques from several cultures.

name: *Alquerque*
description_book: Period game from the Middle East in the family of checkers-style games. We will review what is known, the rules, and the play through some games.

instructor: THL Don Po Silvertop the Rogue
name: Æthelmearc Rapier Novice Tourney
description_book: For novices less than three years from first rapier authorization, have never received a Kingdom-level rapier award or won a published-event tourney.
description_web:
This tournament is open to any authorized rapier combatant with less than three years from their first rapier authorization, who has never received an award at the Kingdom level for rapier prowess, and who has never won a rapier tourney at a published SCA event. The tourney will be run as a multiple-bearpit tourney. Prizes will be awarded.

Note: This tournament will take place on the main rapier field

name: Byzantine Chainmail
description_book: This style of chainmail was prevalent for several centuries, across multiple cultures, throughout our period in the Mediterranean and European worlds.
description_web: Learn the Byzantine chainmail weave that was prevalent throughout our period across multiple cultures. All hand-prepared materials necessary to complete class project are provided. For those who don't have them, tools are available on a first-come, first-served basis.
fee_itemization: Sufficient hand-turned & cut rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter, to complete class project.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.
fee_itemization: materials

name: Late-Period Cross Stitch and Variations
description_book: Examines how cross stitch was used, alone and with other stitches, plus a brief look at long-armed cross and reversible cross stitch.
description_web: Examines examples of extant pieces and images, and the many ways cross stitch was used, alone and with other stitches, plus a brief look at long-armed cross and reversible cross stitch. SCA myths about cross stitch will be debunked. Some photos show pieces not available to the public.

name: Bullet Journal and Planner Gathering
description_book: Bring your BuJo or other planner and meet with others to share layouts, tips, and techniques for planning your modern and medieval lives!
description_web: The Bullet Journal is a customizable planning and organizing system. It can serve as your calendar, your to-do list, your diary, your sketchbook, your vacation planner, etc., all in one volume! Come compare layouts, collections, your favorite pens and other planner tools, and how you use your BuJo for planning your SCAdian life. Those who use other planners and planning systems are more than welcome to join the fun! So bring your Leuchtturms, your Molekines, your Erin Condrens, your Happy Planners, your Midoris (or Fauxdoris) and spend an hour with others who won't look at you oddly when you gush about your planner. Curious about Bullet Journals or other planner system? You're welcome, too!

name: Nefarious Characters: Assassins and Such
description_book: Existence of assassins in period; other bits of information regarding assassins and other nefarious types.

name: History of the Seed Beads
description_book: When were the seed beads used the first time? What necklaces are period? And many other questions we will answer!
fee_itemization: Print handout with resources we used in our research

name: Introduction to Irish Frame Drum, the *Bodhrán*
description_book: Basic instruction in *bodhrán* including most-used rhythms, session etiquette. Bring a drum if you have one; some loaners available.
description_web: Learn how to choose and care for the *bodhrán*; what makes a good tipper; tune and set structure, how to identify and play jig, reel, hornpipe, slip jig, polka rhythms; etiquette; jokes. Learn secret arcane hand gestures to amaze and stun your listeners. Demonstration of how to adapt *bodhrán* drumming to period music. Bring a *bodhrán* if you have one. A few loaner drums will be available. Teens and older welcomed.

name: Fingerloop Braiding
description_book: Make "a round lace of v bowys" (c.1475) to use as a medallion cord or purse string.
description_web: Fingerloop braids were used in period for any application which required a cord or lace. In this class, students will make and take a 5-loop braid, instructions for which have been found in an English manuscript dated c. 1475.
fee_itemization: Perle cotton for braiding, twine for anchor cord

name: Card Games: Tarot
description_book: Tarot cards are used in games as well as divination. Come and learn the rules and join in a fun, easy game.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
fee_itemization: Material

name: Introduction to Whisky
description_book: This class is for those interested in learning about whisky. The class will cover history, production, and free tastings. Age 21 and over.
description_web: This class is for those interested in learning about whisky. The class will cover history, laws governing spirits, and production. The class includes a how to taste and appreciate. Samples for 20 people. Some cups will be provided, but it's suggested you bring your own glass. Age 21 and over.

location: Denys The Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp  EO8)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: Daily meetings for those in any 12-step program such as AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: We welcome all in AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc., who are in any 12-step program to the 4:00 pm daily meeting at EO8 Denys The Decadent's Camp.

location: Orluk Oasis (W10, on the lake near the peninsula.)
name: Intro to Egyptian-Style Group Improvisation
description_book: Learn Tribal Odyssey: Egyptian-based improvisational tribal-style with *beledi*-style combinations.
description_web: Rajni is a Certified Level 1 Tribal Odyssey dance leader, a group improvisational style developed by Kawakib of Fredericksburg, VA. In the words of Kawakib: “Tribal Odyssey uses natural posture and both sides of the body in combinations based primarily on Egyptian *beledi*-style movement. It's versatile enough to adapt to any size group.” Class will repeat to allow for several days of practice with a group, and will incorporate recorded Middle Eastern drumming as well as live music/drumming as available. Learn moves that you and your dance friends can use at Pennsic haflas this year! Class will be taught in Orluk Oasis. Stay for refreshments and conversation after!

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Coffee with Friends of Dr Bob and Bill
description_book: Morning open meeting for those in recovery.
description_web: Morning open meeting for those in recovery.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off-line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Cheesemaking: How Hard Is **Your** Cheese?
description_book: Basic introduction into ingredients and supplies needed to make rennet-based cheeses.
description_web: Ever want to make cheese at home but not sure where to start or what you need to make cheese? This class will go over basic equipment and ingredients and where to find it all. Discussion will also include an overview of what you need for different types of cheeses. Basic recipes will be included in the handout as well.

name: Herbalism and Botanical References
description_book: Come find out about period texts on herbalism, horticulture, botany, and agriculture, from the Romans to 1600.
description_web: Come find out about period texts on herbalism, horticulture, botany, and agriculture, from the Romans to 1600. We will discuss texts, cultures, and the evolution of data within SCA period.
fee_itemization: $2 for handout.

name: 14th-Century Self-Stuffed Buttons
description_book: Hands-on. We will learn to create beautiful tight little wool buttons for their 14th garments

name: Ælflæd, Lady of Mercia
description_book: Exploring the life and deeds of Ælflæd, Lady of the Mercians, co-creator of a unified England in the 10th century.
description_web: The amazing daughter of Ælfred the Great was as instrumental in reconquering and holding the Saxon lands taken by the Vikings as her brother King Edward (the Elder).  She ruled Mercia with her husband Æthelred, and alone after his death, extending the *burh* system, and pushing back the borders of the Danelaw.

name: Beginner Knitting
description_book: Learn how to cast on, knit, purl, and cast off. Feel free to bring your own needles and yarn.
fee_itemization:
$2.50 - needles
$2.50 - yarn

name: Introduction to *Kumihimo*
description_book: Learn the ancient Japanese art of *kumihimo*. This is a hands-on beginner class and each kit contains all you need to complete a *kumihimo* cord.
fee_itemization: Fee covers the cost of a portable kumihimo kit.  The kit includes an instruction sheet, bobbins, counter weight, loom, and craft thread.

name: The End of Commonwealth: Iceland, 1150-1264
description_book: A look at the *Sturlunga* period in Icelandic history, the time when the Commonwealth ended and the Kingdom of Norway took control of Iceland.
description_web: A class looking at the *Sturlunga* period in Icelandic history, the time when the Commonwealth ended and the Kingdom of Norway took control of Iceland.

name: How to Make and Use Textile Printing Blocks
description_book: Make & take. Covers methods of making and printing. **Extensive** materials list. Please join www.facebook.com/groups/PrintedTextilesPennsic.
description_web: We will make textile printing blocks and cover the various methods of making more **and** we will print with them. Students will need to bring some design ideas. Keep it simple as you will be cutting it out with your scissors and/or a razor knife. This class is not child-friendly. **Extensive** materials list. Please join www.facebook.com/groups/PrintedTextilesPennsic.
fee_itemization: backing blocks, dowel sections, corks, craft foam sheets, precut designs

name: Blue and White Ceramic Design: Beginner Hands-on
description_book: A hands-on class examining the evolution of blue and white ceramic design over time from Iran to China and back through to England.
description_web: We will be discussing the evolution of designs found on blue and white ceramics across Europe and Asia with a specific focus on Iraq, Iran, Egypt, China, Turkey, Japan and Spain. This class will discuss the technological constraints on ceramic design as well as socio-political influences. Attendees will create two unique designs within the framework of our spatial and temporal discussion.

name: Medieval Women Warriors
description_book: We will discuss women who donned armor, picked up weapons, and fought alongside their male counterparts.
description_web: We will discuss women who donned armor, picked up weapons, and fought alongside their male counterparts. Were they really so unusual? Why did they choose to forgo traditional women’s roles? What’s fact and what’s fiction? Come and hear their stories and learn more about these wondrous warrior women.

name: Beginning Bobbin Lace
description_book: Three-day class for a total of 9 hours. Learn the basic movements and make three basic projects. Start a period pattern.
description_web: This is a three-day class for a total of 9 hours of bobbin lace! First Day: Students will learn the basic movements of bobbin lace and begin a project. Second Day: Students will finish the project and learn some simple grounds. Third Day: Students will begin a period pattern from the *Nüw Modelbuch*.
fee_itemization: $30 – One-time fee for all three days. Includes pillow with cover, bobbin holder, 10 pair of bobbins, pins, handout, patterns

name: Yorkshire Buttons
description_book: Want to know how to make an Elizabethan "Yorkshire" button (those round, thread-wrapped and woven buttons over a wooden center)? Then come and learn!
description_web: Learn how to make an Elizabethan "Yorkshire" button (those round, thread-wrapped and woven buttons over a wooden center). This is a beginner class for the button novice.
fee_itemization: For cotton perl thread, wooden button specific to the craft, and a specific needle.

name: The Very New Persona
description_book: You're brand, spanking new, and you don't know who you want to be? No worries! I'll talk through good starting points, and then we just chat. Relax!
description_web: You're brand, spanking new, and you don't know who or what you want to be? No worries! I'll talk through common considerations and good starting points for information. After we go through the basics, we just chat about our thoughts. Relax! It's not supposed to be work!

name: Enameling
description_book: Exploring the process of copper enameling using a cloisonné-style technique with wire and fusing of colors.

name: Glass Working Day
description_book: Learn how to make glass beads and learn different techniques to enhance your knowledge and skill.
description_web: Learn how to make glass beads and learn different techniques to enhance your knowledge and skill.

name: Make a Sand Castle
description_book: Come use colorful sand to make a play castle to use while at War.
description_web: Parents, this is a great downtime activity and fun project. You may, of course dispose of the castle at the end of War, after capturing an image for the memories!

name: Feasts Are More Than Cooking
description_book: A discussion of the many things needed for a successful feast that have nothing to do with the cooking.

name: Tournament Heralding and List Running
description_book: YouthU class for teens and tweens (and adults) who want to get involved in kingdom tournaments such as Crown Tournament and K&Q Rattan Championships.

name: Egg Recipes from Scappi
description_book: We will explore the place of egg recipes in the menus of Scappi and some of the many recipes.
description_web: Scappi's 15th-century Italian cookbook has an entire section on egg recipes, from fritters to *frittata*, from fried to boiled to stuffed, and everything in between. In this class we will first explore where in the year and when in the menu these recipes appear, then explore them in greater detail.

name: Demystifying the 12th-Century Bliaut
description_book: A review of the 12th-century dress as it appeared in history; we'll discuss easy construction.
fee_itemization: $1 for handouts

name: Nefarious Characters, Like Assassins and Such
description_book: How assassins existed in the past; other bits of information regarding assassins and other nefarious types.

name: Chemist-Cheese or Basic Cheesemaking
description_book: Learn how to make ricotta cheese to impress your friends! No experience/all ages. Everyone will get to try fresh ricotta at the end of class.
description_web: What happens when you heat up milk and add vinegar? Come find out! Science, only tastier! Class geared towards children but adults are welcome.

name: Women Pirates
description_book: Women pirates, their stories, their motives. What is fact or fiction? Come and learn about these dastardly damsels.
description_web: In this class, we will discuss women who chose to take up the profession of piracy. What did it take to be a woman pirate in an occupation dominated by men? What were their motivations? What happened to them? Come and learn about these bold women through their stories and we’ll try to separate fact from fiction. Let's dish out the dirt on these dastardly damsels!

name: Throw Away Your Wristwatch
description_book: Learn period methods of timekeeping to tell time day and night at Pennsic. Discussion of scientific principles so you can tell time anywhere, anytime.
fee_itemization: 30 page color booklet. Cardboard nocturnal. A stick.

name: Cooking over Wood
description_book: How to perform basic cooking tasks using fire. Learn what kinds of fires there are. Demonstration and theory.
description_web: How to perform basic cooking tasks using fire. Learn what kinds of fires there are and how to talk to your camp pyro-crat to get the best results. Demonstration and theory.
fee_itemization: Photocopy

name: The *Game of the Goose*
description_book: Period game in the style of *Chutes and Ladders*. The game is dice-based so it is suitable for children, but can be adapted to a fun game for adults.

name: Topics in Basic Heraldry
description_book: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory skills for consulting at Pennsic Herald's Point. Dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point.
description_web: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory submission skills necessary to consult at Pennsic Herald's Point. Exact dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point at the beginning of the War. All newer heralds are strongly encouraged to attend at least one of these classes prior to volunteering at Herald's Point.

name: Japanese Stab Binding: Make a Book in Under 1 Hour
description_book: Make two books in an hour using the stab binding method of Japan. No handout, as we will focus on the craft rather than the history.
description_web: Come make two books in no time at all using the ancient stab binding method of Japan. There is no handout, as we will focus on the craft rather than the history, but a card with reference sites will be available. Supplies are limited to 6.
fee_itemization: Beeswax, Paper for book pages, decorative paper for book covers and linen binding thread.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, Thursday, 8/10 (time and place to be determined).

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: A Hand a Day: Uncial and Artificial Uncial
description_book: Learn the basics of these two early-period hands that were used extensively in manuscripts across England and Ireland.

name: Hand-Sewing 101
description_book: A discussion and hands-on of hand-sewing of garb, etc. This is not embroidery, but useful stitches. Please bring needle, thread and light cloth.

name: Knitting with Two or More Colors
description_book: Learn how to knit with more than one color. This is an intermediate-level class. Feel free to bring own yarn and needles.

name: Healthy Hair Care Then and Now
description_book: We'll be reviewing how people kept their hair clean in the past. Then we'll cover healthy natural hair care in the modern age without shampoo.
fee_itemization: $1 is for a sample hair wash. $2 is for a handout that includes several wash recipes

name: *Wagadu*: The Empire of the Ghana
description_book: Among the lush lands between the rivers of West Africa a strong empire grew based on the salt and gold trade. Learn about its people and culture.
description_web: Beyond the Great Sahara lies the lush lands among the rivers of West Africa. There a strong empire grew based on the salt and gold trade. We will talk about its people, culture, neighbors and secrets.

name: Cover to Cover
description_book: Learn the step-by-step process to create a book, plus some history of the Byzantine Codex. Not a hands-on class. You will not leave with a book.

name: Irish Language 101
description_book: The Irish language: pronunciation, basic grammar, introductions, counting, ask and answer questions, how to be polite.
description_web: Basic introduction to the Irish language (modern, sorry, not ancient). Learn pronunciation and grammar rules, pronouns and vocabulary, how to introduce yourself and tell someone where you are from, how to count and tell time, how to ask and answer simple questions, and how to politely say a few phrases like "please" and "thank you".

name: Going to Hell in the Middle Ages
description_book: Comparing the medieval view of Hell with modern perceptions, including the popular motif - the Hell Mouth.

name: Anglo-Saxon Riddles
description_book: Come learn about the riddles of the Exeter Book and their place in Anglo-Saxon culture, with examples to take to camp and share!
description_web: Come learn about the riddles of the Exeter Book and their place in Anglo-Saxon culture, with examples to take to camp and share!

name: Counted Work Not Displayed at the Met
description_book: The Metropolitan Museum has interesting embroideries which are rarely, if ever, seen by the public.
description_web: The Metropolitan Museum has interesting embroideries not displayed to the public, but I was able to photograph some, including a few reverse sides. These items and fragments often have interesting differences from those the public sees, and can be analyzed in detail. Since the Met does not allow copies of the photos to be given out, the handout will include some charts I've made of them instead.

name: Retaining 101
description_book: Basic information on what retaining is and what to expect, and what you get in return from the experience. Class is geared toward 12- to 14-year-olds.
description_web: Basic information on what retaining is and what to expect, and what you get in return from the experience. Class is geared toward 12- to 14-year-olds interested in volunteering their time.

name: How to Make a Medieval Sword Scabbard
description_book: The DIY process of making historically-accurate sword scabbards for the entry-level scabbard maker.
description_web: The objective of this 2-hour class is to give the entry-level scabbard maker an overall appreciation for the Do-It-Yourself process of making historically-accurate European medieval sword scabbards, using modern tools. Making a scabbard is not as difficult as one might imagine, and so the hope is that this class will encourage you to eventually jump in and try it yourself. Class will cover specific resources, materials, tools and techniques. Course fee is $15 for a booklet.
fee_itemization: Instruction booklet

name: Jest Foolin' Around: The Fools & Jesters of Period
description_book: Some history and traditions to the profession of making laughter in the Middle Ages and Renaissance.
description_web: Some history and traditions to the profession of making laughter in the Middle Ages and Renaissance.

name: Tarot and other Card Games
description_book: A review of the card games previously taught, including the game of tarot. Practice playing them with an instructor's assistance.
description_web: This class will review the card games previously taught, including tarot. You can practice playing them with an instructor's assistance.

name: I Spy: Calligraphy
description_book: Want your calligraphy look more “medieval"? Letters don't look quite right? Learn how to analyze calligraphy and take your letters to the next level.
description_web: Searching for ways to make your calligraphy look more “medieval"? Not sure why your letters don't look quite right? This class will show you how to analyze calligraphy and take your letters to the next level. Some calligraphy experience is helpful.
fee_itemization: handout and supplies

name: *Marudai* for Beginners (Also *Kumihimo*)
description_book: *Kumihimo* on a *marudai* stand for beginners. Braiding on traditional Japanese stand. Stands available for purchase.
description_web: *Kumihimo* on a *marudai* stand for beginners. Learn to braid beginning patterns on the traditional Japanese stand. Stands available for purchase from instructor for $120.00.
fee_itemization:
5.00 for class and handout
3.0 for handout only
120.00 if you choose to purchase stand

name: Commenting on Letter of Intent
description_book: Heraldic letters of intent (in and out of kingdoms) can always benefit from both trained, and less-experienced, commenters. How can you help?
description_web:
Commenting on letters of intent: How I learned to stop worrying and love heraldry.
Heraldic letters of intent (in and out of kingdoms) can always benefit from both trained, and less-experienced, commenters. We will discuss how to provide helpful commentary. For heralds or aspiring heralds.

name: Micro-mosaics Make-and-take
description_book: Discuss mosaics of tiny pieces in period, and make a slightly-post-period jewelry item!
fee_itemization: Jewelry bezels, epoxy clay, mosaic items (glass rods, stones, metal chips, etc)

name: Medieval Double Aprons
description_book: We will discuss the medieval double apron, most often known as a midwife's apron.
description_web: We will discuss the medieval double apron, most often known as a midwife's apron. We'll discuss its prevalence in period depictions and how to develop a pattern to make your own. This is an easy project for almost anyone, from beginning seamstresses/tailors to advanced.
fee_itemization: $1 for printed handouts to cover cost of paper and ink

name: The Chinese Knight-Errant
description_book: An examination of the history and motivations of Chinese "knights".
description_web: Join us for a discussion of how chivalry was practiced in China in the Middle Ages. This class will cover how *Xia* is different from Western chivalry, how it is the same, and ways to incorporate these into your persona.

name: Planning a Feast
description_book: How to design a menu, figure out how much to cook, plan logistics, and everything else you need to consider to ensure a successful feast.

name: The New Bard's Road Map
description_book: A how-to primer for new/aspiring bards. Developing repertoire, finding performance opportunities, seeking mentors and patrons, joining the community.
description_web: A how-to primer for new or aspiring bards. Developing a repertoire, finding performance opportunities, seeking mentors and patrons, gaining visibility, becoming part of the bardic community.

name: Period Printing Pastes for Textiles: Make-and-Take
description_book: Make a period print paste and print a textile. **Extensive** materials list. Please join www.facebook.com/groups/PrintedTextilesPennsic.
description_web: Make a period print paste and print a textile. **Extensive** materials list. Please join www.facebook.com/groups/PrintedTextilesPennsic.
fee_itemization: iron oxide and other pigment powder, flour, vinegar

name: Drinking along the Silk Road
description_book: Explore the art, history, and poetics of wine in medieval China with a journey along the dusty merchant trails of Silk Road caravans.
description_web: Explore the art, history, and poetics of wine in medieval China with a journey along the dusty merchant trails of Silk Road caravans. We examine the art, archaeology, literary testimony, and cultural mores of potent potables with an emphasis on China's Shang, Zhou, and Tang Dynasties. The Far East shone while Europe was in the dark, yet how did Alexander's legacy influence medieval Chinese drinking practice?

name: The Afterlife In Pre-Christian Anglo-Saxon England
description_book: *Walheall* is not strictly a warrior paradise meant only for those who died in battle.
description_web: When talking about the afterlife in heathenry, the first thing that comes to most people’s minds is *Walheall* (Old Norse *Valhӧll*). Wóden gathers his champions, the *einherjar*, here. Their only ticket to *Walheall* was to die in battle. Here, the *einherjar* fight from sunrise to sunset and those slain in battle that day are resurrected at day’s end. After sunset they spend the rest of the night feasting on the boar, *Sæhrímnir* (sooty sea-beast or sooty sea-animal), and drinking mead produced by the goat, *Heiðrún* (Old Norse *heiðr* meaning "bright, clear" and *rún* meaning "secret").

name: Speaking Forsoothly for Newcomers
description_book: Speaking forsoothly is nothing more and nothing less than speaking in a way that sounds medieval.
description_web:
In the collective participatory fantasy which is the Society for Creative Anachronism, there is an expectation to act in a way consistent with having a pre-seventeenth century persona. Part of this is "Speaking Forsoothly".  
"Speaking Forsoothly" can be defined as speaking in such a way that 21st-century North American English speakers would perceive your manner of speech as being from an earlier time, likely before the seventeenth century.

name: Mad Words: Comedic Theatre of Japanese *Kyōgen*
description_book: *Kyōgen* is a style of comedic theatre begun by 14th-century Japan and continued today, often as a companion to more serious *nō* dramas.
description_web: Often translated as "mad words", *kyōgen* is a style of comedic theatre begun by the 14th century in Japan and continued today, often as a companion to the more serious *nō* dramas. This will class will cover history and description of the art as well as demonstration through short skits and participation in movement workshops.

name: Make a Simple Girdle Book
description_book: We will make a simple blank journal and create a fabric girdle to cover it. Bring 2-foot square of fabric or choose from the instructor's stash.
description_web: In this class we will first make a journal and then craft a girdle to cover it that you can hang it from your belt. All materials will be provided by the instructor, but if you have a specific kind of fabric to match your device or as the basis for further embellishment, please bring a 2-foot square of fabric. Instructions will be provided in a handout.
fee_itemization: Handout, binding supplies, leather, paper, fabric.

name: Classes Posted at the Dance Tent Today!
description_book: Please see the signboards or Thing online for today's dance classes!

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
fee_itemization: materials

name: Perfect Medieval Spindle and Distaff Workshop
description_book: Match spindle and distaff to your persona and time period in Europe. Lecture and hands-on.
description_web: Match a spindle and distaff to your persona and time period in Western Europe. Lecture and hands-on class to experience different types of removable whorl spindles and distaves (hand, waist & floor) and which goes with which.  Early period (Roman/Viking), Middle Ages up to Early Modern. **Not a beginner's class**; some spinning experience expected. Students are encouraged to bring their own spindles and distaves for show-and-tell. Kits as well as loaners are available. Other spindles, whorls and distaves are available for purchase from the vendor (Minerva’s Spindle) where this class is held during and after class, but only if student desires.
fee_itemization:
Handout - paper copies
Materials - Each kit contains 1 perfectly ordinary medieval wood spindle and removable pottery whorl (seconds) as well as sample wool to spin.

name: What Are the Known World Choir's Top Ten?
description_book: Singers and directors of singers: this is the list for you! Come sing through the KWC's collated list of songs many groups will enjoy performing!
description_web: Singers and directors of singers: this is the list for you! Come sing through the KWC's collated list of songs many groups will enjoy performing!
fee_itemization: Song list handout is free.  Photocopies of all songs will be on hand - $3 donation if you wish to keep the music, please

location: The Camp of the Three Bears (N17 along Battle Road)
name: Building a Camp Bread Oven
description_book: Join us in building our camp's beehive bread oven.
description_web: A hands-on lesson in one method of constructing a temporary beehive bread oven, one that's been built at Pennsic for two decades.

name: Kiev and Post-Kiev Russ and Mongols: 13-15 C.
description_book: More than 200 years of troubled relations between Eastern Europe and Mongols, full of bloody wars and uneasy and unexpected alliances. New look.
description_web: More than 200 years of troubled relations between Eastern Europe and Mongols, full of bloody wars and uneasy and unexpected alliances. The depiction of these complex relations pass through several stages in historiography and have been highly politicized. What, indeed, do we know about this period?

name: History of Late Period (1500-1600) Bookbinding
description_book: The mass production of books was well underway by 1500. Bookbinding was becoming an industry all its own.

name: Basic Hand-Stitches
description_book: Beginner class in hand-stitching. Learn stitches for hemming and seaming by hand, including whip, slip, catch, running back stitch, and rolled hem.
description_web: Beginner class in hand-stitching. Learn stitches for hemming and seaming by hand, including whip, slip, catch, running back stitch, and rolled hem. Designed for novices, but students of all skill levels are welcome. Students will be provided with muslin, thread and needles for practice.
fee_itemization: Muslin, thread, needles

name: Help Me, Tempus, You’re My Only Hope!
description_book: Two hours with Tempus, anything sewing. Trouble-shooting, problem-solving, garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Maybe learn to sew...
description_web:
(Garb Troubleshooting/Q&A Workshop)
This is a trouble-shooting and problem-solving class; garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Bring to the class garb that went “wrong” or garb that didn’t “work” for you. We'll talk; it can be fixed. If you don’t have the garb here, bring your questions; we’ll do our best to solve your garb troubles. We’ll talk about gussets and how to use your seam ripper, too. This class can go on longer if needed. Also, this class will be offered next year.

name: Historical Uses of Poisons
description_book: A rundown of the weaponization of poisons in history garnered from various resources.
description_web: A review of the weaponization of poisonous plants (and two rocks) as recorded in history. A summary garnered from various resources, the compilation paints a unique picture of warfare and weaponization techniques from several cultures.

name: Cords: Lucet vs. Tablets vs. Fingerloops
description_book: Comparing lucet cord, tubular tablet-weaving & finger-loop braids: elasticity, patterning, materials & take-up, ease of production, documentability.

name: How to Make and Use Stencils for Printing Garb
description_book: Covers methods of making & printing with stencils. **Extensive** materials list. Please join https://www.facebook.com/groups/PrintedTextilesPennsic/
description_web: We will make stencils for printing textiles **and** we will print with them. Students will need to bring some design ideas already printed out. Keep it simple as you will be cutting it out with your scissors and/or a razor knife. This class is not child-friendly. **Extensive** materials list. Please join https://www.facebook.com/groups/PrintedTextilesPennsic/
fee_itemization: Five sheets of transparency paper for $1 as needed.

name: Vinegaroon – Never Dye Leather Again!
description_book: Learn to make deep black leather using this ancient mixture of iron scrap and vinegar!
description_web: Long before Fiebings or Eco-Flo leather dyes, people made deep black leather using this ancient mixture of iron scrap and vinegar. It works instantly, never rubs off, and never fades! Come see how it works, try it for yourself, and learn to make your own! Class will consist of a short talk about the historical plausibility of this method, a discussion of the chemical properties that make it work, a demonstration, and hands-on make-and-take of a simple key fob.

name: Make Your Own Medallion Cord
description_book: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, cord-making described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. OK to be late.
description_web: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, a method for cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. *Slung* is also known as Viking whip-cording. It is not only useful but a lot of fun for all ages. Can be done as a children's activity or at demos. Bring a friend! People will be taking turns on a limited number of set-ups. Showing up late is perfectly fine.

name: Myths and Legends of The SCA
description_book: We've all heard stories about the SCA of long, long ago. Come and hear some new ones, or share your own.
description_web: We've all heard stories about the SCA of long, long ago. Come and hear some new ones, or share your own. Stories may include  "The SCA vs. The Motorcycle Gang", "Why You Should Never Try to Mug a Knight", "The Russian Spies Learn about The SCA", and others. After last year's sessions I've added several new myths to the class.

name: Graph Paper is Your Friend
description_book: How to use graph paper to perfect your pattern layout, save yourself time, fabric and heartache! Beginner-level pattern layout.
description_web: How to use graph paper to perfect your pattern layout, save yourself time, fabric and heartache! Beginner-level pattern layout. Class starts with a quick breakdown of how, then we dive right in and practice the theory hands on. *Please bring a pencil and eraser if possible*.

name: *Laugh and Lie Down*
description_book: A simple, matching-style card game. We'll teach the rules and then give you a chance to play.

name: Recorder Jam with Siri!
description_book: Read through Renaissance recorder literature. Loaner SATB recorders available. Soprano recorders available for purchase.
description_web: Play recorders with others in a group setting and read through Renaissance literature. In a two-hour session, we will start with beginner/easy sequential drills and move toward harder music. Beginner players should arrive early; advanced can arrive later. Bring your instrument or use a loaner (Soprano, Alto, Tenor or Bass). New (Harmony brand) Soprano recorders will be available for $4.
fee_itemization: Copies of music

name: Non-European Chainmail
description_book: Intro class to non-European chainmail. Bring your own tools. Materials provided.
description_web: Intro class to non-European chainmail. Bring your own tools. Limit of 5 participants. Materials provided. $10 materials fee.
fee_itemization: Hand turned & cut enameled copper rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter; sufficient to complete class project

name: Belt Favors
description_book: This class is for children ages 10 and under. Learn to paint a belt favor on pre-assembled fabric using our simple templates, or design your own.
description_web: This class is for children ages 10 and under. Paint a belt favor on pre-assembled fabric using our simple templates, or design your own as you choose. We will help  get started painting, and then learn history of the favor while we work. You will  will have a finished project to wear at the end of class. Parents accompanying their little ones are encouraged to make their own while helping their little ones.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.
fee_itemization: materials

name: Being Your Persona
description_book: How to maintain the illusion, at an event, that you are a period person interacting with other period people.
description_web: How to maintain the illusion, at an event, that you are a period person interacting with other period people.

name: Food Safety for SCA Cooks
description_book: Preparing an SCA feast is different from preparing a family dinner. Learn about the food safety practices needed to ensure a safe event.
description_web:
Preparing an SCA feast is different from preparing a family dinner. Learn about the food safety practices needed to ensure a safe event.

Students will learn the causes of food-borne illness as well as safe food handling practices related to these:
Preventing Cross Contamination
Controlling Time and Temperature
Good Personal Hygiene
Cleaning and Sanitizing
Planning a Successful Food Event

Whether you are a new event cook, or you and your kitchen staff have been doing this for years, it is important to be up to date and knowledgeable about food safety.
fee_itemization: $2 for class handout

name: Viking Era Headgear: A Survey
description_book: Fashions of and archaeological evidence for Jorvik and Dublin caps, Skjoldehamn and Hedeby hoods, nålbound and sprang caps, tablet-woven headbands.

name: Basic *Ka-Kha-Ga-Gha*
description_book: Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *Devanagari* script used by Hindi, Sanskrit and other Indic languages.
description_web:
Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *Devanagari* script used by Hindi and other North Indian languages. While the focus of this class is on Hindi usage, the characters and pronunciation are nearly identical for others. There will be examples in Hindi and basic documentation.
1st hour: Basic characters and pronunciation.
2nd hour: Vowels and half-letters; more if time and student interest allow.

name: Period Stained Glass (Basic and Advanced)
description_book: Discussion of materials, techniques, and primary sources used in period stained glass work. This will not be hands-on, but many visual aids!
description_web: Discussion of materials, techniques, and primary sources used in period stained glass work, including vitreous paints, silver stain, design considerations, lead came technique, making pigments and silver stains, period kiln designs, etc. Discussion will also include an overview of primary sources and other resources for research. Practical hands-on will not be available, but many examples will be available for viewing.

name: Coaching and the Art of Constructive Criticism
description_book: Discover proven NPS coaching techniques to cultivate critique that aids and inspires rather than crushing talent before it can bloom. Coach the Dream!
description_web: We all hear the cries of the populace - or at least the artists-to-be and the volunteers-to-be - that they tried and were rendered low by sharp criticism. Here you can discover proven coaching techniques from a National Park Service Registered Coach. Learn to shape artistic performance and presentation or volunteer service into something that serves the Dream rather than drives people away!

name: Meat and a Sauce: Recipes from the *Banchetti*
description_book: A veal meat pie in the French style, a stuffed breast of veal, and a egg yolk and grape juice syrup sauce called cordial.
description_web: A veal meat pie with beef fat, ginger, pepper, nutmeg, saffron, cloves, and a small amount of ground onion baked in a egg and flour and saffron pie case; a breast of veal stuffed in the Lombardy style stuffed with cheese, eggs, herbs in oil, pepper, saffron, grated bread, raisins, pounded walnuts, and a small amount of pounded fat and a sauce called cordial made with egg yolks, sour grape juice grape syrup, saffron and placed over cooked fish with sugar and true cinnamon sprinkled on top.

name: Beaded Rose
description_book:
Make a miniature rose in the style of beaded flowers of 15th-century Venice. If you have needle-nose pliers/wire cutters, 
bring them to class.
description_web: Make a miniature rose in the style of beaded flowers of 15th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class. Not recommended for youth.
fee_itemization: beads & wire

name: Social Theory of *Commedia dell’Arte*
description_book: Styled like morality plays but wholly quotidian, *commedia* follows a single social perspective that defines all roles, conventions, motion, and plot.
description_web: Stylized, as morality plays were, but wholly secular and quotidian, *commedia* follows a single social perspective that defines everything on stage: all roles, conventions, motion, and plot. Before the invention of characters in the modern sense, and before the fourth wall was raised, *commedia* used roles representing social segments to mock the *nouveau riche* and the limits of their authority over their children, their servants, and the loose cannons of the newly-risen middle class, and thereby revealed our common underlying humanity and shared struggles in urban life.

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn how to throw axes, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit: 25 participants. No experience needed.

name: Hedeby Apron: A Simple Construction
description_book: A new cutting/sewing layout for a Norse apron-dress, based on the Hedeby fragment. Only two measurements, one cut, and three seams!
description_web: A new cutting/sewing layout for a Norse apron-dress based on the Hedeby harbor fragment. We will briefly discuss the extant fragment and why it is interesting to the historical costumer, and then learn how to construct the garment using a new construction/layout. Only two measurements, one cut, and three seams! Good for both beginning and advanced tailors.

name: Interrogating Your Museum
description_book: It's time to get more out of your museum. Find out what to ask, who to ask, and what to do with the answers once you have them.

name: Scottish Choral and Vocal Music Under the Stewarts
description_book: 12th-16th century, sacred and secular, choral and vocal, pre- and post-Reformation. Sources and solutions!
fee_itemization: Duplication costs of handout materials and music.

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to Gypsy Persona
description_book: Don't know how/where to start with this persona? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a Gypsy persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.

name: Making a Farthingale
description_book: Building a farthingale after the manner of Juan de Alcega. Moving from this Spanish tailor's pattern to a properly-shaped farthingale.
description_web: Building a farthingale after the manner of Juan de Alcega. Moving from this Spanish tailor's pattern to a properly-shaped farthingale. We will examine how his description translates into skirt pieces that fit together by tacking miniature fabric models together.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Pregnancy and Midwifery in the Norse World
description_book: The *hjelpekone* ("helping woman", i.e., midwife) magically, as well as physically, helped the mother through pregnancy and giving birth.
description_web:
Pregnancy and midwifery in the Norse world: the *hjelpekone* (helping woman) was a critical
member of society, and it was she who would magically, as well as physically, help the mother
bring forth a healthy child. She would provide advice during pregnancy so that the child would
be healthy, and also during early infancy. She could recognize magical attacks and deal with
them.

name: Beyond Thunderdome
description_book: Tournaments hold a special place in SCA culture. Come learn how math and SCA culture create the structures and rules of how we run tournaments.
description_web: The combatants clash, the marshals watch, the heralds cry, and the populace cheers. Tournaments in the SCA involve a lot of moving parts. Come step behind the M.O.L. table and see how the people working behind the scenes coordinate the who-fights-whom in some of our grandest spectacles. This class is for anyone who wants to know more about how tournaments work, from combatants who want a competitive edge, to members of the populace who just want a good view of the fighting.
fee_itemization: printing

name: *Tables*
description_book: *Tables* (also called *Nard, Imperial*, and a dozen other names) is the ancestor of modern backgammon. Come learn the rules and play a game.

name: Advanced *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block-working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block-working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
fee_itemization: materials

name: Drumming for European Dance
description_book: Learn the basics every drummer should know about basic European rhythms and tempos, and communicating with musicians and dancers.
description_web: Whether you're a new drummer, an experienced musician new to drumming, or an experienced drummer new to Renaissance dance music, this class has something for you. We'll cover the basics of communicating with musicians and dancers, basic rhythms and appropriate tempos for Renaissance dance music, how to prevent things from going wrong, and how to handle it when things go wrong anyway. No drum or experience is necessary.

name: Viking Fun
description_book: Stop in and make a pair of Viking brooches to wear throughout War or build a longship to sail.

name: Using Common Name Sources
description_book: Examples on how to use some of the commonly used name sources used by heralds to document names.

name: Renaissance Slasher Movie: The Revenger's Tragedy
description_book: Let's talk about this over-the-top revenge drama! This class is a facilitated discussion of the play and its place in Renaissance pop culture.
description_web:
Let's talk about this over-the-top revenge drama! If you thought that Renaissance drama was stuffy or refined, you have a big surprise in store. This play starts with a man holding the skull of his poisoned girlfriend while he plots revenge on the lecherous duke who murdered her for turning him down, and it only gets more extreme from there. Middleton gives us a play with all the revenge you can handle, full of sex, betrayal, deceit, poison, stabbing, and gore. This class is a facilitated discussion of the play, its treatment of revenge, and its place in Renaissance pop culture. Knowledge of the play is not absolutely necessary, but students should ideally have read the text. (Available in paperback or epub from the New Mermaids line at Bloomsbury publishing. A free electronic copy of the play is available at http://www.tech.org/~cleary/reven.html )

Parental guidance suggested for children under 16.

name: History of Painted Cloth and Printed Textiles
description_book: A discussion with extant examples of the making and use of painted cloth and printed textiles in the Middle Ages.
description_web: A discussion with extant examples of the making and use of painted cloth and printed textiles in the Middle Ages. Documenting the spread of textile painting and printing from the Far East into Europe: the methods, the materials, the extant examples and the confusion. Please join Facebook group: Printed Textiles in the Middle Ages.

location: Denys The Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp  EO8)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: Daily meetings for those in any 12-step program such as AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: We welcome all in AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc., who are in any 12-step program to the 4:00 pm daily meeting at EO8 Denys The Decadent's Camp.

name: Multiplayer Table Games
description_book: Four- and seven-player backgammon will be taught depending on attendance. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.
description_web: Four- and seven-player backgammon will be taught depending on attendance. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.

location: Orluk Oasis (W10, on the lake near the peninsula.)
name: Intro to Egyptian-Style Group Improvisation
description_book: Learn Tribal Odyssey: Egyptian-based improvisational tribal-style with *beledi*-style combinations.
description_web: Rajni is a Certified Level 1 Tribal Odyssey dance leader, a group improvisational style developed by Kawakib of Fredericksburg, VA. In the words of Kawakib: “Tribal Odyssey uses natural posture and both sides of the body in combinations based primarily on Egyptian *beledi*-style movement. It's versatile enough to adapt to any size group.” Class will repeat to allow for several days of practice with a group, and will incorporate recorded Middle Eastern drumming as well as live music/drumming as available. Learn moves that you and your dance friends can use at Pennsic haflas this year! Class will be taught in Orluk Oasis. Stay for refreshments and conversation after!

name: Troubadours and *Trouvères*
description_book: Introduction to the music of the troubadours and *trouvères* covering literature/resources. Emphasis on performance style and musical accompaniment.
description_web: An introduction to the music of the troubadours and *trouvères* covering literature and resources for further research. Heavy emphasis on performance style and musical accompaniment.

name: Period Shoes for Armored Combat
description_book: We will cover period footwear suitable for SCA armored combat, along with some modifications to complement their use in this function.
fee_itemization: The fee is to cover the cost of printing for the handout.

name: Æthelmearc Scribal College Open Scriptorium
description_book: Open time at the Scribal tents for people who need to work on scrolls or want to consult with experienced scribes and teachers. Use the side gate.
description_web: Open time at the Scribal tents for people who need to work on scrolls or want to consult with experienced scribes and teachers. Use the side gate. We will have tables, chairs, good lighting, and experienced scribes and teachers who can answer questions, help with any issues or direct you to where to get further information on most scribal topics.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: Open Dancing
description_book: Join us all evening for dancing by request. Open band! Musicians, please come have fun with us!
description_web:
Balls are fun, but what if you miss your favorite dance because you took too long getting ice cream after dinner? Come to open dancing, and request it! (Period dances, please, during official hours.)

Musicians! We are happy to have you join the open band tonight. "Pennsic Pile" compilations will be available.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Coffee with Friends of Dr Bob and Bill
description_book: Morning open meeting for those in recovery.
description_web: Morning open meeting for those in recovery.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off-line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Armored Combat Morning Session
description_book: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.
description_web: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.

name: Irish *Brehon* Law
description_book: Irish law principles to include details on honor price, injury, sick maintenance, rights of women.
description_web: Irish law principles to include details on honor price, injury, sick maintenance, rights of women. Examples of the application of the law in traditional Gaelic Ireland. Details on where to find information on the law tracts and the sort of research they can support.

name: Glass Cutting (and Basic Design) STS1
description_book: Learn to cut glass or improve your technique in glass design basics. This is **required** for the "Sheet to Shiny" track. Wear closed-toed shoes!
description_web: You can't design a stained glass piece until you know how glass "thinks". So whether or not you have glass-cutting experience, you can further your skills by taking this class! Wear closed-toed shoes, please. This is a rolling-style class, meaning it **will not** take every person 1.5 hours, but, as there are only 2 of us, and we have limited cutters and tools, each person will get about 10 minutes of one-on-one time to learn how to cut glass. This class is **required** for the Stained Glass Track ("Sheet to Shiny") being offered this year.
fee_itemization: Offsets the glass cut up during class.

name: Embroidery: How Do I Do That!?!
description_book: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Come out and learn a few easy stitches!
description_web: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Do you want to decorate your garb or projects but aren't sure where to start? Come learn a few easy stitches. See some examples of basic embroidery projects. Sample fabric, needle and thread provided. Please bring scissors and a small embroidery hoop if you have them. Strict limit of 10 students! Handouts will be given to everyone but kits and hands-on teaching will be limited to 10.
fee_itemization:
Embroidery floss
Needles
Hoops
Sample fabric

name: Twelve Plants through the Ages: Year 2
description_book: Follow twelve plants through time from Celsus to the modern day. How plants were used for medicine in period, and how that is supported today.
description_web: Follow twelve plants through time from Celsus to the modern day. What plants were used medicinally in period, and which of these uses have been proven by contemporary science. I am covering 12 plants this year, and plan additional material in following years. This is a historical overview of uses, and does not constitute medical advice.
fee_itemization: Handout costs $3.

name: The Kingdom of Zion in Muenster of 1534
description_book: A lesson on the fascinating story of the spectacular rise and fall of Muenster, Germany, after it was taken over by a radical sect of Anabaptists.
description_web: A lesson on the fascinating story of the spectacular rise and fall of Muenster, Germany, after it was taken over by a radical sect of Anabaptists. Learn about the many controversial religious and social changes made within the city, as well as the *Landsknecht* participation on both sides of the siege. The results of the punishment of the radical leaders can be seen to this day.

name: Open Knit
description_book: Stuck on a project, need help understanding a pattern or just want to knit and chat with others? Come and join a knitter's circle.

name: Printing Textiles: Blocks, Stencils, and Freehand
description_book: Creating the textile effect you want with paint. **Extensive** materials list. Please join https://www.facebook.com/groups/PrintedTextilesPennsic
description_web: We will combine block printing with stencils and freehand to create the textile effect you want with paint. **Extensive** materials list. Please join https://www.facebook.com/groups/PrintedTextilesPennsic

name: Dungiven Doublet
description_book: A doublet so simple even a fencer can make it. Learn about this 1590s Irish exemplar, how to make it, and the theories behind its construction.
fee_itemization: Handout

name: Palmistry
description_book: Palmistry was practiced throughout period, and you can learn to read palms well enough in one hour to start immediately.
description_web: From the Egyptians throughout SCA period, palm reading has been practiced in most cultures. Although years of study add more details, you can quickly learn enough of the basic skills to read (well enough that you'll probably be mobbed with requests). We'll cover a bit of history, but mostly this is "hands-on" learning about hand reading.
fee_itemization: handout optional, free further reading sheet

name: Ten Things To Know about Medieval Books of Hours
description_book: What was a Book of Hours? What are these small books in saint's hands, on effigies and in manuscripts? This class will give you the basics.
description_web: What was a Book of Hours? We see these small books in saint's hands, and on effigies and in manuscripts. They are given in wills and as love tokens and wedding presents. But what are they? This class will give you the basics about Books of Hours and help you understand a little bit more about what you are seeing in medieval religious art and sculpture.
fee_itemization: Optional handout.

name: Closing Your Clothes
description_book: Survey of period clothing closures and how to use them. Covers antiquity to 1600, and all the cultures that I have time for.
description_web: Survey of period clothing closures and how to use them. Covers antiquity to 1600, and all the cultures that I have time for. Includes information on where to purchase these items. I will pass around actual closures and demonstrate their use.
fee_itemization: $3 for handout

name: Beaded Daisy
description_book:
Make a daisy in the style of beaded flowers of 15th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please 
bring them to class.
description_web:
Make a daisy in the style of beaded flowers of 15th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please 
bring them to class. Not recommended for youth. Take the Rose class first; this is a more advanced technique.
fee_itemization: beads, wire

name: Medieval Mustards and Sauces
description_book: Come try and taste a variety of mustards and sauces prepared from recipes from medieval times.
description_web: Taste a variety of mustards and sauces prepared from recipes within our period.

name: Wire and Cold Metal Work
description_book: This is a hands-on demonstration class that teaches wire working and other cold metal work techniques.
description_web: This is a hands-on demonstration class that teaches wire working and other cold metal work techniques.

name: Thumb Ring Archery
description_book: Learn how to shoot like a Mongol. Requires a horse bow and arrows at least 4" longer than your finger draw. Some rings will be available for sale.
description_web: Learn to shoot the way Mongols and other steppes and horse archers did. Lord Naran Numuchi, Bow Khan of the Great Dark Horde, Companion of the Order of the Yew Bow (Atlantia), Ponte Alto Baronial Marshal, and many times Archery Champion, has been shooting thumb ring since 1998, and has focused on the use and history of static-eared recurve bows the whole time. High quality stainless steel thumb rings will be available for sale

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: Sticks & string

name: Build a Bellows for Your Camp Fire
description_book: Each student will build a functional camp fire bellows from the provided materials.
description_web: Students will build a working set of bellows that can be used for their camp fire. Each student will be provided the needed materials, and the use of patterns and tools to make their bellows.
