Basic knowledge of arms design is helpful, but not really necessary, and we can also talk about how to narrow down the many options to make it easier for you. We’ll talk about the style of our period and what best passes with the SCA College of Arms.

name: Harassment and the SCA: A Guided Discussion
description_book: Roundtable discussion and brainstorming session: how harassment can manifest and official and unofficial options for handling it in an SCA context.
description_web: With increasing social awareness of the difficulties harassment can pose within a social group, an organization as diverse and widespread as the SCA has seen its share of incidents. This is a guided discussion and brainstorming session intended to increase understanding of the issue, hear what individual branches are doing about it, and share ideas and options that can help increase affirmative support and knowledge of the options available to branches and event staff.

name: Perfect Medieval Spindle and Distaff
description_book: Match a spindle and distaff to your persona and time period in Western Europe. Lecture; limited hands-on.
description_web: Match a spindle and distaff to your persona and time period in Western Europe. See the different types of removable whorl spindles and distaves (hand, waist & floor) and learn which goes with which. Early period (Roman/Viking), Middle Ages up to Early Modern. **Not a beginner’s class**; some spinning experience expected for hands-on. Students may bring their own spindles, distaves & wool if desired. Kits as well as loaners are available for very brief hands-on experience in class. Mixed lecture and hands-on.
fee_itemization:
2.00 for paper copies.
15.00 dollars for wood spindle and removable pottery whorl (seconds) along with small amount of spinning wool.

name: Plausibly Period: Gluten-Free in the Middle Ages
description_book: Discover surprising history about celiac disease and gluten-free food and how to easily incorporate it into feasts. Recipes and samples to taste!
description_web: Discover some surprising history about celiac disease and gluten-free dining. Then learn how easy it is to incorporate gluten-free selections into your feasts that everyone will love. Recipes will be available and there will be samples to taste! All are welcome!

name: Keyboards Before 1600: Instruments and Repertoire
description_book: In this class we'll listen to recordings of period keyboards, as well as look at facsimiles of keyboard intabulations.
description_web: In this class we'll explore European keyboard instruments and their repertoire in the Middle Ages and Renaissance. We'll listen to recordings of period keyboards and look at facsimiles of keyboard intabulations. If there is time and interest, we'll discuss how to read period notation for keyboard music. In particular we'll look at the *German Keyboard Tablature of the Buxheimer Organ Book* and the notation in Attaignant's intabulations of chansons.

name: Period Egyptian Necklace
description_book: We will create a period Egyptian necklace that can be counted as the basis of most seed beads necklaces in history.
fee_itemization:
Print Handout and scheme
Seed beads
Metal beads
Clea beads
Connectors
Threads

name: I Wanna Help at Events but They Say I'm Too Young!
description_book: (YouthU, 11-15) Having trouble getting involved with events because of your age? Learn what you can do and how to offer your help.
description_web: (YouthU, 11-15) Having trouble getting involved with events because of your age? Sometimes adults need a little help figuring out how youth can assist them! Here’s your chance to learn what you can do and how to offer to do it. We will talk about different kinds of events and the various activities they offer, with a focus on how youth in the “tween” age bracket can provide service and participate. Attendees will have a chance to share their ideas and experiences, and there will be a handout with ideas (and room for notes!) to take home.

name: Landed Baronesses and Barons: A Roundtable
description_book: Considering running for Baron or Baroness? Is your group considering going Barony? What does it all mean? Come join our discussion!
description_web: For Baronies - and any group considering going Barony - there exist roles which are covered by no handbook, training is often minimal, and there are no deputies allowed. Landed Barons and Baronesses are as different as the groups they represent and, while we in the East have House Runnymede, which consists of all current Landed Barons and Baronesses, we may be uncommon in that regard. Come with your traditions, perceptions, expectations, ideas *and* an open mind, to consider how others might see or do the job themselves. This isn't limited to current territorials; former and potential Baronesses and Barons; all are welcome!

name: Viking Navigation
description_book: This class will present at least two of the methods of direction-finding seen in the Viking TV series.
description_web: The methods of navigation employed by the Viking navigators are currently unverifiable by archeological evidence. However, the search for answers goes on. This class will present the arguments for at least two methods of direction-finding by experts in the field. The published findings of Soren Thirslund from the Danish National Maritime Museum and Leif Karlsen, a retired merchant marine navigator will be presented. Both of these gentlemen’s published findings are internationally recognized and available from the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde Denmark. Hands-on demonstrations and primary source documentation of these authors’ navigation theories.
fee_itemization: Handout of information and basic documentation for how the navigation methods work.

name: Frying Pan Breads and Pastries
description_book: A demonstration of two period flatbread recipes and two period pastry recipes, all of which can be made in a frying pan over your campfire.
description_web: A demonstration of two period flatbread recipes and two period pastry recipes, all of which can be made in a frying pan over your campfire. The flatbreads are 10th-century Middle Eastern and 16th-century Mughal; the pastries are both 13th-century Maghrebi.

name: Build a Crossbow for 25 Bucks
description_book: If you bring 25 bucks, you can walk out with a crossbow that you made with hand tools and a drill. This is an actual crossbow for use on the range.
description_web: If you bring 25 bucks, you can walk out with a crossbow that you made with hand tools and a drill. This is an actual crossbow for use on the range. It will be ugly, but you can make it pretty or change it later now that you know how this works.
fee_itemization: Wood, Screws, Crossbow Prod

name: *Commedia* for Beginners
description_book: A beginner's class on *commedia dell'arte*, introducing the history of *commedia*, the stock characters, and semi-improvisational medieval comedy.
description_web: A beginner's class on *commedia dell'arte*, introducing the history of *commedia*, the stock characters, and semi-improvisational medieval comedy.

name: Beginning *Atlatl*
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively.

name: Women Can't Read-Debunk'd: A Sleeping Pen Awakened
description_book: Women's literacy between 1400-1600 was a much contested (and complicated) concept. This class examines how women interacted with texts.
description_web: Literacy does not mean the same thing today that it meant 500 years ago, and this change is more complicated when gender enters the picture. We will examine women's literacy between 1400-1600, and will examine women who wrote, men and women who wrote about women writing, and the distinction between women reading and women writing.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magick.
description_web: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.
fee_itemization: There's a free handout, and a bigger optional "manual" available.

name: Italian Dances from the German Letter
description_book: Come learn some dances from Italy in 1517 via a letter home by a German traveler.
description_web: Come learn some dances from Italy in 1517 via a letter home by a German traveler. Some of these dances are found in earlier sources but are interestingly different here.

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a narrow strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a narrow strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Class limited to 5 looms. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: cards & string

name: Knitting in the 16th Century: An Overview
description_book: Not only is hand-knitting period, the 16th century has a wealth of items to choose from. We'll look at a wide range of caps, gloves, and hosen.
description_web: Not only is hand-knitting period, the 16th century has a wealth of items to choose from. We'll look at a wide range of caps, gloves, and hosen. Interested in Eleanora of Toledo's stockings? I was the first to publish the pattern!
fee_itemization: I have a handout with extensive bibliography.

name: Ships in the SCA Period: A Chronological Overview
description_book: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.
description_web: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.

name: Modern Media & the SCA: Making Them Work Together
description_book: How to connect with modern media to share the SCA on a larger scale and provide a good story for the news.
description_web: Reaching people who are interested in the SCA can be difficult; reaching a large number at once even more so. In this class, Æthelmearc Media Liaison and broadcast journalist Lord Arias Beltran del Valle discusses how to reach out to modern media and share activities and events with them, while also adhering to Society media policies, as well as what to do (and not to do!) when the media arrives at an event. Included in the discussion will be suggestions on how to make an event more interesting to news outlets. We'll touch on rights given to the reporters and to participants. We'll also discuss who should be involved in preparations for meeting the media at an event, and how to present the best face for your group!

name: 14th-Century Decorative Hair Pins
description_book: Learn to make 14th-century decorative brass hairpins. First 10 in class will get materials to make 1 hairpin. More info available online.
description_web: Learn to make 14th-century decorative brass hairpins. First 10 in class will get materials to make 1 hairpin. If you want to bring your own materials, bring one piece of 8" long, 12- or 13-gauge brass wire, one piece of 36" long 26-gauge brass wire, and a needle-nose pliers.
fee_itemization:
Alys: Added hyphens. Used comma in place of colon. No fee for materials??
Alys: Changed "Learn and" to "Learn to."

name: Wee Scadians: Find them, Keep Them!
description_book: How to recruit and maintain families with children in your local group, and what to do once you have them!
description_web: Youth and families are essential to the future (and present!) of the SCA. This class will discuss how to recruit and maintain families with children in your local group, and what to do with them once you have them! Children's Activities are fun and all, but there are so many things beyond that to be done to keep children (and their parents) happy, engaged, and excited about their future in the Society. Come get some pointers from a Youth Officer and SCA parent, and bring your own ideas to share! (Children are welcome to attend, and will have their own quiet activity to do during class.)

name: *Fabliaux* or Tavern Tales
description_book: A discussion of the rhyming tales used to entertain common people in taverns and gatherings as a means of livelihood for a common traveling bard.
description_web: A discussion of period French and English metrical tales. These tales varied in length taking from five minutes to an hour or more to tell. The content was usually a comic, frankly coarse, and often cynical tale in verse popular in period, especially during the 12th and 13th centuries. The themes often made fun of the clergy and upper classes and were designed to entertain the low-born. Presentation of these tales to common men and women in taverns and public gatherings was probably a means for a common traveling bard to maintain a livelihood, earning a meal and a place to sleep while traveling from village to village. Excerpts and examples will be presented. The content of some of the pieces is sexually suggestive or implies morally corrupt behavior.

name: Embossing Metal, a Simplified Kind of  *Repoussé*
description_book: (YouthU Ages 11-14) We will do a simplified version of *repoussé*, which is pushing out a picture in a piece of metal.
description_web: (YouthU Ages 11-14) Using metal foil and wooden tools, we will make a picture by embossing a picture in the metal. This class is geared for children. When we are done we will patina the metal to show contrast.
fee_itemization: 2 pieces of metal foil to emboss,  use of tools, and supplies

name: Great Military Blunders and the Lessons They Teach
description_book: Never get involved in a land war in Asia! A survey of the causes and effects of military fiascoes from classical antiquity to the Elizabethan age.
description_web: Never get involved in a land war in Asia! A survey of the causes and effects of military fiascoes from classical antiquity to the Elizabethan age. Special attention will be paid to the foibles of the Roman Republic and Empire, as well as the Hundred Years' War.

name: Iron *Commedia*: Creating a New 16th-Century Play
description_book: Join actors from your favorite improvisational *commedia dell'arte* troupes to craft, cast, perform, & premier a brand-new play in just one afternoon!
description_web: If you've ever laughed at the zany antics of improvisational *commedia dell'arte*, join members from your favorite troupes to craft, cast, and perform a brand-new *commedia* play in just one afternoon with its world premier at at Pennsic that same day! Two sessions, two performances, one each week. Find a mask, put it on, and see what happens!

name: Shimmy Lab, aka Butt-Wiggling, 101-4
description_book: Explore the exciting variations and dynamics of the shimmy. This drill class will get you moving, sweating and thinking.

name: Body Mechanics for Beginning/Intermediate Dancers
description_book: All levels welcome! A survey of nonverbal cues and body mechanics to enhance everyone's dance experience. We'll learn a dance along the way!

name: Multiplayer Table Games
description_book: Four- and seven-player backgammon will be taught depending on attendance. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.
description_web: Four- and seven-player backgammon will be taught depending on attendance. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
fee_itemization: materials

name: *Khaliji* Choreography
description_book: Learn a women's *Khaliji* (Gulf) dance choreographed by Kay Hardy Campbell to *Warene*, a song by the Miami (Kuwati) Band. *Thobes* not provided.
description_web: Learn a women's *Khaliji* (Gulf) dance choreographed by Kay Hardy Campbell to *Warene*, a song by the Miami (Kuwati) Band. *Thobes* not provided.

name: Vocal Techniques for Singers and Storytellers
description_book: Give your voice greater strength, better control, expanded range and color, and more energy. Tips and tricks to improve your entertaining voice!
fee_itemization: $1.00 contribution to keep the handout will be greatfuly accepted

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater: Open Youth Rehearsal
description_book: Youth Readers' Theatre gives youth (ages 8-14) an opportunity to experience being in a low-stress theatre production, *A Bag Full of Fables*.
description_web: Known World Players, Youth Readers' Theatre, will give the youth (ages 8-14) an opportunity to experience a low-stress theatre experience by creating a staged reading of *A Bag Full of Fables* by Robert Lehan. A staged reading means that the actors will be performing the play with the script in hand. No audition necessary; attend both rehearsals. To be performed Friday, 8/4, in the Performing Arts Tent at 6:00 pm. Children under 12, please bring a parent or guardian.

name: Intro to *Kanzashi* Flowers
description_book: This is an introductory class in making basic *Kanzashi* Flower traditional hair ornaments worn in Geisha hair styles.
description_web: This is an introductory class in making basic 6-petal *Kanzashi* Flowers traditional hair ornaments worn in Geisha hair styles. Each student will be provided with all necessary pre-prepared materials necessary to complete their very own *Kanzashi* Flower in this class.
fee_itemization: All necessary pre-prepared materials necessary to complete a 6 petal Kanzashi Flower in the traditional style.  All necessary tools will be provided.

name: Beginning to Drum Solo: *Malfuf, Syrto, Chifti*
description_book: An intro to the beginnings of solo techniques for *Malfuf, Syrto*, and *Chiftitelli* rhythms. An intermediate class, but all levels welcome.
description_web: An intro to the beginnings of solo techniques for *Malfuf, Syrto*, and *Chiftitelli* rhythms. An intermediate class, but all levels (including beginners) welcome.

name: Crumhorn Appreciation Society
description_book: Crumhorn and other soft wind cap instrumental jam. Repertoire determined by level of attendees. Some instruments available to borrow.
description_web: An hour of crumhorn playing! All soft wind cap instruments (cornemuses, kelhorns, etc.) are welcome. Repertoire will be determined by the level of the attendees. Some instruments will be available to borrow for those with prior recorder experience.

name: Discovering a Calligraphic Hand That Suits You
description_book: Learn a hand that matches your own personal handwriting. Pens, inks, and paper will be available.
description_web: A hand that matches your personal handwriting is easier to learn and more enjoyable to practice. We will explore and experiment.

name: Making a Hare Net
description_book: We will apply the ancient technique of knotting to the creation of a purse net that is used in Europe to catch large rabbits or hares.
description_web: We will apply the ancient technique of knotting to the creation of a purse net that is used in Europe to catch large rabbits or hares. Use of the net will be explained, as well as the use of the netting knot for other applications such as fishing nets, corrals, hair nets, and lacis fabric. Kits will be available for purchase or you can bring your own. Do not bring netting needles/spacers for hair nets, as the scale is too small.
fee_itemization: netting kit  - estimate

name: Heraldic Customer Service
description_book: How to be a better local officer/consultation herald with a few, relatively painless, changes.
description_web: Are you a new herald? Are you an extra-crispy herald? Either way, come hear about ways to better serve your group with a few simple changes in how you see the office.

name: Block Printing 101
description_book: Using a combination of modern materials and period techniques, play with the decorative technique of block printing fabric. Wear "messy" clothes.
description_web: Using a combination of modern materials and period techniques, play with the decorative technique of block printing fabric. We'll look at period techniques and examples, and get a chance to work with period-style blocks. Wear "messy" clothes; this class involves dyes and inks.
fee_itemization:
Dye
Towels
Pad supplies

name: With These Knots I Bind My Camp
description_book: You will learn to master a very few knots that will meet almost every need you may have in camp - or double your money back!
description_web: Before cordless drills and screws, before plentiful cheap nails, even before glue, there was knotted cord holding our lives together. Sadly, most of us barely know how to tie even two or three knots. My guarantee: You will learn to master a small handful of knots that will meet almost every need you may have in camp - or double your money back!

name: The Basics Of Leather-Working: Getting Started
description_book: Interested in leather-working but not sure how to begin? What tools do I need? Choose the right leather for your project. We'll learn all that here!
description_web: Interested in leather-working but not sure how to begin? What tools do I need? Choose the right leather for your project. We'll learn all that here!
fee_itemization: $1.00 per handout for printing costs.

name: Gift-Giving to Royalty
description_book: What is good and not so good to give to seated royalty plus preparing gifts for royalty to give out. Largesse class should be taken first.

name: Performance and Written Work Documentation for A&S
description_book: How to get started with documentation. Elements to consider when documenting your historical performance or historically-based written work.
description_web: Documenting a performance or original written work is challenging. Judging sheets do not always help with what you need to document. “Materials” and other terms are ethereal concepts in a performance or written work! Elements to consider when documenting your historical performance or historically based written work will be discussed.

name: Soap in a Bottle! DIY Hard Soap for Soapballs, &c.
description_book: Use a 2-liter soda bottle to safely make small amounts of cold process olive oil & lye soap without having to invest in fancy equipment.
description_web: Use a 2-liter soda bottle to safely make small amounts of cold process olive oil & lye soap without having to invest in fancy equipment. Basic modern and medieval soap-making will be discussed, as well as how to make period scented soap balls. (If you have access to bottles with lids, please bring to class.) Due to the use of potentially harmful chemicals, the class is only open to people who follow instructions well (no kids)! Each participant will leave with a bar of soap in a bottle.
fee_itemization: For ingredients to make soap, including lye, olive oil, bottles.

name: Period Greek Make-and-Take
description_book: Bring 4-6 yards of linen and 4-6 yards of cord, matching thread, needle, and scissors and learn to hem, drape, and tie it into accurate Greek garb!
description_web: Bring 4-6 yards of linen and 4-6 yards of cord, matching thread, needle, and scissors and learn to hem, drape, and tie it into accurate Greek garb! This make-and-take will create a perfect wardrobe staple for Pennsic. We will discuss other variations that are accurate, affordable, and beautiful. Perfect to pair with the "Are You Wearing a Tablecloth?" class.

name: Midrealm Epay System Training
description_book: Required training to use the Midrealm Epay System. The group Exchequer and Reservationist must take this training before using the system.
description_web: Required training to use the Midrealm Epay System. The group Exchequer and Reservationist must take this training before using the system to accept credit card payments for an event.

name: A Taste of *Maghribi* and Andalusi Cuisine
description_book: Discussion, recipes & tastes from al-Andalus and al-Maghrib, based on two 13th-C. Andalusi cookbooks, *Fadalat al-Khiwan* and "Anonymous Andalusian".
description_web: Discussion of the cuisines of al-Andalus and al-Maghrib, based on two surviving 13th-C. Andalusi cookbooks, the so-called "Anonymous Andalusian" cookbook, and my translation of the *Fudalat al-khiwan fi tayibat al-ta'am wa al-alwan* ("Delights of the Table, the Best Foods & Dishes") by Ibn Razin al-Tujibi. Handout will include recipes, and I will bring a few dishes to sample.
fee_itemization: For photocopying and purchasing ingredients for food

name: The Very New Persona
description_book: You're brand, spanking new, and you don't know who you want to be? No worries! I'll talk through good starting points, and then we just chat. Relax!
description_web: You're brand, spanking new, and you don't know who or what you want to be? No worries! I'll talk through common considerations and good starting points for information. After we go through the basics, we just chat about our thoughts. Relax! It's not supposed to be work!

name: From the Mind of a Bored Drummer (Even + Odd = ?!)
description_book: What happens when you combine an odd and even rhythm into one new one? Learn a couple of new rhythms or share your own combinations. BYOD.
description_web: What happens when you take an odd-count rhythm and mash it with an even-count rhythm? Sometimes you get a train wreck, sometimes you get a moment of brilliance! Come and learn a couple of new rhythms I created or bring your own to share. Bring Your Own Drum.

name: Less Familiar ECD Dances
description_book: We'll cover dances such as *Gelding the Devil, Adson's Saraband, Broome*, and *Chelsea Reach*.

name: Card Games: Tarot
description_book: Tarot cards are used in games as well as divination. Come and learn the rules and join in a fun, easy game.

name: Recorder Consort: 15th- and 16th-Century Music
description_book: Come make beautiful music in good company! Session for intermediate and above recorder players comfortable with sight-reading. Sheet music provided.
description_web: Come play an assortment of Renaissance pieces in good company! This group playing session is geared for intermediate and above recorder players who are comfortable with their instruments and with sight-reading. Bring your recorders and a stand. Sheet music will be provided; feel free to bring your own favorites (in multiple copies, please).

name: Family Stick Weaving
description_book: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.
description_web: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian. Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Fee covers sticks and string; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: Sticks & string

name: Best of the Knowne Worlde Rapier Tourney
description_book: Come one, come all! Come watch the best of the best fight! Open only to those with a grant level rapier award, MoD, knights, and Masters of Arms.

name: Non-European Chainmail
description_book: Intro class to non-European chainmail. Bring your own tools. Materials provided.
description_web: Intro class to non-European chainmail. Bring your own tools. Limit of 5 participants. Materials provided. $10 materials fee.
fee_itemization: Hand turned & cut enameled copper rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter; sufficient to complete class project

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn how to throw axes, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit: 25 participants. No experience needed.

name: *Shūji*: Taking the Brush - Japanese Calligraphy
description_book: A hands-on introduction to Japanese calligraphy for official documents. Please bring large bamboo writing brushes and ink stones if you have them.
description_web: A hands-on introduction to designing and executing Japanese official documents. This class will introduce the role of the scribe in imperial and military governments. Epistolatory style and the structure of official documents will be introduced. Participants will learn about the evolution of character styles and how documents were attested. We will also discuss paper and signature seals. The bulk of the class will consist of a hands-on calligraphy class similar to those held in Tokyo. Please bring large bamboo writing brushes, ink stones, paper weights, and *hanshi*-size felt mats if you have them. There will be limited loaner supplies of all of these available at class. Paper and ink is included in the class materials fee.
fee_itemization:
Covers production cost of the handout. I have been advised to include a handout for this class.

Cost of paper and ink

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.
fee_itemization: materials

name: Two Capon and a Lentil Recipe from the *Banchetti*
description_book: Capon in onions; capon in broth with prunes, cherries, garlic; and fennel stalks, bread crumbs, sour grape juice, spices, herbs, and lentils in sauce.
description_web: A capon cooked in good rich rich broth with quartered onions, a piece of prosciutto ham, a pinch of lard, and minced parsley. A capon browned in lard then boiled with good broth with prunes, cherries, garlic cloves, and stalks of fennel, toasted bread crumbs soaked in sour grape juice, spices, pounded herbs in oil. A lentil dish with raisins, toasted bread crumbs soaked in red wine and a small amount of vinegar, honey, ground true cinnamon, and pepper.

name: *Klosterstich* and Bayeux Tapestry Stitch
description_book: *Klosterstitch* and Bayeux Tapestry embroidery stitches were used to create wool decorative hangings from the 11th to 16th centuries.
description_web:
*Klosterstitch* and Bayeux Tapestry embroidery stitches were used to create wool decorative hangings from the 11th to 16th centuries. The Bayeux Tapestry stitch produces a firmer and more dense design. The *Klosterstitch* is not as dense and more appropriate for hangings or other items that won't see significant wear. 

Some experience with embroidery is very useful. Please bring your favorite scissors and a hoop. A few will be available to borrow. Also a portable light source if you find it useful in the possibly dark tent. The kit will contain fabric, wool, needles, and handout.
fee_itemization: Kit will contain fabric, wool, needles, and handout. Please bring your favorite scissors and a hoop. A few will be available to borrow. Also a portable light source if you find it useful.

name: A Damaged Defence
description_book: A roundtable discussion for fencers with disabilities or physical challenges. How have you learned to adapt? Open to all.

name: Irish Language 101
description_book: The Irish language: pronunciation, basic grammar, introductions, counting, ask and answer questions, how to be polite.
description_web: Basic introduction to the Irish language (modern, sorry, not ancient). Learn pronunciation and grammar rules, pronouns and vocabulary, how to introduce yourself and tell someone where you are from, how to count and tell time, how to ask and answer simple questions, and how to politely say a few phrases like "please" and "thank you".

name: Spoken Latin
description_book: An introduction to basic conversational Classical Latin and grammar. Oral participation optional, but strongly encouraged.
description_web: An introduction to basic conversational Classical Latin and grammar. Oral participation optional, but strongly encouraged.

name: Babies at Pennsic: A Discussion
description_book: How to deal with babies and small children at Pennsic: a discussion by and for those who have done it, are doing it, or will do it.

name: North African Wrapped Dresses
description_book: Learn to wrap yourself like a North African woman. Also useful for Celts, Vikings and Romans!
description_web: This class will cover women's *Maghribi* wrapped dresses, and examine the similarities and differences with other people who wore this style, including Romans, Celts, and VIkings. We will also look at accompanying undergarments and accessories. If you want to be wrapped up before you go, bring 5-6 yards of light linen or cotton fabric, 55-60" wide. You will also need a belt or rope, and two very large safety pins, brooches, or kilt pins.
fee_itemization: handouts

name: Building a Household: An Oldcastle Model
description_book: There are many kinds of households in the Society. We will discuss several of them, focusing primarily on Clan Oldcastle, the one I know best.

name: Whose Partner Am I Anyway?
description_book: Why settle for one when you can have both? Three fun, flirty, and fickle Playford dances: *Rufty Tufty, Heart's Ease*, and *Cuckolds All in a Row.*
description_web: Why settle for dancing with one partner when you can dance with both! Learn three fun, flirty, and fickle four-person Playford dances including *Rufty Tufty*, *Heart's Ease,* and *Cuckolds All in A Row.* Basic ECD steps will be reviewed. Beginner plus.

name: *Game of the Goose*
description_book: Period game in the style of *Chutes and Ladders*. We will review the rules and then play through a game, dice willing.
description_web: Period game in the style of *Chutes and Ladders*. The game is purely deterministic (dice-based) so it is suitable for children, but for adults it is often played with stakes to make repeated play more interesting. We will review the rules and then play through a game, dice willing.

name: Zill Dance from Start to Stage: 1 of 4
description_book: Learn a zill choreography to be performed at the Middle Eastern Dance Expo. Recommended for intermediate dancers who know zill basics.
description_web: Zills, or finger cymbals, add much to a performance. This class series will have the students learning a zill choreography with the option of performing it as a group at the Middle Eastern Dance Expo. Recommended for intermediate dancers who know zill basics as this class will move quickly through the choreography. Performance costuming should consist of a period or peri-oid coat worn over *salwar* or harem pants and a simple hip scarf or belt. Dancers must attend 3 of the 4 sessions including the final one in order to be eligible to perform.

name: Pennsic Technical Theater: Lights, Stage, Action!
description_book: Come and learn about the behind-the-scenes tech theater of the Performing Arts Tent: building the stage, rigging curtains, running lights, and more!
description_web: Come and learn about the behind-the-scenes tech theater of the Performing Arts Tent: building the stage, rigging curtains, running lights, and more! Useful class for those wanting to volunteer now or in the future for setup, strike, evening performances, and light re-sets.

name: Japanese Dyeing I: Setting Up a Dye Bath
description_book: How to set up a dye bath for the total beginner. Includes direct, mordanted, and vat dyes (gardenia, madder, and indigo).

name: Just a Little Sling
description_book: While we cannot sling weapons at Pennsic, this class will show the construction of a basic sling.

name: Begin Egyptian *Tabla* (*Doumbek*) with Donovan
description_book: Come and learn the basics of the Egyptian *tabla* (*doumbek*). We will work on basic techniques for getting great sounds out of your drum.
description_web: Come and learn the basics of the Egyptian *tabla* (*doumbek*). We will work on basic techniques for getting great sounds out of your drum.

name: Drawing Heraldic Art
description_book: Help out the heralds or become a herald! Also for scribes or anyone who wants to draw heraldry.
description_web: While this class is mostly for anyone who would like to help out the heralds or become a herald, it can help scribes or anyone who wants to draw heraldry.
fee_itemization: To help defray cost of handouts.

name: Espionage and Covert Action In the Elizabethan Age
description_book: A survey of Elizabeth's intelligence service, spymasters, codes, and night's black agents, as well as the litany of conspiracies and plots they faced!

name: Jewelry Demonstration: Etching Copper Alloys
description_book: Demo and lecture class. Intro to tools and techniques to etch copper, brass and nickel silver with ferric chloride. Various resists will be discussed.
description_web:
In this demonstration and lecture class you will be introduced to the tools and techniques used to etch copper, brass, and nickel silver with Ferric Chloride. Various resists will be discussed with an emphasis on heat transfer resists: PnP Blue and Toner Transfer Paper (TTP). You will be able to adapt these techniques to etch a wide variety of jewelry items, favors, largesse, coronets, belt elements that can be riveted on, armor decorations, scrolls, etc. 

Most of the techniques discussed can be used to etch fine silver and sterling silver using Ferric Nitrate.

The hand-out will be available on my website at: http://ga.crimsonkraken.com/metalSawing.html
fee_itemization: This is a demonstration class.

name: Getting to know the English Sonnet
description_book: We will cover some of the major poets and developments in the sonnet tradition and work through ways to read and comprehend sonnets more easily.
description_web: A brief overview of the development of the sonnet during the English Renaissance. Although moderns frequently identify Shakespeare with the sonnet form, he was far from the only sonneteer of the Renaissance or even the most well known. The course will cover some of the major poets and developments in the sonnet tradition and work through ways to read and comprehend sonnets more easily. We’ll read poems and talk about some conventions and tropes of the genre. No previous knowledge of sonnets or Renaissance England required. A handout will be provided.

name: Pennsic Without a Cooler
description_book: How to feed yourself period food at long camping events without the use of a cooler.

name: Make Your Own Medallion Cord
description_book: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, cord-making described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. OK to be late.
description_web: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, a method for cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. *Slung* is also known as Viking whip-cording. It is not only useful but a lot of fun for all ages. Can be done as a children's activity or at demos. Bring a friend! People will be taking turns on a limited number of set-ups. Showing up late is perfectly fine.

name: Advanced English Country Dance: *Step Stately*
description_book: From first edition Playford comes a challenging dance: *Step Stately.*

name: Morris Games
description_book: We will teach 3-Man Morris (similar to tic-tac-toe), Rota, 9-Man, and 12-Man Morris. The games range from simple to challenging.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
fee_itemization: Material

name: Introduction to Irish Frame Drum, the *Bodhrán*
description_book: Basic instruction in *bodhrán* including most-used rhythms, session etiquette. Bring a drum if you have one; some loaners available.
description_web: Learn how to choose and care for the *bodhrán*; what makes a good tipper; tune and set structure, how to identify and play jig, reel, hornpipe, slip jig, polka rhythms; etiquette; jokes. Learn secret arcane hand gestures to amaze and stun your listeners. Demonstration of how to adapt *bodhrán* drumming to period music. Bring a *bodhrán* if you have one. A few loaner drums will be available. Teens and older welcomed.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): ME&WDE Tech and Lighting Check
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Loom-Woven Pouch
description_book: Create a tabby-woven pouch on a one-piece loom.
description_web: Create a tabby-woven pouch on a one-piece loom. Class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: loom, string, needle

name: Japanese Dyeing II: Preparing the Fabric
description_book: Preparing fabric for dyeing and simple *shibori* tie-dye techniques. Bring your own small item to dye or purchase a handkerchief or scarf (optional).
fee_itemization: Handkerchief $1, silk scarf $5.

name: Hafla Songs for All Instruments by Lady Melissa!
description_book: New songs for haflas! Bring drum, zills, band or orchestra instruments! Sheet music available. *Habibi Ya Eini, Efem*, and more!
description_web: New songs for haflas! *Habibi Ya Eini, Efem, Qaddukal Mayas (Ada Sahilleri)* and more. Bring your drum, zills, band or orchestra instruments. Sheet music available to purchase. Let's make beautiful Middle Eastern music together.
fee_itemization: Sheet music and drum rhythm sheets

name: Youth Armored Combat Afternoon Session
description_book: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.
description_web: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.

name: Building Scrolls Without a Book of Hours
description_book: What? No Book of Hours? Yes! Learn how to use period artwork to build scrolls and break into a new area of creativity.

name: The Bliaut Revisited
description_book: Survey of what we know about the 12th-C garment known as the bliaut and suggestions for making it. Class includes hand-out with patterns.
description_web: Survey of what we know about the 12th-century garment known as the bliaut. Discussion of where we arrived at fallacies, and where to find better sources. Discussion and suggestions for recreating both men's and women's bliauts. Free hand-out with patterns.

name: How to Really Read a Poem: Poetic Scansion
description_book: An introduction to "scansion", the technical art of detecting a poem's structure and poetic techniques, for both poets and appreciative readers.
description_web: An introduction to "scansion", the technical art of detecting a poem's structure and poetic techniques, for both poets and appreciative readers. In this class we will discuss poetic devices such as meter, rhyme scheme, and alliteration, and learn how to mark a poem for better analysis of these techniques.

name: Making Couscous by Hand
description_book: Learn to make couscous by hand following a 13th-century North African recipe, using a method that hasn't changed in 8 centuries.
description_web: Fresh, hand-made couscous is very different from the instant stuff available at most grocery stores. The earliest documented couscous recipe dates from the 13th century and describes a process that is still followed in North Africa with very little change. We'll be following that recipe to make couscous from scratch. If all goes well, attendees will have some hand-made couscous to take with them at the end of the class. Limited to 10 hands-on participants, but others may come to watch.
fee_itemization: Pays for raw ingredients.

name: Pennsic Homes, Part 2: Tour
description_book: A tour of just a few the different types of Pennsic homes and other mobile structures. Lots of walking.
description_web: A tour of just a few the different types of Pennsic homes and other mobile structures. Lots of walking.

location: Denys The Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp  EO8)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: Daily meetings for those in any 12-step program such as AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: We welcome all in AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc., who are in any 12-step program to the 4:00 pm daily meeting at EO8 Denys The Decadent's Camp.

name: Japanese Dyeing III: Dyeing the Fabric
description_book: Simmer your fabric in the dye bath and learn about the Japanese dyes most commonly used in period.
fee_itemization: $1 handout, $1 handkerchief, $5 silk scarf.

name: Left-Handed Calligraphy
description_book: An introduction to the tools, techniques, and challenges for any left-handed calligrapher. Materials provided.

name: Archery Marshals Meeting
description_book: There will be two archery marshals meetings, the first on Friday, August 4, at 5 pm and second on Sunday, August 6, at 5 pm.
description_web: There will be two archery marshals meetings, the first on Friday, August 4, at 5 pm and second on Sunday, August 6, at 5 pm. All archery marshals should attend one of these meetings.

name: Learn to Read, Write, and Sing Byzantine Notation
description_book: Learn the basics of this simple but beautiful style of music notation used from early period to modern day. Music experience welcome but not required.
description_web: Master musician or *neume* newbie: This class is for everyone! See how a simple system can be used to depict relative and absolute pitch and learn how to translate some medieval and modern day "hits" into this beautiful style of notation.

name: Late Period Rounds
description_book: Come help sing through (or listen to) some late period rounds.

name: Iron *Commedia*: World Premiere
description_book: Earlier this same day, a group of foolish players came together to craft, cast, and create a brand-new "16th-century" *commedia dell'arte* play!
description_web: Earlier this same day, a group of foolish players came together to craft, cast, and create a brand new sixteenth-century *commedia dell'arte* play to premiere before your very eyes! Sorry, we can't give you a plot synopsis because we only just built the plot a few hours before the performance! Come see the zany foolishness in extremely live theatre! (And don't miss when we do it again on War Week Thursday!)  *Probably family-friendly but possibly some material inappropriate for very young children, but it's unknown until the play is crafted at the workshop earlier that day.*

name: Period Drinking Songs
description_book: Sing a variety of period songs about drinking from across Europe, including easy unison and rounds, as well as harmony with up to four parts.
description_web: Learn to sing a variety of period songs about consuming alcoholic beverages from across Europe. The songs vary in difficulty from easy unison and rounds to harmony with up to four parts, so anyone can participate. Music will be available to take with you. If you have heard of the Pennsic Drinking and Singing Walk or the *Hymni Bacchi*, this is the music we sing. This class might take place in a tent without chairs, so please consider bringing your own.

name: Youth Readers' Theater: *A Bag Full of Fables*
description_book: KWP Pennsic Youth Readers' Theater will perform a staged reading of *A Bag Full of Fables* by Robert Lehan.
description_web: Pennsic Youth Readers' Theatre will perform *A Bag Full of Fables* by Robert Lehan. This will be a script in-hand performance by the youth of Pennsic, ages 8-14. This type of performance does not have costumes, sets, or lighting. Sponsored by the Known World Players. Open to all performers 8-14; see class listings for rehearsal details.

name: Æthelmearc Scribal College Open Scriptorium
description_book: Open time at the Scribal tents for people who need to work on scrolls or want to consult with experienced scribes and teachers. Use the side gate.
description_web: Open time at the Scribal tents for people who need to work on scrolls or want to consult with experienced scribes and teachers. Use the side gate. We will have tables, chairs, good lighting, and experienced scribes and teachers who can answer questions, help with any issues or direct you to where to get further information on most scribal topics.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: Walk Like a Phoenician: Dance in Ancient Sources
description_book: A basic history of ancient belly dance, based on Greek and Roman sources. NB: this is a dance **history** class, not a dance performance class.

name: Pennsic Readers' Theater: *The Young Elizabeth*
description_book: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater presents staged reading of *The Young Elizabeth*.
description_web: This is a staged reading of the script *The Young Elizabeth* by Jennette Dowling and Francis Letton. A staged reading is a performance where the actors perform with the script in their hand and there are no props, costumes, scenery, or special lighting. Sponsored by Known World Players. See class listings for rehearsal details. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

name: *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: Disk, bobbins, string

name: Period Oil Lamps; Light up the Bog!
description_book: Oil lamps are safe, period and inexpensive. Consider bringing a glass vessel to class and light up the Bog with a burning lamp!
description_web: Oil lamps were used to light lamps by all cultures throughout the Middle Ages. Learn how easy, inexpensive, compact and, best of all, **safe**oil lamps still are! Learn how to camp with just one bottle of cooking oil. Taught at Bog University this year, inexpensive wick kits and free oil will be available to allow everyone to depart the class with a burning oil lamp. Let's light up the Bog!
fee_itemization: $3 for a handout and 2 wick kits.

name: Night Sky over Pennsic
description_book: Come learn about the night skies.
description_web: Enjoy viewing the night sky over Pennsic. A small telescope will be present. Bring chairs and blankets out near the fencing list at about dusk. Family-friendly.

name: Early Bird Ball
description_book: Come and dance at the first ball at Pennsic! Lots of fun dances and opportunities to greet old friends and to meet new ones!
description_web: Come and dance at the first ball at Pennsic! Lots of fun dances and opportunities to greet old friends and to meet new ones! If you are interested in playing in the band, Siri Toivosdotter (Jo-Ann Sheffer) will be organizing the music and directing.

name: Lorelei Skye: Songs of Humor, Whimsy, and Woe!
description_book: Lorelei Skye returns performing yesteryear and original songs of humor, whimsy, and woe for your enjoyment!
description_web: Lorelei Skye returns performing yesteryear and original songs of humor, whimsy, and woe for your enjoyment! *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Coffee with Friends of Dr Bob and Bill
description_book: Morning open meeting for those in recovery.
description_web: Morning open meeting for those in recovery.

name: 5th Annual Unofficial Pennsic Half-Marathon
description_book: Countess Thora Heri and HRM Signy Heri of Atlantia will lead a 13.1-mile run around the Pennsic campground.
description_web: The estimated 13-mile course (it is medievally inexact!) will consist of three loops around the entire Pennsic campground, plus one smaller loop around the Serengeti. Runners will meet in front of Chirurgeons' Point at 8 a.m. Water is available from the chirurgeons, but runners are encouraged to supply their own water/sports drink/snack needs. We will pass the Chirurgeons' Point three times, at roughly 4.5-mile intervals. Note: This is a group run, not a race. No times will be kept, though there will be some participant awards. The goal is fitness as part of the SCAdian lifestyle. All are welcome. Wearing medieval-style tunics instead of modern running clothing is encouraged.

name: Youth Armored Combat Morning Session
description_book: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.
description_web: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.

name: Keeping Bees in the Knowne World
description_book: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.
description_web: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.

name: Late-Period Cross Stitch and Variations
description_book: Examines how cross stitch was used, alone and with other stitches, plus a brief look at long-armed cross and reversible cross stitch.
description_web: Examines examples of extant pieces and images, and the many ways cross stitch was used, alone and with other stitches, plus a brief look at long-armed cross and reversible cross stitch. SCA myths about cross stitch will be debunked. Some photos show pieces not available to the public.

name: Combat Archery for Commanders
description_book: How to integrate combat archery into your army.
description_web: We'll use diagrams and demonstrations to discuss how to incorporate CA tactics in typical battlefield scenarios.

name: Elizabethan Working Clothes
description_book: A survey of clothing appropriate for working-class men & women of late 16th-century England, particularly garments/outfits suitable for Pennsic.
description_web:
Nothing's as impressive as full-bore, late-period finery, but save your silks and farthingales for courts and dancing. This class will discuss choices of attire for pitching tents, cooking over a fire, going to the market, etc., including options for the range of climes that Pennsic can contain. 
This is not a clothing construction class, though sources for patterns and materials are included in the handout, and details of fit may be discussed.

name: German Reformation and Sumptuary Laws
description_book: A look at German sumptuary laws, the effects of the Reformation, and how the people broke the rules.
description_web: A look at German sumptuary laws, the effects of the Reformation, and how the people broke the rules. These are the laws that ran the everyday lives of the citizens of the German city states - not only how they dressed, but how they celebrated, practiced their faith, and planned a meal, and socialized.
fee_itemization: 10+ page handout with color plates for reference.

name: Braiding Hair
description_book: Simple braids... two, three and four strand braids of hair.
description_web: Practice the art of braiding hair, either on ourselves or with a camp mate.

name: Werewolves in the Middle Ages
description_book: Covering lore and various views of shapeshifters, especially werewolves, from Rome to the Renaissance, from the Baltic to the Mediterranean.
description_web: I'll cover shape shifters and lycanthropes from the Norse berserkers to the witches of the early Renaissance, focusing on what different attitudes were in different times and places. What would your persona have heard and believed about those tales? What was written by scholars in different times and places?
fee_itemization: free handout, but optional booklet available

name: Everyday Elizabethan for the Middling Sort
description_book: What did working and middle class people wear in Elizabethan England? Learn the  building blocks of a comfortable, everyday outfit for men or women.
description_web: What did working and middle class people wear in Elizabethan England? What layers, what fibers, what fabrics? Learn what goes into a comfortable, everyday outfit. Look at different possibilities and get ideas for designing your own mid- to late-16th-century wardrobe. For men and women. The focus is on English ensembles, but other western European sources will be used also.
fee_itemization: 3 for printing costs

name: Make and Take Rag Dolls
description_book: Come make a little friend for yourself or a loved one in this special needs-friendly, hands-on class! All ages.
description_web:
Rag dolls were a child's best friend in period. Learn how to assemble one of your very own to take home. This class is specifically designed to be accessible for all ages, including special needs adults and children. The instructor works with special needs adults and designed this as a positive motor-skill reinforcing activity. Dolls are one per person.

Come any time during the block, as long as we have space you can participate.

Only plant fiber rags.

name: Documenting Your Food: Brehon Laws in Ireland
description_book: A focus on the Brehon Laws and how they can be used to document food and nutrition in the SCA time period.
description_web: This class will focus on the Brehon Laws and how they can be used to document food and nutrition in the SCA time period. The class will discuss what the Brehon Laws were and give specific examples of references to food and its relationship to the community law.

name: Period Slavic Seed Beads: *Gerdan*
description_book: We will create a period ethnic necklace that was used as an amulet a long time ago in East Europe, Asia, and the Middle East.
fee_itemization:
Printed colored scheme and instructions
Cords
Czech seed beads

instructor: Baroness Juliana Rosalia Dolce di Siena
name: Retaining: Taking Care of Your Royalty
description_book: This class is for people who have never retained before and those who have but are now going to be the Head Retainer for a reign.
description_web: This class is for people who have never retained before and those who have but are now going to be the Head Retainer for a reign. We’ll discuss the overall duties of being a retainer, caring for yourself and running a reign.

name: St. Sebastian's Archery Shoot VIII
description_book: The St. Sebastian's Archery Shoot VIII, hosted by Atlantia.
description_web: A full day of Atlantian-style archery with 13 novelty stations to test your prowess with the bow. Come on out and have some fun and take a chance to win some fabulous prizes. Shoot will start at 9 am and all score cards must be turned in by 4 pm with awards right afterwards.

name: Beginner Dance for Children and Families
description_book: Some simple steps and dances will be taught to introduce children of all ages and their families to period European dancing. No experience needed.

name: Battle of La Rochelle
description_book: The defenders of La Rochelle **will** die! The only question is, **when**? Join us at the Fort to find out. Heavy rapier and rubber band gun melée.
description_web: The defenders of La Rochelle **will** die! The only question is, **when**? Join us at the Fort to find out. Heavy rapier and rubber band gun melée. Attackers will have unlimited resurrections, defenders will have limited resurrections. RBG cannon are welcome. No archery, please. Pennsic standard rules for rapier apply. Don't have a heavy rapier? Bring a dagger or two. Bring a friend or 20. The more the merrier. Don't like to fight melée? Come and get close to the action and help marshal the battle. Please muster **at the Fort**  half an hour before the start time, especially if you want to fight along with a particular group. Time permitting, we will do something new and different for the last battle. Come check it out.

location: Guild of Saint Barbara (Top of Mt Eislin under the Gunners Red Fly. Bring chairs and water)
name: Guild of Saint Barbara Annual Meeting and Training
description_book: Annual meeting will cover new items and also go over the firing schedule. Bring pre-1600 firearms with you to be inspected. Bring questions.
description_web:
The Guild of Saint Barbara will having its annual meeting on Middle Saturday at 10 am. Immediately following will be a black powder training session for new gentles that wish to learn and join us on the line, or a refresher for those who would desire. 
Hands-on training will be from 12 pm to 3 pm. The meeting will cover new items and also go over the firing schedule for Pennsic 46. Please join us for this informative session and feel free to bring questions. And, if you have pre-1600 firearms, bring them with you to be inspected. Please **DO NOT** bring powder to Pennsic!

name: Mass Project
description_book: Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. We will study a plain chant Mass and a Mass by Josquin.
description_web: Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. We will study a plain chant Mass and a Mass by Josquin. We are going to do a mini-performance at the European Music Expo and a Mass Performance during War Week. Time and Date TBD
fee_itemization: Music Packet

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a narrow strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a narrow strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Class limited to 5 looms. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: cards & string

name: Story Time with the Mayor
description_book: Come meet the Mayor and have him read you a story or two.
description_web: Come meet the Mayor and have him read you a story or two.

name: Beginning Scribes' Track
description_book: In this 5-day track, brand-new scribes will learn everything needed to produce award-worthy scrolls based on a 15th-century French manuscript.
description_web:
In this 5-day track, brand-new scribes will learn the skills (Layout, Gothic Calligraphy, Drawing the Flowers, Gilding, and Painting) needed to create award-worthy scrolls based on this 15th-century French manuscript:  http://gallica.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/btv1b53000324z/f1.planchecontact 

In class, you will create a small project suitable for framing.

Fee includes supplies for all 5 days, plus a starter scribal kit to create an 11 x 14" scroll at home.

Students must commit to attending all 5 sessions. Each session will last 2 hours. A different skill will be covered each session.
fee_itemization: Fee includes handouts and supplies for all 5 days, plus a starter scribal kit to create an 11 x 14" scroll at home.  For a detailed list, contact me at hutchnsn@bucknell.edu

name: Artisans' Playtime
description_book: Artisans of the Known World, come to Æ Royal and share your skill in an open forum of fun and learning.
description_web: Calling the Artisans of the Known World! Come out to Æ Royal and share your skill. Pick up a new technique or revisit an old one. Not sure if the Arts & Sciences are for you? Ever wondered what that thingy is? Or how do they do that? Come to Æ Royal and figure it out.

name: Tiny Stocking
description_book: Knit a small version of a period-like stocking. For experienced knitters. Double-pointed needles, increase and decrease, and pick-up stitches.
description_web: We will knit a small version of a period-esque stocking.  For experienced knitters; must know how to use double-pointed needles, increase and decrease, and pick-up stitches. Feel free to bring your own needles and yarn.
fee_itemization: Double-pointed needles, yarn, large eye needle, stitch marker, case, handout

name: Beginner's Guide to Garbing
description_book: With several myths regarding garb colors & materials, come learn what materials & colors were really used. Some helpful hints with patterns too!
description_web: Come and learn about colors, materials, and patterns used in Middle Ages & Renaissance. This class will focus mostly on appropriate colors and materials for the 13th-16th centuries with some helpful hints on where to start with garbing.
fee_itemization: Handouts for the class

name: Untangling Twist
description_book: A spinning clinic. Bring your problem tool, project, technique and let's see what we can work through.
description_web:
Are you getting started with spinning and there's just this thing you don't get? Have you been spinning for years and you would like a few more pointers? Do you have a tool (spindle, wheel) that's driving you bonkers? Are you trying out a different fiber and getting tangled up?
Come hang out with a spinster and work through your current spinning questions. Work through an issue, or  just hang out with people who like to talk fiber.
I've been spinning for 30 years. I can't promise to solve all your problems, but we should be able to work through a couple.

name: Bidding the Bedes: Introduction to Paternosters
description_book: The history and development of western European Christian prayer beads as well as information on making your own replica.
description_web: In the 13th-16th centuries in western Europe, prayer beads were a ubiquitous accessory. This class discusses the history and development of the paternoster, as well as information on making your own replica. Kits will be available to make a glass paternoster.
fee_itemization: Beads, silk thread, needle, terminal pendant, bead tip

name: Irish Bardic Tradition
description_book: The Irish Bardic Tradition from pre-Christian times to the Flight of the Earls (1607).
description_web: The Irish Bardic Tradition from pre-Christian times to the Flight of the Earls (1607). Details on the Bardic Schools, status and power of bards, ability to curse through "satire," the epics, praise poems, music, and presentation style.

name: Natural Hair Dye: Henna and Beyond
description_book: Learn how to use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever.
description_web: Learn how to use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever. We'll focus on henna but explore other herbs to color and protect hair naturally without dangerous chemicals. Some supplies will be available at the class.

name: Spinning "Yarns"
description_book: Spinning is the subject of mythology and folklore in hundreds of cultures. Learn the truth about Sleeping Beauty as well!
description_web: Spinning has been the subject of mythology and folklore in hundreds of cultures. Join me for a discussion of some of them, including the answer to the age-old question, what did Sleeping Beauty **really** stick her finger on? Some adult content due to the original Sleeping Beauty story. Sorry, Uncle Walt!

name: Period Mustards Made Easy
description_book: Mustards can be made….**easy**. Learn to make mustards that can be put out at your next dayboard or feast; includes period recipes and variations.
description_web: Mustards can be made….**easy**. Learn how to make mustards that can be put out at your next dayboard or feast, including period recipes and variations. Make your dayboard a bit more exciting. Class will include the different ingredients that go into mustards, techniques, spices, and have a real-time display on just how easy it can be. There will be tastings so food allergies should be considered.  Tastings available for the first 20, first come first serve, but hand outs for audits will be available.

name: New? A Class on the Basics/Intro to Royalty
description_book: Learn about what essentials you should have for an event, basic customs and protocol, how to get involved, persona and heraldry, and meet Royalty.
description_web:
Are you new to the Society, or have you only gone to a few events? Still confused about what there is to do and what we are about? Come meet the Chatelain for the Kingdom of Atlantia (the officer in charge of welcoming you to the Society) and get a grasp on the basics. Learn about what essentials you should have for an event, basic customs and protocol, how to get involved, persona and heraldry, as well as much more. We promise you will learn a lot!

Also, come and meet some of the Royalty and Royal Peers of the Knowne World. One of the things that makes Pennsic stand out from other events is the large number of Royalty and Royal Peers in attendance from all over the Knowne World. To many, they are the “stars” of the SCA that many only get to see from a distance. This is your opportunity to not only meet some of them, but to talk to them and ask them questions, or sit and listen. It is something that you will not soon forget!

name: Mask Performance and Mumming
description_book: Brief overview of historical performances using masks, practice exercises using masks, and (weather permitting) a field trip "in character".
description_web: Masked performers appeared in a number of countries in medieval and Renaissance Europe, in mummings, masques and other performances. After an overview describing such performances, the class will practice performing in masks. (Masks will be available, or feel free to bring your own!) Weather permitting, the class will make a short field trip "in character" (wearing the masks) down a Pennsic thoroughfare.

name: Period-Like Printing with Computers
description_book: We will discuss the availability of typefaces for computers which approximate (or recreate) period-looking type.
description_web: We will discuss the availability of modern typefaces for computers which approximate (or recreate) period-looking type. Printing in the SCA is one of the few aspects of our endeavor where we neglect period-ness, and in this class we will explore ways, using typefaces, art, and layout techniques, to make our publications look more period. (Please leave your Times New Roman and Helvetica at the gate!) Bring a thumb drive to class, so you can download any of the free fonts we discuss!
fee_itemization: 24-page, hand-sewn chapbook containing the materials and resources covered in this class.

name: 15th-Century Italian Dance 3.0 "At Tempo"
description_book: This class will discuss newer research on the four *tempi* in this dance era and how the steps are performed.
description_web: This class will discuss newer research on the four *tempi* in this dance era and how the steps are performed both in their native tempo and in other *tempi*. Practice of the basic steps as described by Domenico and others along with review of several dances will be included with the lecture and discussion on dance *tempi* and dance step descriptions.

name: Multiplayer Chess
description_book: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.

name: Topics in Basic Heraldry
description_book: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory skills for consulting at Pennsic Herald's Point. Dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point.
description_web: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory submission skills necessary to consult at Pennsic Herald's Point. Exact dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point at the beginning of the War. All newer heralds are strongly encouraged to attend at least one of these classes prior to volunteering at Herald's Point.

name: Japanese Stab Binding: Make a Book in Under 1 Hour
description_book: Make two books in an hour using the stab binding method of Japan. No handout, as we will focus on the craft rather than the history.
description_web: Come make two books in no time at all using the ancient stab binding method of Japan. There is no handout, as we will focus on the craft rather than the history, but a card with reference sites will be available. Supplies are limited to 6.
fee_itemization: Beeswax, Paper for book pages, decorative paper for book covers and linen binding thread.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, Thursday, 8/10 (time and place to be determined).

name: Pennsic Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! Singing in the Choir is an intense and rewarding experience with a concert Thursday War Week.
description_web: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! This year's concert theme is "A Medieval Christmas" The repertoire includes pieces by Hassler, King Henry VIII, Praetorius and Morley, conducted by Lady Siri Toivosdotter. Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on Thursday evening of War Week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is helpful, but not required if you learn the music in advance. Sheet music and audio tracks are available online at https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsicxliiichoirs

name: Early Music Notation: Petrucci's Prodigious Press
description_book: Reading from the first printed music (1501-1509). Bring melody instruments that you play fluently, or sing. No early-notation experience necessary.
description_web: Ottaviano Petrucci (1466-1539) was the first large-scale printer of music. Between 1501 and 1509 he published over 40 books of music: instrumental and vocal, sacred and secular, sober and whimsical, but all with a visual clarity that would not be equaled for another 200 years. We'll read a variety of pieces in facsimile from the Petrucci press, stopping to discuss notational difficulties as they come up. Bring a melody instrument (or voice) you play fluently: recorder, fiddle, harp, viol, lute, etc.

location: The Camp of the Three Bears (N17 along Battle Road)
name: Anglo-Saxon Cookery
description_book: A discussion and demonstration of Anglo Saxon cooking.

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn how to throw axes, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit: 25 participants. No experience needed.

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: Basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 4-part class; different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*
Day 4- *Kashlimah* and other strange stuff

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Period Fishing with Dame Anthoinette Martel
description_book: Come learn to make period bait and equipment! All youth require an individual adult "buddy" for this class.
description_web: Come learn to make period bait and equipment! All youth require an individual adult "buddy" for this class.

name: A Hand a Day: Insular Majuscule
description_book: Learn the basics of the hand that is best known for its use in the Book of Kells and the Lindisfarne Gospels.

name: Undulation Nation
description_book: Complex and layered undulation patterns and combinations for belly dancers. I guarantee you will learn something new and exciting.
description_web: Complex and layered undulation patterns for belly dancers. I guarantee you will learn something new and exciting. Please have mastered basic undulations. We will learn the class's choice of horizontal, diagonal, spiral, circular or other undulation patterns and fabulous new undulation combinations.

name: Visit Shakespeare's London
description_book: A guided tour of everyday life in the 1590s. How folk of all classes work, play, dress, and live - or don’t. Taught in persona.
description_web: Taught in persona. A guided tour of everyday life in the 1590s. How folk of all classes work, play, dress, and live - or don’t. The experience of the material and social culture of London life in the late Elizabethan period.

name: On the Evolution of Jewish Names
description_book: Traces the evolution of Jewish names from the Biblical period through the medieval era, with references for a variety of cultures.
description_web: This class shows how Jewish names evolved from the simple names used in the Hebrew Bible (Old Testament to Christians) through the Greco-Roman period and into a variety of European and Middle Eastern cultures. The class is intended for persons trying to develop a registerable Jewish name and for heralds as a help with clients working with clients who want a Jewish persona.
fee_itemization: The five dollar cost is for an 18-page handout, complete with tables and footnotes.

name: Leather Coronets: Light, Bright and Beautiful
description_book: This class will go over some of the options in putting together a leather coronet.
description_web: Does your coronet weigh heavy on your brow....not from duty, but from the amount of metal on your head? Do you want something lighter but still elegant? This class will go over some of the options in putting together a leather coronet.

name: Introduction to a Basic Healing Balm
description_book: Learn some basics about some healing herbs for topical use, how to harvest and extract their oils plus the differences between a tincture and oils.
description_web: Learn some basics about some healing herbs for topical use, how to harvest and extract their oils plus the differences between a tincture and oils.Includes the differences between using fresh herbs and dry herbs and how to keep herbal creams fresh longer.

name: Event Finances: Before, During and After
description_book: From budget to gate to the event report. A discussion of event finances, based on Chapter 9 of the *Local Exchequer Handbook*.

name: Plagues of Europe: Yes - There Was More than One
description_book: Focus is on types of plagues, their origins, biological mechanisms, transmission, physical and psychological impact on the affected populations.
description_web: This class focuses on the types of plagues, their origins, biological mechanisms, means of transmission and their impact on the populations in affected areas.
