Measles, smallpox, bubonic plague, anthrax and leprosy each had a devastating impact on the population physically, economically, psychologically, spiritually and artistically.
fee_itemization: Documentation of common plagues and discussion of their impact on history, medicine, culture, social structure and the agricultural food supply

name: Story Quest: A Spoken-Word Bardic Circle
description_book: A quest for story in all of its spoken formats. Bring lunch and your poetry, prose, and tales for this spoken word bardic circle! *Bardic Safe Space*.
description_web: Lady Scholastica Joycors hosts a quest for story in all of its spoken formats. Bring lunch and your poetry, prose, and tales for this spoken word bardic circle! *Bardic Safe Space*.

name: An Analysis of Middle-Eastern Clothing in the SCA
description_book: A discussion of the differences and similarities of clothing worn in the now Middle East in the SCA time periods.
description_web: What is the difference between Ottoman and Persian clothing? What did the Seljuks wear? Did men and women wear the same thing? A discussion of who wore when and where with hands-on example.

name: Tea with the Queen of Ealdormere
description_book: Come and have a conversation with the Queen of Ealdormere. Take a look behind the palace doors and see how we try to make reigning look effortless.
description_web: Come and have a conversation with the Queen of Ealdormere. Take a look behind the palace doors and see how we try to make reigning look effortless.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: I Feel Pretty and Period
description_book: A discussion of (generally later) period beauty practices, both from the perspective of "What they did" as well as "What can we safely do."
description_web: A discussion of period skin care and hair care practices, both from the perspective of "What they did" as well as "What we can safely do." It is no secret that period skin care and hair care recipes often involved mercury, lead and arsenic, but there are also some great recipes and tools that SCAdians can use to further their immersion into their persona.

name: Palmistry
description_book: Palmistry was practiced throughout period, and you can learn to read palms well enough in one hour to start immediately.
description_web: From the Egyptians throughout SCA period, palm reading has been practiced in most cultures. Although years of study add more details, you can quickly learn enough of the basic skills to read (well enough that you'll probably be mobbed with requests). We'll cover a bit of history, but mostly this is "hands-on" learning about hand reading.
fee_itemization: handout optional, free further-reading sheet

name: *Alquerques*
description_book: Period game from the Middle East in the family of checkers-style games. We will teach the rules and the play.
description_web: Period game from the Middle East in the family of checkers-style games. We will review what is known, the rules, and the play through some games to learn the basic strategies.

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: Sticks & string

name: Scribal Workshop: The Armenian Gospels of Gladzor
description_book: This 4-part, 4-day hands-on Intermediate to Advanced workshop will cover the skills necessary to create a scroll based upon the Gladzor book.
description_web: This 4-part, 4-day hands-on Intermediate to Advanced workshop will cover the skills necessary to create a scroll based upon the Gladzor book: a fascinating combination of zoomorphic images, whitework, gold and inkwork. A faux script has been created to compliment this workshop.
fee_itemization:
Kit Includes:
Black and White handout/Typed
Color copies of the Gladzor book carpet pages  1 per student
1 sable paintbrush, size 1
1 sable paintbrush, size 2
Palette with all paint needed for class
Arches Watercolor paper 8x10 - personal piece
Arches watercolor paper 11x14
Colored inks, red, blue, black
Quill tip nibs
Arabic gold paint

name: Seasons and Cycles of Medieval Life
description_book: Examines the cycles which drove the medieval world: the seasons, the agricultural year, the church year, to show the broad outline of medieval life.
description_web: Seasons and cycles of medieval life, or "the rhythm method", examines the cycles which drove medieval life: the seasons, the agricultural year, the church year, light and dark, to show the broad outline of life in the medieval world.

name: Bidding for KWHSS
description_book: So you want to bid for a Known World Heraldic and Scribal Symposium (KWHSS)? You should probably come to this class first.
description_web: For three years, my local shire tried to bid to host KWHSS. This class is the sum total of the knowledge that my group, staff, and I gained through that experience. If your group wants to host a different symposium this is not the class for you. Cooks and bards, metal and fiber all go through a different bidding process.

name: Paternosters: The Evidence
description_book: Lecture class on evidence for prayer bead construction in Europe prior to 1600, and the benefits and challenges of each source.
description_web: We will discuss what evidence we have for the construction of prayer beads in Europe prior to 1600 and the benefits and challenges of using each kind of source. Lecture-style class.
fee_itemization: Paper, ink

name: Retaining Members in the SCA Workshop
description_book: This class will cover things that you can do to help retain all our valuable members and is geared toward those who hold officer positions.
description_web: Retaining members in SCA groups can sometimes be difficult. This class will cover things that you can do to help retain all our valuable members and is geared toward those who hold officer positions. First, we will go over some basic do’s, don’ts and lessons learned that I have experienced within the SCA. Second, we will do some hands-on interaction between people in the class. This will be geared towards how to interact with new people. It will be especially helpful to those who “never know what to say” or have a hard time walking up to someone new and talking to them. Last, we will have a roundtable discussion to come up with more positive ways of interacting with very new members.

name: The History of Kissing
description_book: Juliet stated "palm to palm is holy palmers' kiss", but what do we know about the kiss in period? Our lips aren't sealed; come learn the history.
description_web: Juliet stated "palm to palm is holy palmers' kiss", but what do we know about the kiss in period? Our lips aren't sealed; come learn the history of the kiss.

name: Interlaced Herringbone / *Kutchwork* / *Marash* I
description_book: Basic interlaced herringbone stitch: a complex multi-step stitch used throughout Europe, Indian and Armenian embroidery dating from the 13th C.
description_web: Interlaced herringbone stitch is a complex multi-step stitch used in Europe, northern Indian, and Armenian embroidery dating from the 13th C. This class teaches the basics of layout and work from which more complex patterns can be built.
fee_itemization: Handout packet includes hoop, fabric, floss, needle, instruction, research CD

name: *Cloisonné* Enameling
description_book: Come learn *cloisonné* enamel reproduction. Will leave with a finished item. Max of 8 participants.
description_web: Come learn *cloisonné* enamel reproduction. We use non-leaded, vitreous enamel on copper discs. We will have some simple Byzantine and Saxon style examples that you may reproduce, or come with a simple design, that would be easy to shape with copper wire. We will use modern tools, but discuss medieval tools. If you have jewelry making tools, please bring them along as we only have a limited supply. You will leave with a finished item. Max of 8 participants.
fee_itemization:
$1 fee for information handout.
$9 recovering costs of enamel and copper and wire

name: Beginning *Pysanky*
description_book: Students will learn the history of the *pysanka*, and have the opportunity to create one of their own.
description_web: Students will learn the history of the *pysanka*, as well as the techniques involved, and have the opportunity to create one of their own. The class is listed as 3 hours to allow plenty of time for writing the shells; it doesn't usually take that long.
fee_itemization: $5 overall, $2 if you just want the handout (but it IS a hands-on class ...)

name: Hammer of the Witches: Witch Hunts and Trials
description_book: Examines the various texts, tactics, and histories of witch-hunters, along with information on the enemies they believed they fought.

name: How Not to Make a Gothic Fitted Dress
description_book: Learn about some common mistakes in making this popular dress, and how to avoid them.
description_web: Learn about some common mistakes in making this popular dress style, and how to avoid them. Students are invited to contribute stories and suggestions from their own experience as well.
fee_itemization: 1.00 for photocopied handout

name: Slavery in Viking Culture
description_book: Discussion of slavery and how it was treated in Viking culture. The Thursday morning session of this class will be taught *in persona*.
description_web: A class discussing slavery in Viking cultures, how it was started in myth, as well as the laws and devices used in the slave trade. Recreation of items from the time may be available for use as examples. First session of this class will be held as an "in persona" discussion.

name: Shiny Hats and Medallions: Introduction to Royalty
description_book: Covers Society award structure, what all the medallions and coronets mean, using titles appropriately and court etiquette, and intro to Royalty.
description_web:
Keeping everyone’s names straight can be confusing, but then when you add titles to the mix it takes on a whole new level. This class will cover the Society's award structure (so you know why people are clapping in court) as well what all the medallions and coronets mean. We will also discuss some of the differences in awards across the different Kingdoms. In addition, there will be a section on using titles appropriately and court etiquette. That way, when you are called up for the first time, you know what to do!

Also, come and meet some of the Royalty and Royal Peers of the Knowne World. One of the things that makes Pennsic stand out from other events is the large number of Royalty and Royal Peers in attendance from all over the Knowne World. To many, they are the “stars” of the SCA that many only get to see from a distance. This is your opportunity to not only meet some of them, but to talk to them and ask them questions, or sit and listen.  It is something that you will not soon forget!

name: What to Play and Where to Play It
description_book: Getting started making instrumental music in the SCA. Includes instrument demos, roundtable discussion, and playing session; bring instruments!
description_web: For those looking to get started or to find new opportunities making instrumental music in the SCA. Class will include tips and hints, roundtable discussion, demos of an assortment of instruments, and a playing session. Bring your instruments!

name: Pre-16th-Century Musical Modal Improvisation
description_book: This is a practical application class for musicians to learn improvisational skills that were practiced in the Middle Ages for ages.
description_web: Musician class for acoustic instruments to learn medieval modal improvisation that will teach the student to create melodies on the spot for both free form and structured rhythmic forms. Students are required to be very familiar with their instruments. Reading music is not required but really helps, especially your major and natural minor scales.

name: Canary with Training Wheels
description_book: The Canary is a 16th-century dance with swagger and foot-stamping. I will teach a simplified pattern that will let you start having fun with it.

name: Morris Games
description_book: We will teach *Nine Man's Morris* and other games of that family (which include the modern *tic tac toe*).
description_web: We will teach *Nine Man's Morris* and other games of that family (which include the modern *tic tac toe*).

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
fee_itemization: materials

name: Zill Dance from Start to Stage: 2 of 4
description_book: Learn a zill choreography to be performed at the Middle Eastern Dance Expo. Recommended for intermediate dancers who know zill basics.
description_web: Zills, or finger cymbals, add much to a performance. This class series will have the students learning a zill choreography with the option of performing it as a group at the Middle Eastern Dance Expo. Recommended for intermediate dancers who know zill basics as this class will move quickly through the choreography. Performance costuming should consist of a period or peri-oid coat worn over *salwar* or harem pants and a simple hip scarf or belt. Dancers must attend 3 of the 4 sessions including the final one in order to be eligible to perform.

name: String Theory
description_book: How do vibrating-string instruments really work? For players (and aspiring players) of plucked, strummed, and bowed string instruments.
description_web:
How do vibrating-string instruments really work? For players (and aspiring players) of plucked, strummed, and bowed string instruments, an understanding of the “what’s really going on physically” can be very enlightening. Practical tips for technique and practice will also be shared.

Class will also include a discussion of the medieval understanding of what was going on in the context of Aristotelian (as opposed to modern Newtonian) physics. Mathematical and scientific concepts limited to length, mass, tension, and simple fractions.
Instructor has been playing guitar since the 1970s and teaching (and performing in the SCA) since the '80s, when he was an engineering student.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): *i Verdi Confusi*
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: From One Manuscript, Many Scrolls
description_book: Learn how redact manuscripts for use in your scrolls.
description_web: Have you ever looked at a manuscript image and thought there was no way to do the whole thing? Learn how to redact the manuscript! If you want to work on a new technique or overall style, picking a small part of a larger, more complicated work is a great way to learn.

name: Introduction to Beginning Period Cookery
description_book: Want to cook "in period" but don’t know where to start? For beginners who want a quick intro to some basics of modern period cookery.
description_web: Want to cook "in period", but don’t know where to start? Your apartment doesn't have a handy open fireplace? No idea what an *eyroun* is or where to find one? No problem! This class is designed for beginners who might never have cooked a period recipe before but want a quick introduction into some of the basics of modern period cookery.

name: Fit Your Neck Hole: Keyhole Neck
description_book: We’ll look at the placement and geometry of how the neck hole works. A look at how to make a keyhole neck.
description_web: This class is all about the neck opening of any garment. We’ll look at the placement and geometry of how the neck hole works and get it to fit well every time. Primarily for keyhole necks, this works for the T-tunic, doublet, bodice, cotehardie, houppelande and even modern shirts.

name: The Evolution of English: Cracking the Myths
description_book: Covers the basic history of the development of the English language from Old English through Early Modern English.
description_web: This class will cover the basic history of the development of the English language from Old English through Early Modern English from the standpoint of commonly-heard myths and incorrect facts about English, such as "English is a romance language, right?" The class will address time line, language contact, sound and grammar changes, and more. Questions and discussion welcome!

name: The End of Commonwealth: Iceland, 1150-1264
description_book: A look at the *Sturlunga* period in Icelandic history, the time when the Commonwealth ended and the Kingdom of Norway took control of Iceland.
description_web: A class looking at the *Sturlunga* period in Icelandic history, the time when the Commonwealth ended and the Kingdom of Norway took control of Iceland.

name: Counted Work Not Displayed at the Met
description_book: The Metropolitan Museum has interesting embroideries which are rarely, if ever, seen by the public.
description_web: The Metropolitan Museum has interesting embroideries not displayed to the public, but I was able to photograph some, including a few reverse sides. These items and fragments often have interesting differences from those the public sees, and can be analyzed in detail. Since the Met does not allow copies of the photos to be given out, the handout will include some charts I've made of them instead.

name: Gender Relationships in Heian Japan
description_book: An exploration of gender relationships in Heian (794 to 1185) Japan, including marital relationships, literature, and ownership of property.
description_web: An exploration of gender relationships in Heian (794 to 1185) Japan, including marital relationships, literature, and ownership of property.

name: Retaining 101
description_book: For those who are interested in retaining but are unsure where to even begin the process of signing up.
description_web:
This class is for those who are interested in retaining but are unsure where to even begin the process of signing up.
We will cover the steps needed to sign up, and how to retain. This is a roundtable discussion-type of class. There will be demonstrations of various interactions. Handout provided.

name: Period Portable Furniture You Can Make
description_book: Chairs, tables, and a bed, all based on period designs.
description_web: Chairs, tables, and a bed, all based on period designs. At least one chair, one table, and the bed are simple enough so that someone with only basic tools and no expertise should be able to make them.

name: English Country Dance from the West
description_book: Come learn *Jack O'Lent*, an interesting, complex, and unusual English Country Dance for sets of three couples! *Stingo* will be added if time.
description_web: Come learn *Jack O'Lent*, a fun, complex, and *decidedly* non-typical English Country Dance for sets of three couples! *Stingo*, which is a little more typical, but only so much so with a crazy fun last verse, will be added if time allows. This is an advanced class.

name: Period Card Games: *Losing Loadem*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period, trick-avoidance card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game based on a reconstruction from Francis Willughby’s *A Volume of Plaies* (~1665).

name: Early Music Notation: Marguerite's *Chansonnier*
description_book: Reading from Queen Marguerite's (1480-1530) handwritten music book. Bring melody instruments that you play fluently, or sing.
description_web: Queen Marguerite of Austria, Princess of Asturias and Duchess of Savoy (1480-1530), was not only a musician herself but a noted patroness of the arts. One of her prized possessions was a 70-page handwritten collection of secular and sacred polyphonic music now referred to as Brussels 11239. We'll sight-read a variety of pieces from the book, stopping to discuss notational difficulties as they come up. Bring a melody instrument (or voice) you play fluently: recorder, fiddle, harp, viol, lute, etc.

name: Sprang Basics
description_book: Using the twisted warp-based weaving of sprang create a useful pouch.
description_web: Using the twisted warp-based weaving of sprang create a useful pouch. Class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: loom, accessories, string

name: Battle of Tortuga
description_book: A non-war-point rapier battle. Two ships meet at sea. One filled with pirates will attempt to board the other that will do its best to fend them off.
description_web: A non-war-point rapier battle. Two ships meet at sea. The one filled with pirates will attempt to board the other that will do its best to fend them off. RBGs will be allowed.

name: Helga Ball Tournament
description_book: Helga Ball is a **ladies-only** sport based on a Viking game.The game, also known as "Cabbage Ball" is played with teams of 5 or 6 players.
description_web:
Helga Ball is a **ladies-only** sport based on a Viking game.The game, also known as "Cabbage Ball" is played with teams of 5 or 6 players. The game itself is played with a head of cabbage as the ball. This event at Pennsic will be a benefit for Paladin's Pantry. We will be accepting donations of paper and hygiene products for poor and food-insecure families in the Portersville area (the town where Pennsic take place). The tournament is sponsored by the Barony Marche of the Debatable Lands.

To Play:
- Organize a team of 5-10 women. (Having substitutions is a good thing.)
- Each player must be over 18.
- Each team member should bring one or more paper or hygiene product for donation. (No monetary donations.)
- Points are scored by getting a cabbage through/past your opponent's
goalposts. Two members of the Chivalry (or squires) shall serve as
stationary goal posts for each goal.
- All players must wear a dress. (Viking garb encouraged, but not required.)
- Players are encouraged to wear do-rags, heavy shoes/boots.
- Players may kick or dribble the cabbage with their feet, but may not touch
the cabbage with their hands or use hands to pick up the cabbage.
- Players may scoop the cabbage up in a skirt, apron, or do-rag, and move
the cabbage on the field.
- Tackling is not allowed, however "Group Hugs" are legal.
- Goalposts shall signal a "score" by raising one arm and yelling either
"Helga Ball!!" or "Olga ball!" to identify the scoring team.

- For our purposes, each game will last 15 minutes.

location: The Camp of the Three Bears (N17 along Battle Road)
name: Cooking with Crockery on a Campfire
description_book: A practicum on cooking over fire using period crockery pots and skillets.
description_web: A practicum on cooking over fire using period crockery pots and skillets. We'll provide the fire, some food, and a limited supply of crockery, and advice. You'll actually heat the crockery and cook, getting a feel for how to use these tools.

name: Intermediate *Doumbek*
description_book: Various topics for those looking to get beyond *baladi*. Pops, snaps, rolls, combinations, fills, soloing, etc.

name: Fighters' Dance
description_book: The use of basic Middle Eastern dance moves to improve fencing and heavy combat. Teaching balance, muscle isolation, and power transference.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.
fee_itemization: materials

name: I Do Not Think That Means What You Think It Means
description_book: An exploration of the inter-kingdom anthropology of the usage of regalia and other tokens and designators of rank as used within the SCA.

name: Period Mustards
description_book: There will be a tasting of various medieval mustards, and a hands-on demonstration on how to make a simple mustard.
description_web: A brief class on the theory and practice of making and using medieval mustards. There will be a tasting of various medieval mustards.

name: Musings on Chinese Tea in the Song Dynasty
description_book: We will touch on the culture, the preparation, the wares and the tea during the golden age of the tea house.

name: Burn the Coloring Pages, Toss Out the Foam Crowns!
description_book: Fun, hands-on youth activity ideas. This is an **adult class** on how to run activities.
description_web: Fun, hands-on activity ideas for running a youth point that shares knowledge about medieval life and/or life in our Society. If there is time, we will also cover "How to Run 'It Takes My Child to Raze a Village'". There is an optional $5 fee if you want to actually make and take samples. My book will be available for an as-yet-to-be-determined fee. (Have to calculate printing and binding costs for this year.)
fee_itemization:
Not required, but if you want to make and take samples, or own my book you can pay the fee(s).

$15 - Burn the Coloring Pages, Toss Out the Foam Crowns! 3rd Edition

$10 - Burn the Coloring Pages, Toss Out the Foam Crowns! 2nd Edition

$5 - Activity Fee

name: In Search of Anglo-Saxon Recipes
description_book: Is it possible to uncover Anglo-Saxon recipes in known manuscripts? I have a working theory to share.
description_web: Is it possible to uncover Anglo-Saxon recipes in known manuscripts? I have a working theory. A review of Ann Hagen's research and other sources on available food stuffs, cooking methods, and known habits that can point us to possible recipes.

name: Tale to Telling
description_book: How do you go from source text to a powerful presentation with six months to prepare? What if you have only three days?
description_web:
I discuss a simple (if time-intensive) process for taking source material and turning it into a powerful performance, using as case studies two of my pieces.  

One, "Gawain and the Green Knight" (which I regularly perform - in full kit - for the Brit Lit classes at the college where I work), was worked up over a period of six months. It's a 30-minute prose rendition of the famous tale of knightly virtues, attempted seduction, and sorcery. I plan to present it (in series) at Enchanted Ground over Middle Weekend. Here's the first part: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7mG4MnMZwtM

The second, "The Death of The Cid," was cooked up *literally overnight*, but resulted in me being named as Queen's Champion the next weekend. I performed it at Pennsic, where a Crown Prince sought me out afterward to thank me.

name: Nigel's Fire-Starting Class
description_book: You too can start a fire with flint and steel. We will explore the history of fire and how to start a fire with flint and steel. You will make fire.
description_web: Formerly titled “How to Start a Fire Like a Moderately Intelligent Saxon”. Yes, you too can start a fire with flint and steel like a Saxon, Roman, Viking, or any other civilized culture in the Middle Ages. Includes history of fire and the flint-and-steel mechanics of starting a fire. Hands-on class; you will start a fire. You must be at least 14 years old and have your parents' or wife’s permission.

name: Death and Dying in the Middle Ages
description_book: Come learn a little bit about death in the Middle Ages. What was it like to live in the 14th century? How long did people live? (TeenU, 14-17)
description_web: Come learn a little bit about death and dying in the Middle Ages. What was it like to live in the 14th century? How long did people live? What challenges did they face? After someone's death, what sort of practices did the survivors follow? How is it different from us today? (TeenU, 14-17)

name: *Nalbinding* Hats! Mittens! Socks!
description_book: So you know how to do at least one *nalbinding* stitch? Take the next step and learn how to make hats, mittens or socks.
description_web: So you know how to do at least one *nalbinding* stitch? Take the next step and learn how to make hats, mittens or socks. Bring a *nalbinding* needle if you have one and some yarn you are willing to waste. I will have some materials available for those who do not have needles or yarn.

name: Scandalously Practical: Italian Drawers
description_book: A delicate conversation about an indelicate subject: underwear. We'll discuss the origins of the garment, references in period and construction.
description_web: A delicate conversation about an indelicate subject: underwear. Several pairs of Renaissance Italian "trousers" from Venice are found in museums around the world. We'll discuss the origins of the garment, plus references in period and construction techniques using both period and modern patterning.

name: Pennsic 101
description_book: The Drums of War begin to Beat. It sounded like so much fun... ...but you've never done anything like this, so... now what do you do?
description_web: PENNSIC 101: The Drums of War begin to Beat. It sound like so much fun... ...but you've never done anything like this, so... now what do you do? Pennsic is a most wonderful SCA event and attending this class will help you to have the best time possible.

name: Writing *Commedia dell'Arte* Scenarios
description_book: Quick and practical way to create period-plausible *commedia* scenarios for your troupe for practice, SCA event, or Pennsic performance!
description_web: Quick and practical way to create period-plausible *commedia* scenarios for your troupe for practice, SCA event, or Pennsic performance! We will define a basic structure of a *commedia* play, identify the main characters and their functions, and learn to construct the scenarios that highlight the strengths of your troupe, whatever size and/or composition! Familiarity with basic history of commedia and characters required. No acting experience necessary.

name: Beginning *Atlatl*
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively.

name: Simple Dances, Simply Fun
description_book: Let's dance! Need I say more? All ages & abilities welcome. No fancy footwork, just an hour of moving to the music, from a variety of European styles.
description_web: Let's dance! Need I say more? All ages and abilities welcome. No fancy footwork, just an hour of moving to the music, from a variety of European styles.

name: Body of the Mask: The Full *Commedia* Character
description_book: Based on research of Antonio Fava, how to don the whole body of each *commedia* character to connect deeply with the audience with or without words.
description_web: Based on the research of Antonio Fava, how to don the whole body of each *commedia* character to connect deeply with the audience with or without words. Please come prepared to move in comfortable clothing. Each day we will inspect the movement of a different class of character: the lovers, the first and second *Zanni, Capitano, Signora* and house servants, *Pantalone* and *Dottore*.
fee_itemization: 100 page handouts in its own binder. Only needs to be purchased once.

name: Lovelace Manuscript Dances
description_book: Covers some familiar and some new material from this earlier ECD source which demonstrates the evolution of this dance style.

name: Beginner Near- and Middle-Eastern Hand Drumming
description_book: Let's learn to play that *dumbek/riq*/frame drum! Lady Zakiyyah (a.k.a. Kazuki) will help you get comfortable with that drum and have fun. All ages.
description_web: Let's learn to play that *dumbek/riq*/frame drum! Lady Zakiyyah (a.k.a. Kazuki) will help you get comfortable with that drum and have fun. We will go over posture, hand placement, tones, and some fun rhythms. Open to all ages.

name: PA Afternoon Series: European Music Exhibition
description_book: Come experience the history of composers and variety of music from the 11th-16th centuries. Bring your voices, instruments, and play along!
description_web: Come and enjoy an afternoon of European music. Experience the history of composers and a variety of instruments and vocal music from the 11th-16th centuries. Bring your voices, instruments, and play along!

name: A Hand a Day: Faux Russian Calligraphy
description_book: Faux Russian calligraphy, for those who don't speak the language.
description_web: Not everyone speaks the language of their persona, but would love to be able to figure out what it says on their scroll. We will explore this with pen and ink, and an appropriate "library petting zoo" will be available.

name: Device Design
description_book: How to draw and design your device or badge for submission. Learn the Core Style rules from SENA and how to avoid redraw returns.
description_web: This class will teach you how to draw and design your (or a client's) device or badge for submission to the Collage of Arms. We will go over the Core Style rules from SENA and learn how to avoid administrative returns due to a redraw.

name: Some Simple Period Sauces
description_book: There will be a tasting of various sauces.
description_web: A brief class on the theory and practice of making and using medieval sauces, with particular emphasis on the vinegar- and breadcrumb-based sauces. There will be a tasting of various sauces.

name: How to Build an Accurate Sundial
description_book: You too, can build a sundial like the one on Okewode Hall that can be read as easily and accurately as a modern digital watch.
description_web:
You may have noticed that large sundial at Okewode Hall. This is an advertisement to convince people that it is possible to make a dial that can be read as easily as a modern watch. The trick is to include all the astronomical corrections into the design of the dial, so they do not need to be applied after the dial is read. I intend to describe how I built this dial, and how you can do the same for your camp. I want enough people building and maintaining public dials for Pennsic, that they become the normal way for people to tell time.
I will describe how to calculate the time-marks, lay them out on the dial, mark them with nails, set the gnomon to the correct angle, and calibrate the whole thing once it's hanging on the wall. I will cover construction details and various safety considerations to prevent it from falling and injuring someone.
There **will** be math, specifically some high school-level trigonometry, but you should not let that frighten you away.

name: The Way of Saint James: Pilgrims to Santiago
description_book: We examine the legends, history, battles, miracles, and lore of Spain's *Camino de Santiago*, in period and today, taught by former pilgrims.
description_web: We will examine the legends, history, and lore of the *Camino de Santiago*, with special emphasis on the nature of medieval pilgrimage, sites of special historic, religious, and cultural importance along the route, plus advice for planning and completing the pilgrimage today. Taught by former pilgrims. *¡Buen camino!*

name: Bardic Circles as Theater in the Round
description_book: Rule 1: Don't fall in the fire! Performance techniques for bardic circles: how the audience sees you, how you see performers, working in the space.
description_web: Rule 1: Don't fall in the fire! Performance techniques for bardic circles: how the audience sees you, and how you see the performers. Class includes working with the space, using lyrics in low-light situations, performing sitting or standing, and more! Come to the "Runestone Bardic Circle", 2 pm, Sunday, at Runestone Park; apply your new knowledge and skills!

name: Recreating Historic Glass Beads
description_book: Creating historically accurate glass beads is not hard. It can be done at any skill level, and there are many quality information sources available.
description_web:
Creating historically accurate glass beads is not as hard as you might think. You can make period beads at any skill level! Resources and strategies will be shared with attendees in this class to help get you on the path to making well researched historic glass beads. We will discuss good starting points and first projects. We will also discuss various sources artisans can use to inform their efforts, including the presenter's favorite source, archaeological reports. These reports provide a wealth of information that is not available from museum or other websites.
 
This class is appropriate for beginning bead makers as well as for intermediate to advanced bead makers who have not done much research into period beads. While the presenter's own work will be used as examples throughout the class, experienced bead makers are welcome and invited to attend to discuss their own early projects, or share additional resources and strategies with the class.

name: How to Brew a Tree, Part I: Sap
description_book: Learn about various saps and fluids that trees contribute to the brewer’s tool box. Age 21 or over.
description_web: When considering tree sap as an ingredient for alcoholic beverages, there are several options available to the brewer, several of which were available in our periods and localities of study. I will present the various saps and fluids that trees contribute to the brewer’s toolbox. Alcohol will be served. IDs will be checked. Must be 21 or over.
fee_itemization: Handout is 7 pages at 0.15 per page (at Staples)

name: From Queen Teuta of Illyria to Grainne Ni Mhaille
description_book: We'll explore the rich history of women in piracy: why they took to the sea and how they shaped their own stories.

name: How to Look Period on a Budget
description_book: Money is tight, but you can still look like you belong in period. Learn where to find discount feast gear, fabric, jewelry, and camping gear.
description_web: Money is tight, but you can still look like you belong in period. Learn where to find discount feast gear, fabric, jewelry, and camping gear. You don't need to look shabby just because your pockets don't have a lot of jingle. This class is designed for newcomers but everyone is welcome!

name: Intermediate Middle Eastern Drumming: 7/8 and 10/8
description_book: Add to your drumming repertoire: Learn rhythms played in 7/8 and 10/8. *Samai, Curcuna, Laz*, and variations are covered. Beginners welcome.

name: Beginner Dance: *Branles*
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn fun *branles* from 16th-century France.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then introduce you to fun *branles* from 16th-century France.

name: Introduction to *Go*
description_book: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.
description_web: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.

name: Advanced *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block-working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block-working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
fee_itemization: materials

instructor: Viscountess Kamiilah al Sudanii um Zoom
name: Beginning Middle Eastern Dance
description_book: Covers the basic movements that this lovely art form is based on, including drills! Intermediate and Advanced welcome. I'll make it harder for you!
description_web: Covers the basic movements that this lovely art form is based on, including drills! Intermediate and Advanced welcome. Kamiilah will add layers and make it harder for you!

name: Music in the Italian *Novelle*
description_book: Read some 14th-16th-century Italian music mentioned in literature of the time and discuss the authors' depictions. All instruments and voices welcome.
description_web: Several 14th-16th-century Italian works of literature survive which contain descriptions of music performances. We'll read through some of the surviving music mentioned in these works and compare what we do to how the authors describe the musical performances. All instrumentalists and vocalists are welcome.

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own; class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: weaving materials, string

name: Advanced Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn advanced forms of throwing. A hands-on session is included. Should have experience using thrown weapons. Limit: 20 participants.

name: Introduction to Irish Frame Drum, the *Bodhrán*
description_book: Basic instruction in *bodhrán* including most-used rhythms, session etiquette. Bring a drum if you have one; some loaners available.
description_web: Learn how to choose and care for the *bodhrán*; what makes a good tipper; tune and set structure, how to identify and play jig, reel, hornpipe, slip jig, polka rhythms; etiquette; jokes. Learn secret arcane hand gestures to amaze and stun your listeners. Demonstration of how to adapt *bodhrán* drumming to period music. Bring a *bodhrán* if you have one. A few loaner drums will be available. Teens and older welcomed.

name: Tarl's Little Pole Arm Tourney
description_book: The tourney is open to all inspected heavy fighters. Weapons must conform to Pennsic standards. Format is two 45-minute bear-pit sessions.
description_web: Welcome to the 12th annual Pole Arm Tourney. The tourney is open to all inspected heavy fighters. Weapons must conform to Pennsic standards. The format is two 45-minute bear-pit sessions, with a half-time show in between. Fighters of all skill levels are encouraged to attend. Enjoy a great time fighting the "One True Weapon's Form".

name: Youth Armored Combat Afternoon Session
description_book: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.
description_web: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.

name: Scroll Wordsmithing for Everyone
description_book: Wordsmithing for scrolls is a vital part of the scribal arts that anyone can do. Come learn how to get started.

name: Responsible Performing in the SCA
description_book: Serve your own dreams of performing to adoring crowds in balance with serving the event.
description_web: Learn the balance between being a spotlight hog and waiting to be invited to perform. Learn to work with event staff, Royalty, and Baronage to schedule when and where your performance will enhance the event. You may be brilliant, but don’t risk grandstanding even by mistake.

name: Juggling Practice
description_book: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.
description_web: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.

name: Learning to Play the Big Drum (*Tupan/Davul*)
description_book: This class will cover basic and intermediate technique on the *davul*, as well as brief notes about buying or building one. Some loaners available.

name: *Furioso all'Italiana*
description_book: Come learn *Furioso all'Italiana*, a 16th-century Italian dance for sets of three couples. Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.
description_web: Come learn *Furioso all'Italiana*, an elegant and elaborate 16th-century Italian dance for sets of three couples. Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.

location: Denys The Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp  EO8)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: Daily meetings for those in any 12-step program such as AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: We welcome all in AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc., who are in any 12-step program to the 4:00 pm daily meeting at EO8 Denys The Decadent's Camp.

location: Gunnery Point on Mt Eislinn (Top of Mt Eislinn)
name: Period Black Powder Firearms: Safety and Handling
description_book: Firearm safety, handling, and shooting procedures for small arms and artillery, 1320-1600. Powder and match supplied by teacher. Ages 18+.
description_web: Firearm safety, handling, and shooting procedures for small arms and artillery, 1320-1600. Owners of period arms are requested/encouraged to bring them and help with coaching newer shooters. Powder and match are supplied by instructor. Ages 18+. Handouts for all classes: http://www.3fgburner.net/#info.

instructor: Viscountess Kamiilah al Sudanii um Zoom
name: Intermediate Middle Eastern Dance Combos
description_book: Kamiilah will be teaching some of her favorite combinations of movements, and her own style of lead-and-follow dance! If we have time, we will zill!
description_web: Kamiilah is the fearless leader of modern dance troupe RockaBelly, and is ready to share her sassy lead-and-follow combos with all of you! If we have time, we will also learn zill patterns specific to the movements.

location: Orluk Oasis (W10, on the lake near the peninsula.)
name: Beginner Steps to *Saidi* Rhythms
description_book: Class will include an easy-to-learn beginner dance to *Saidi*, a popular Middle Eastern rhythm.
description_web: Class will include an easy-to-learn beginner dance to *Saidi*, a popular Middle Eastern rhythm. While it will be taught as a basic choreography, students will also practice improvisational portions and how to use this dance as a framework for creating their own choreography. Live drumming! Refreshments and conversation after! Join us in Orluk Oasis.

name: Embellishing 16th-Century Italian Dance Music
description_book: This class will give you practical tools for embellishing late period Renaissance dance music.
description_web: This class will give you practical tools for embellishing late period Renaissance dance music. We will look at some sources for period-appropriate embellishments and will write out embellishments for music that will be in the balls. Participants should be able to play *Gracca Amorosa* and *Bizzaria d'Amore* fluently.

name: KW Thrown Weapons Marshals Opening Meeting
description_book: Meeting for all Thrown Weapons Marshals.

name: Scribal Isn't Scary: Scribing 101
description_book: Come and explore the basics of the scribal arts: the tools and materials, the tricks of the trade, the possibilities for getting started.
description_web:
Ever wonder about the people who make the beautiful awards that are given out at Court and competitions? Ever want to be one? Ever considered becoming a scribe, but said to yourself, “I could never do that” – or thought that it’s too hard, too time consuming, too expensive?
Come and explore the basics of the scribal arts: the tools and materials, the tricks of the trade, the possibilities for getting started. This is a chance for those both new to the SCA and new to scribing (calligraphy and illumination) to poke through an experienced scribe's “toybox”. If you’ve gotten a start on scribing but have questions, quandaries, and examples of your work so far, bring them. One of the best ways to improve your skills is to share with other artisans.

name: Creating Kingdom-Sized Performing Arts Programs
description_book: Organizing performers is different from performing. Come hear "Lessons Learned" for large scale PA programs for kingdoms or large events.
description_web:
Organizing performers is different from performing. Come hear my suggestions and lessons learned for large scale performing arts programs for kingdoms and large, war-sized events.

Share my "Lessons Learned" from running the SCA 50 Year Performing Arts Program, serving as Kingdom MOAS Deputy for Performing Arts in Atlantia for 3 years, Guild Leader for the Atlantia Performing Arts Guild for 2 years, Co-Lead for *Commedia*, Foolery, and Physical Theater track at Pennsic University for 6 years, creating the Performing Arts Program at War of the Wings (Atlantia) and a myriad of other organizational jobs in SCA Performing Arts over 25 years. Come with your own ideas, and we’ll discuss what you can do back home.

name: Pennsic Archery Champions Practice/Tryouts
description_book: All archers wishing to make the Pennsic Archery Champions' Teams should attend these practices.
description_web: All archers wishing to be on the Pennsic Archery Champions' Teams should attend these practices. See either the East Kingdom Captain General or the Midrealm Lt General for more details.

name: Introduction to *Commedia*
description_book: Are you curious about "those *commedia* performers?" Join Lady Avelina del Dolce for the first introductory *commedia* class at Bog University!
description_web: You may see us perform at the Performing Arts Amphitheater and Pavilion at Pennsic, SCA events, feasts and parties. So are you curious about "those *commedia* performers?" Join Lady Avelina del Dolce for the first introductory *commedia* class at Bog University! This class will cover the basics of *commedia dell'arte* and include information from Lady Sophia the Orange's "Intro to *Commedia*" handout along with content from a *commedia* workshop Avelina recently attended by the professional performance troupe, *Pazzi Lazzi.* You don't want to miss the foolish fun!

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP Read-Through Cast and Crew
description_book: Space in use
description_web: Space in use

name: Period Drinking Songs
description_book: Sing a variety of period songs about drinking from across Europe, including easy unison and rounds, as well as harmony with up to four parts.
description_web: Learn to sing a variety of period songs about consuming alcoholic beverages from across Europe. The songs vary in difficulty from easy unison and rounds to harmony with up to four parts, so anyone can participate. Music will be available to take with you. If you have heard of the Pennsic Drinking and Singing Walk or the *Hymni Bacchi*, this is the music we sing. This class might take place in a tent without chairs, so please consider bringing your own.

name: Æthelmearc Scribal College Open Scriptorium
description_book: Open time at the Scribal tents for people who need to work on scrolls or want to consult with experienced scribes and teachers. Use the side gate.
description_web: Open time at the Scribal tents for people who need to work on scrolls or want to consult with experienced scribes and teachers. Use the side gate. We will have tables, chairs, good lighting, and experienced scribes and teachers who can answer questions, help with any issues or direct you to where to get further information on most scribal topics.

name: *Psallite*: Medieval Music for Everyone
description_book: *Psallite* performs troubadour songs, *cantigas*, motets, and other medieval music. All songs in English, with vibrant translations by Mistress Kasha.
description_web:
*Psallite* performs troubadour songs, *cantigas*, motets, and other medieval music. All songs are sung in English, with vibrant translations written by Mistress Kasha.
Featuring Mistress Kasha Alekseeva, Mistress Jadwiga Krzyzanowska, and Master Aaron Drummond.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: Opening Ceremonies (Alternate for Rain)
description_book: In the event of rain, the Opening Ceremonies will be held in the Great Hall.
description_web: In the event of rain, the Opening Ceremonies will be held in the Great Hall.

name: Family Stories in the Bog
description_book: 8 pm - 8:45 pm: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.
description_web: 8 pm - 8:45 pm: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.

name: The Irish Frau: Aibhilin inghean Daibhidh
description_book: Aibhilin, the Irish Frau, debuts mix of music for harp and voice with period songs, SCA works, rousing SCA war songs, with a little humor thrown in!
description_web: Aibhilin, the Irish Frau, performs a mix of music for harp and voice from period songs, modern SCA compositions, to rousing *a capella* SCA war songs. And, of course, a little humor thrown in!

name: Thrown Weapons Night Tournament
description_book: Try to cut glow sticks with axes. Ages 18 and over only.

name: Grand Ball
description_book: Come celebrate after Opening Ceremonies on Saturday night! Enjoy the camaraderie before the war points start in the morning!

name: *i Verdi Confusi*
description_book: Players' Patchwork returns with hilarious antics of *Commedia all'Improvviso*! Of Course! It All Makes Sense Now!
description_web: Players' Patchwork returns with hilarious antics of *Commedia all'Improvviso*! Of Course! It All Makes Sense Now! *Show contains adult-themed content*.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Coffee with Friends of Dr Bob and Bill
description_book: Morning open meeting for those in recovery.
description_web: Morning open meeting for those in recovery.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Youth Armored Combat Morning Session
description_book: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.
description_web: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.

name: The Bayeux Tapestry and the Battle of Hastings
description_book: History is embroidered by the victors! An introduction to the story in the Bayeux Tapestry and the events leading up to the Battle of Hastings.

name: Survey of Rapier Hangers and Sword Belts
description_book: We will look at different styles of later period sword belts, go over design, layout and construction, material options, hardware, and how to wear it.
description_web: Looking to dress up your kit, or maybe just find a place for your sword when not stabbing an opponent? We will take a look at different styles of later period sword belts, go over design, layout and construction, material options, where to find hardware, and how to wear it.

name: Basic Glass Bead Making
description_book: This class will cover the basics of beginning glass beads. A little bit of history but mostly tools, techniques and tricks.
description_web: This class will cover the basics of glass beads. This is a beginner's class. A little bit of history but mostly tools, techniques and tricks. You can bring your own torch or use ours. Supplies will be provided but may be limited. We will work on several basic shapes and go over the use of tools to recreate simple patterns. Children can attend but no one under the age of 15 will be allowed at a torch without their parent being present.
fee_itemization: Gas, glass, slip

name: Pennsic Homes, Part 1: Wagon Homes
description_book: Period carts and wagons, what you must consider to make it a Pennsic camping/storage wagon, or to take it to other events.
description_web: A What-You-Need-to-Consider class. There are many different uses, from kitchens/ showers to sleeping/storage to "gracious living". A brief history discussion of period carts and wagons. Mostly adaptations to make it a Pennsic camping/storage wagon (Do you know the Pennsic Regs?), or to take it to other events. Includes some of my available resources. Also, why these are *not* necessarily out-of-period "Gypsy" *vardos*; various building materials that work or don't work, etc.

name: Lenten Food in Period
description_book: For 40 days out of the year, medieval Christians gave up dairy, eggs, and meat. Find out what they did eat and how delicious it could be.
description_web: Can you imagine giving up cheese, scrambled eggs, and bacon for forty days out of the year? Many Christians from the 10th century into the 16th century did just this but that doesn't mean they went without some form of comfort food. Come to the class to find out what they did eat and how to make some medieval Lenten treats.
fee_itemization: Three dollars for each handout of medieval recipes with the historical recipe and the redaction

name: What the Irish Ate
description_book: What was eaten in traditional Gaelic Ireland.
description_web: What was eaten in traditional Gaelic Ireland, based on historical accounts (to include the "Annals"), *Brehon* law tracts, bardic tales, and archaeology.

name: Welcome to the World of Wicker
description_book: We will be working with round reeds to create a twined basket with many uses. Dyed and flat reeds will be available so you can be creative!
fee_itemization: basket reed, flat and round

instructor: THL Cellach Dhonn inghean Mhic an
name: Beadwork Basics (Class Taught in French)
description_book: This is a hands-on class. We will decorate a small box. Some embroidery stitches will be taught in order to do the beadwork.
description_web: This is a hands-on class. We will decorate a small box. Some embroidery stitches will be taught in order to do the beadwork. Each kit will contain all you need to complete the box. Bring your glasses if you need them; glass beads are small. Class taught in French; bilingual handout.
fee_itemization: $10 per kit

name: La Verdadera Destreza: Researching Spanish Fencing
description_book: Learn about the period and modern writers of this Spanish fencing style and the primary elements that define it. Lecture class.
description_web: Learn about the period and modern writers of this Spanish fencing style and the primary elements that define it. Lecture class.

name: Tales of Viking Age Women
description_book: Stories of women from the Viking Age, with emphasis on the Icelandic Sagas.
description_web: Come hear as Unn Olafsdottir brings to life the stories of the women at the heart of the superb literature known as the Icelandic family sagas.

name: Beyond the HerbWife: Fantasy, History & Herbalists
description_book: Lecture/discussion attempting to separate fact from fiction in our historical idea of herbalists and herb use pre-1650.
description_web: Our modern concept of the role of herbs and herbalists in pre-1650 Europe is a mishmash of fact, fiction, misunderstanding and propaganda. We'll try to identify the most controversial ideas on herbs, women, witches and medical treatment, and give a more balanced, if less satisfying, picture of SCA-period herbalism.
fee_itemization: Simple handout, ~10 pages

name: The Anglo-Saxon Warrior
description_book: Weapons, armor, group fighting styles and defensive systems; what your persona needs to know.
description_web: The topic could fill books, but we’ll cover as much about the armor and weapons of the Anglo-Saxon warrior: swords, shields, spears, and of course, the *seax*, as we can. We’ll also cover fighting styles in groups like the *fyrd*, and defensive systems like the *burgs*. The time range covered will be from invading the British kingdoms, through the Viking wars, folding in some of their techniques to fighting the Normans.

name: Throw Away Your Wristwatch
description_book: Learn period methods of timekeeping to tell time day and night at Pennsic. Discussion of scientific principles so you can tell time anywhere, anytime.
fee_itemization: 30 page color booklet. Cardboard nocturnal. A stick.

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia* before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.
description_web: Young adults will learn the art of Commedia Dell'arte while practicing and creating skits that will be performed at the end of the week.

name: Populace Archery War Point Practice
description_book: Practice for the archery War points. Come warm up and practice before you score your war points.
description_web: Practice for the archery war points. Come warm up and practice before you score your war points

name: Narrow Work and Textiles
description_book: No matter what form your art takes - tablet weaving, lucet, card weaving, *kumihimo*, viking whip cord and many more - you are welcome to join us.
description_web: No matter what form your art takes - tablet weaving, lucet, card weaving, *kumihimo*, viking whip cord and many more - you are welcome to join us. Come show off your creations; see and experience a new form.

name: Metalsmithing and Jewelry
description_book: Metalwork and jewelry go hand-in-hand to make beautiful creations.
description_web: Metalwork and jewelry go hand-in-hand to make beautiful creations.

name: Bouncy Dance Games for Squirrelly Children
description_book: Let's be squirrels! Or trolls! Or fairies! We'll play dance games and learn new moves! (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)
description_web: Let's be squirrels! Or trolls! Or fairies! Bring your little ones for lively dance games designed to teach new moves while we have lots of fun. Silly parents are welcome as well! (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)

name: Mass Project
description_book: Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. We will study a plain chant Mass and a Mass by Josquin.
description_web: Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. We will study a plain chant Mass and a Mass by Josquin. We are going to do a mini-performance at the European Music Expo and a Mass Performance during War Week. Time and Date TBD
fee_itemization: Music Packet

name: Family Stick Weaving
description_book: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.
description_web: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian. Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Fee covers sticks and string; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: Sticks & string

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: List will be open for fighting and instruction from 9 am to noon every day of war week. Pending warpoint battles
description_web: All authorized youth fighters are welcome to participate in the daily activities.  Each day will have different rapier-oriented games and lessons.

name: Thrown Weapons Marshal Training: Part 1
description_book: Learn the SCA rules and guidelines to be a Thrown Weapons Marshal. Parts 1 & 2 required with on-the-range training and written test on Friday.

name: Gathering of the Louds
description_book: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Loud Renaissance instruments with a different focus each day such as *intradas*, polychoral works. Bring chair.
description_web: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Players of loud Renaissance instruments gather just for fun to play different styles of music at each session such as *intradas* and other instrumental processionals and polychoral music. Not sure what these instruments are? Come listen or try one. Instruments will be available to share, but a reading knowledge of music is necessary. Bring a chair, music stand and clothespins.

name: East Kingdom Day
description_book: More Details later!

name: Beginning Scribes' Track
description_book: In this 5-day track, brand-new scribes will learn everything needed to produce award-worthy scrolls based on a 15th-century French manuscript.
description_web:
In this 5-day track, brand-new scribes will learn the skills (Layout, Gothic Calligraphy, Drawing the Flowers, Gilding, and Painting) needed to create award-worthy scrolls based on this 15th-century French manuscript:  http://gallica.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/btv1b53000324z/f1.planchecontact 

In class, you will create a small project suitable for framing.

Fee includes supplies for all 5 days, plus a starter scribal kit to create an 11 x 14" scroll at home.

Students must commit to attending all 5 sessions. Each session will last 2 hours. A different skill will be covered each session.
fee_itemization: Fee includes handouts and supplies for all 5 days, plus a starter scribal kit to create an 11 x 14" scroll at home.  For a detailed list, contact me at hutchnsn@bucknell.edu

name: Tubular-Tablet/Card Weaving: Making Period Cord
description_book: Weave a period cord! Basic knowledge of card/tablet weaving needed. Bring loom, 8 cards, 2 balls of strong fiber, and shuttle. Kits available.
description_web: Learn to weave a European medieval cord based on numerous extant finds. This is an easy technique to learn, but a basic knowledge of card/tablet weaving is needed. Bring a loom that can handle card weaving, 8 cards, 2 balls of strong fiber, and a shuttle. We will warp the loom in class together. Kits will also be available. We will also learn two-holed card weaving and a basic introduction to the uses in period.
fee_itemization: $1 for printing costs for color handout, $3 for cards and fiber in kit.

name: Heraldic Devices, Badges, and You!
description_book: Dress up yourself and your stuff with heraldry. Fly banners, wear flashy clothing, and mark your stuff. How to design and register devices and badges.
description_web: Dress up yourself, your stuff, and your events with armorial bearings such as banners and heraldic clothing. What is a device? What is a badge? How can you design devices and badges which will be registered by the College of Arms? This class is an overview of how armory is most commonly practiced by the College of Arms. This class will increase your chances to successfully register armorial bearings with the College of Arms for use within the Society.
fee_itemization: Cost of producing handouts.

name: English Rosaries and Paternosters
description_book: Discussion of prayer beads (paternosters) in England from the 11th to 16th centuries, especially the impact of the English Reformation.
description_web: This class will focus on prayer beads (paternosters) in England from the 11th to 16th centuries, especially the impact of the English Reformation.

name: Documentation, Data, and Research
description_book: Wrap your head around the fundamentals of good research. Both beginners and those experienced are welcome. Emphasis on free resources.
description_web: Wrap your head around the fundamentals of good research. Whether you are just starting, or need to improve your documentation, I cover structure, strategies, and sources, with emphasis on free resources.
fee_itemization: $1 for handout.

name: Bayeux Tapesty: Panel by Panel
description_book: A look at the Bayeux Tapestry, going panel by panel. Discussion of its history, what it actually says, and what hidden messages it might contain.

name: Stitching *Temari*: *Kiku* Pattern
description_book: Learn to mark and stitch the classic *kiku*, or chrysanthemum pattern. Kit is three colors of floss, ball base, and marking thread, or bring your own.
description_web: Learn to mark and stitch the classic *kiku* or chrysanthemum pattern on a Japanese *temari* ball. We will start the ball in the class. You'll learn the basics of the stitch, and finish it outside class. Kit is three colors of floss, ball base, and marking thread, or bring your own. For those that have taken the class before, we will get fancy with the *kiku*.
fee_itemization: materials to stitch one ball, plus enough to begin several more

name: 12th-Century Women's Clothing
description_book: An overview of 12th-century women's clothing, including the elusive bliaut.
description_web: An overview of 12th-century women's clothing, including the elusive bliaut. This class examines period sources outside of the Chartres Portal Sculpture box to explore how women's clothing was made in the 12th century.

name: Charting Sion-Style Colorwork
description_book: Learn to chart the colorwork designs from the Sion knit purses to create your own Sion-style purse using colored pencils and knitters' graph paper.
description_web: Learn the basics of creating your own colorwork knitting patterns, using the Sion purses (14th-century Switzerland) as a starting point, and incorporating your own designs and heraldry to develop a one-of-a-kind purse (or other knitted item). Class will use colored pencils and knitters' graph paper to create charts. No hands-on knitting will be taught in this class.

name: Primer on Heraldic Activities in the SCA
description_book: A class for newcomers on heraldic activities in the SCA, from registering names and armory, to field and tourney heraldry, to the Order of Precedence.
description_web: A class for newcomers on heraldic activities in the SCA, from registering names and armory, to field and tourney heraldry, to the Order of Precedence.

name: Youth Theatre
description_book: For kids ages 6-12 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through story telling, acting, and producing their very own play!
description_web: For kids ages 6-12 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through story telling, acting, and producing their very own play! Come join us as we build a theatre show from the ground up, giving younger kids a creative outlet for all that pent up camping energy! Children 12 and under must have a parent or guardian present.

name: Beginning *Atlatl*
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively.

name: Drop Spinning 101
description_book: Want to learn to drop spin or have had a hard time picking it up? Come and learn using a high whorl spindle. Spindles and wool will be provided.
description_web: Want to learn to drop spin or have had a hard time picking it up? Come and learn using a high whorl spindle. Spindles and wool will be provided. Spindles can be purchased for $3.00.

name: Making Your Own Watercolors
description_book: Using period pigments, and natural, period binders, students will learn how to make their own pan watercolors.
description_web: Using period pigments, and natural, period binders, students will learn how to make their own pan watercolors. Students will leave the class with at least one full pan of watercolor, with the option to make more.
fee_itemization:
Handout will be a printed and hand-stitched chapbook, done in a period style.

Material fee is for the pigments and materials to make the paint, and for the pan to put them in. Students may make more than one, for an additional material fee.

name: Body Mechanics for Beginning/Intermediate Dancers
description_book: All levels welcome! A survey of nonverbal cues and body mechanics to enhance everyone's dance experience. We'll learn a dance along the way!

name: *Shogi*
description_book: We'll go over the basic rules of *Shogi* or "Japanese Chess", and describe a few historic variants.

location: Good Friends Camp (N-01, usually on St. Lawrence)
name: Coptic Sketch Book
description_book: Students will build a small Coptic sketch book with wood covers and exposed spine.
description_web:
New last year: Students will build a Coptic-stitched sketch book with wood covers and exposed spine using techniques born in Egypt in the 4th century. Students are encouraged bring their own cutting board, rotary cutter/X-acto, and metal ruler, if they have them. (Binding tools will be loaned, if needed, however.) 

Fee ($10) includes pre-drilled wood boards, paper, linen thread, and a detailed handout.
fee_itemization: Fee includes pre-drilled wood boards, paper, linen thread, and a detailed handout.

name: Topics in Basic Heraldry
description_book: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory skills for consulting at Pennsic Herald's Point. Dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point.
description_web: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory submission skills necessary to consult at Pennsic Herald's Point. Exact dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point at the beginning of the War. All newer heralds are strongly encouraged to attend at least one of these classes prior to volunteering at Herald's Point.

name: Punching and Drifting for Blacksmiths
description_book: This will be a demo and discussion on punching and drifting holes to exact sizes and shapes.

name: Japanese Stab Binding: Make a Book in Under 1 Hour
description_book: Make two books in an hour using the stab binding method of Japan. No handout, as we will focus on the craft rather than the history.
description_web: Come make two books in no time at all using the ancient stab binding method of Japan. There is no handout, as we will focus on the craft rather than the history, but a card with reference sites will be available. Supplies are limited to 6.
fee_itemization: Beeswax, Paper for book pages, decorative paper for book covers and linen binding thread.

name: Unbelted Champions Battle (Melée)
description_book: description to follow
description_web:
TENTATIVE:
Format: Last Man Standing – winning side takes the point
Number of Participants: 40 fighters per side
Restrictions: None (fighters may participate in this battle and Heroics)
Setup: Open Field (traditional space)
Time Limit: Not timed
Number of Run Throughs: 1
War Points: 1

name: Ottoman Singing
description_book: Learning to sing the 15th-16th-century Ottoman compositions, *Amed nesim-i subh-dem* and *Hem kamer hem zühre vû hem müşterî der âsuman.*
description_web: We will be teaching two Ottoman compositions from the 15th-16th centuries, as well as reviewing songs taught last year. This music is typically performed with singing. As such, we will be teaching a singing class to learn these songs in the original Ottoman Turkish language. What will you learn and experience: 15th-16th-century Seljuk/Ottoman songs and their history; the musical modality *Makam Rast*; pronunciation of Ottoman Turkish and Persian along with a brief history and etymology, learning in the traditional *Meşk* learning style, as well as appropriate Ottoman customs. The five classes will be progressive; however, students may join in when they wish, although attendance at all the classes is strongly encouraged. Students may join the class's Facebook page in advance to orient themselves to the song and class: https://www.facebook.com/groups/398762226986519/
fee_itemization: Handout

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, Thursday, 8/10 (time and place to be determined).

name: Pennsic Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! Singing in the Choir is an intense and rewarding experience with a concert Thursday War Week.
description_web: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! This year's concert theme is "A Medieval Christmas" The repertoire includes pieces by Hassler, King Henry VIII, Praetorius and Morley, conducted by Lady Siri Toivosdotter. Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on Thursday evening of War Week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is helpful, but not required if you learn the music in advance. Sheet music and audio tracks are available online at https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsicxliiichoirs

name: Rapier Bear Pit Tourney
description_book: A no-frills classic bear pit. Three passes, winner stays, three fights maximum. Everyone welcome. Fight until you drop. Lots of prizes!
description_web: Nothing fancy here: a classic bear bit tourney. Three passes, winner stays, three fights maximum. Every skill level welcome. Bring your best, and fight until you can't fight any more. Prize for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place. If you've ever felt like you didn't get enough fencing in at Pennsic, here's your answer. Tournament begins 1 pm or immediately following the Pennsic Rapier Championships Tourney. If the Championship are running late, we will end the bear pit just before the Championships begin. Please be flexible.

name: Advanced Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn advanced forms of throwing. A hands-on session is included. Should have experience using thrown weapons. Limit: 20 participants.

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: Basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 4-part class; different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*
Day 4- *Kashlimah* and other strange stuff

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: A Hand a Day: Faux Arabic Calligraphy
description_book: Designing and practicing Arabic hands to be used with an English text.
description_web: Not everyone speaks the language of their persona, but would love to be able to figure out what it says on their scroll. We will explore this with pen and ink, and an appropriate "library petting zoo" will be available.

name: Unbelted Alternates Battle (Melée)
description_book: description to follow
description_web:
TENTATIVE:
This is a “for fun and camaraderie” battle fought by the alternates to the unbelted champions (unbelted alternates only; no Heroic Champions). This is NOT a war point battle and will run immediately following the unbelted champions battle.

name: Belted Champions Battle (Melée)
description_book: description to follow
description_web:
TENTATIVE:
Format: Last Man Standing; winning side takes the point. 
Number of Participants: 25 fighters per side. 
Restrictions: The sitting Crowns of the Middle, East, Aethelmearc, and Atlantia may not participate (fighters may participate in this battle and Heroics). 
Setup: Open Field (traditional space). 
Time Limit: Not timed. 
Number of Run Throughs: 1. 
War Points: 1.

name: SCA Lunch Taverns 101
description_book: How to plan, manage, and run a successful lunch tavern at an SCA event. Topics will cover menu planning, budgeting, preparation, and day of operation.
