description_web: How to plan, manage, and run a successful lunch tavern at an SCA event. Topics will cover menu planning, budgeting, preparation, and day of operation.

name: Gold and Glass, Hands-on *Verre Églomisé*/Gilding
description_book: A make-and-take class on gilding glass! Learn the history of *verre églomisé* and make beautiful glass art! Talk of other glass/gold combos in period.
description_web: Learn to gild glass and draw on it, paint it, and seal it! A technique dating back to the Romans used by modern artists, *verre églomisé* is versatile and beautiful. We will talk about the history of gold and glass, and other uses like mosaic *tesserae*, fuming, Roman gold, etc. Participants will make a piece in class and take materials away for a second piece. Feel free to bring a small geometric or simple design with you, "mirrored" ("flipped horizontally" as we work on the back of the piece).
fee_itemization: Gold leaf, glass, paint, sealing varnish, etching tools (sewing needles set in wooden dowel rods), black cloth to work on, scrub brushes, jars for paint, cotton balls, and containers (all will be taken home with attendees!). Attendees will gild a piece of glass in class, and then get handed a pre-made one to work on in class (to work around drying time).

name: An Elizabethan Guide to Chocolate
description_book: You have been teleported to 1600 and you are tasting chocolate for the first time. Come learn all the fascinating facts about this new delight!
description_web: You have been teleported to 1600 and you are tasting chocolate for the first time. Come learn all the fascinating facts about this new delight!

name: Medieval Business Practices
description_book: Explore how modern accounting practices evolved following the changes in business during the Middle Ages and Renaissance.
description_web: The most basic accounting techniques used by businesses worldwide today had their start in 12th- and 13th-century Europe, and continued being refined throughout the Renaissance. This class teaches about the sweeping changes in trade that made this evolution necessary...and also changed the face of Europe.

name: Bardic Circles 101
description_book: Entertainment for the people, by the people! Find out what a bardic circle is, etiquette, where to find material, and how to participate.
description_web: Entertainment for the people, by the people! Find out what a bardic circle is, etiquette, where to find material, and how to participate. We won't actually be performing, but we will play a game to give you an idea of how circles work. Conveniently, there's the Runestone (least intimidating) Bardic Circle at 2 pm at Runestone Hill, so you can put your new knowledge and skills to use!

name: Book Lovers' Tea
description_book: Please bring your favorite book(s) to discuss. Books with medieval themes and topics are encouraged but not required. Be ready to take notes!
description_web: Please bring your favorite book(s) to discuss. Books with medieval themes and topics are encouraged but not required. Bring paper and pencil to jot down new authors to check out. Iced tea, water and treats will be provided.

name: Food Preservation Methods and History
description_book: Learn a bit about the various methods documented to before 1650 for preserving foods. Samples may be available.
fee_itemization: Copies of handout

name: Arabic 101: Reading and Writing
description_book: Learn to recognize letters and words for research, A&S projects, etc. This class is hands-on! You'll be writing and reading by the end of class.
description_web: People all over the medieval world used Arabic language. From China to Mauritania in dar al-Islam, and throughout Europe, Arabic was a part of life. This class introduces the Arabic alphabet with exercises designed to acclimate participants to the structure of the letters and language. We will use modern and extant sources; participants will be able to write and read key Arabic words by the end of class. While the lesson will be useful for personas in all regions and cultures, the dialect and names will skew toward the Maghreb region. This is the 2nd part of a two-part series, the first of which focuses on speaking and pronunciation. Class guide will be available at: http://www.talaalzahra.com/pennsic-university
fee_itemization: $1 for handout printing

name: Pennsic 101
description_book: The Drums of War begin to Beat. It sounded like so much fun... ...but you've never done anything like this, so... now what do you do?
description_web: PENNSIC 101:The Drums of War begin to Beat. It sounded like so much fun... ...but you've never done anything like this, so... now what do you do? Pennsic is a most wonderful SCA event and attending this class will help you to have the best time possible.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Populace Archery War Point Shoot
description_book: Populace Archery War Point will consist of three challenging shoots: a clout (100 yards), soldier shoot, and castle window (timed).
description_web: Populace Archery War Point will consist of three challenging shoots: a clout (100 yards), soldier shoot, and castle window (timed). Come and score points for your kingdom. Sunday's populace shoot: 11 am to 5 pm; Monday 11 am to 5 pm; Tuesday 11 am to 7 pm; Wednesday 11 am to 5 pm; and Friday 9 am to 12 pm.

name: Intermediate English Country Squares
description_book: Two dances with patterns that work out beautifully despite your doubts of how you were just arranged. Learn *Newcastle* and *Parson's Farewell*.
description_web: Two dances that have "aha" moments when the patterns work out beautifully despite your doubts of how you were just arranged. Learn, practice, or refine *Newcastle* and *Parson's Farewell*.

name: Tarot the Card Game
description_book: The game of tarot, the trick-taking game. We will play it.
description_web: We will go over the rules of tarot, the card game, and play it.

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. No fee. String provided.

name: Viking Dairy Processing
description_book: A hands-on class to learn about milk processing and cheese-making in the Viking age.
description_web: Milk and milk products were essential to surviving Scandinavian winters and long sea voyages during the Viking era. Join us for a hands-on class which will focus on dairying and cheese products from the Norse world. Starting with milk, which would go bad rather quickly, and using culture and equipment, we will turn it into four (or more) products that not only last well on their own, but can be used to preserve other food. Our *mjólk* (milk) will turn into *skyr* (cheese), *mysa* (whey), *smjör* (butter), and *aft* (buttermilk). This will be done using period tools.

name: Starting a Thrown Weapons Program in a Local Group
description_book: We will discuss how to start a thrown weapons program in your shire, barony, and other local groups.

name: But ... I Can't Draw! (or Paint!)
description_book: A quick, easy practicum in tracing methods and painting/shading techniques, both period and modern. No handout. Fee for consumables.
description_web: A quick, easy practicum in tracing methods and painting/shading techniques, both period and modern. No handout. Fee for consumables.
fee_itemization: $5 for paper, paint, other consumables

name: Zen of Belly Dance Performing
description_book: Learn techniques you can use to relax, tune out distractions, tune into your audience, and enjoy your great dance performance!

name: Heroic Champions (Single Combat)
description_book: description to follow
description_web:
TENTATIVE:
Format: Single Combat; the side with the most bouts won takes the point
Number of Participants: Each side will select 14 champions composed of 4 unbelted fighters and 10 belted fighters; each side will have a belted fighter held in reserve in case of a tie. Double kills will be refought until there is a victor.
Restrictions: The sitting Crowns of the Middle, East, Aethelmearc, and Atlantia may not participate. Other sitting Kings and all sitting Princes are eligible to participate in the single combat
Setup: Open Field (traditional space)
Time Limit: Not timed
Number of Run Throughs: 15 bouts
War Points: 1

name: Scribal Workshop: The Armenian Gospels of Gladzor
description_book: This 4-part, 4-day hands-on Intermediate to Advanced workshop will cover the skills necessary to create a scroll based upon the Gladzor book.
description_web: This 4-part, 4-day hands-on Intermediate to Advanced workshop will cover the skills necessary to create a scroll based upon the Gladzor book: a fascinating combination of zoomorphic images, whitework, gold and inkwork. A faux script has been created to compliment this workshop.
fee_itemization:
Kit Includes:
Black and White handout/Typed
Color copies of the Gladzor book carpet pages  1 per student
1 sable paintbrush, size 1
1 sable paintbrush, size 2
Palette with all paint needed for class
Arches Watercolor paper 8x10 - personal piece
Arches watercolor paper 11x14
Colored inks, red, blue, black
Quill tip nibs
Arabic gold paint

name: Social Media for Fun and Non-Profit
description_book: Social media is a fact of modern life. Niche organizations and businesses can benefit but only if done right. Learn how!
description_web: Social media is a fact of modern life. Niche businesses and organizations like the SCA can benefit but only if it's done right. Instructor is the voice of three billion-dollar brands in her mundane life and travels to train organizations and non-profits across the US. Learn how to administer groups, how to create ads for events **and** recruiting, how to enable social media without diluting events (or running afoul of legal issues) even ways to use social media for your SCA-focused business. Ideal for officers of baronies and kingdoms, business owners or group communicators of any kind.
fee_itemization: Copies

name: Complex Japanese Braids in Period
description_book: Lecture with an overview of period Japanese braids, including a discussion of the different techniques, how the braids were used, and extant pieces.
description_web: Lecture with an overview of period Japanese braids, including a discussion of the different techniques, how the braids were used, and the challenges in documenting period braids.

name: How To Make Fancy Pants
description_book: The construction and wearing of Renaissance pants such as slops, “pumpkin pants,” and *Pluderhosen*. Just what every Landsknecht needs.
description_web: This class is about the construction and wearing of Renaissance pants such as slops, “pumpkin pants,” and *Pluderhosen*. Just what every Landsknecht needs, though it will help with any late-period pants. Might talk about the famous Janet Arnold Upsala/Sture *Pluderhosen* with the “bum” as well as other cool pant stuff.

name: The 16th-Century Italian *Zimarra*
description_book: An examination and discussion of the 16-century Italian *zimarra* with an overview of construction methods.
description_web: The 16th-century Italian woman's wardrobe would not be complete without the fashionable and popular overcoat, the *zimarra*. This essential garment was a key component of Eleonora di Toledo's wardrobe. This class will examine the salient physical details of this garment such as color and textile choices, its place in history as well as its importance in society at large. This is not a construction class; however, there will be an overview of the construction methods that can be used to make one as well as resources to obtain the materials to make your own.

name: Livery Collars
description_book: An exploration of this elite accessory, with a focus on earlier examples and historical significance, plus a discussion of how to adapt to SCA use.
description_web: An exploration of this elite accessory, with a focus on earlier examples and historical significance, plus a discussion of how to adapt to SCA use. Some new information from previous years' classes.

name: *The Belle of Battle*: A Play Reading
description_book: Sit back, enjoy the play, or join in by taking on a role in this reading of this new Elizabethan-style comedy in which no one is who they seem to be.
description_web: Sit back and enjoy the play or join in by taking on a role in this reading of this new Elizabethan-style comedy in which no one is who they seem to be.

name: Rose Beads! A Class for Teens and Youth
description_book: Use rose petals to make beads for paternoster or bracelet. (YouthU/TeenU, 12-17)
description_web: Make rose beads the medieval way! Using a mortar and pestle, we will create beads (which will need time to dry) to be used for a paternoster or a bracelet. Bring a mortar and pestle if you have one, as well as a charm or cross for the end. (These will be made available if you do not have one.) We can also make a tassel out of embroidery floss. (YouthU/TeenU, 12-17)

name: Magic as a Performing Art
description_book: Magic in theory and practice. Three period tricks taught by professional magician. Real methods. Class sworn to secrecy.
description_web: Theory and practice of magic as a performance art, taught by a professional magician. We will cover three period tricks from Scot’s *Discoverie of Witchcraft*, 1584, for close-up, parlor, and stage. The class will be sworn to secrecy and real working methods will be taught.

name: Voices and Viols: *Gamben und Singen*
description_book: Featuring 15th-16th-century German polyphony. Sight singing a plus for singers, but not essential. Viols tune to A440.
description_web: *Zu musizieren und jubilieren steht mir all mein Sinn!* This year, we will focus on compositions by German composers such as Ludwig Senfl and Heinrich Finck (and some Flemish composers who set German texts, like Heinrich Isaac). Sight singing a plus for singers, but not essential. Viols tune to A=440. (*Vielles*/violin family instruments also welcome!)

name: SCA 101: Newcomers' Q&A
description_book: New to the SCA? First event? Don't know what to do? Stop here and get your questions answered!
description_web: So, you're new to the SCA? What do you do? Where do you go? Stop in here at the Newcomer's Q&A. We have answers and are here to help! Come meet with newcomer guides from around the Knowne World and learn about the endless possibilities.

name: Wire Weaving
description_book: A class on the ancient art of wire weaving, sometimes called Viking Knit. This class is perfectly suitable for beginners!

name: *Doppie Mutanze* from Compasso (Double Galliards)
description_book: Expand your improv skills with new double galliard variations from 1560! Familiarity with basic galliard steps recommended.
description_web: Expand your improv skills with new double galliard variations! Familiarity with basic galliard steps recommended. We will learn several variations from Lutio Compasso's 1560 work, *Ballo della Gagliarda*.
fee_itemization: 2 pages photocopied.

name: Multiplayer Period Chess
description_book: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.
description_web: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.

name: Tinsmithing
description_book: A basic but complete course in the fundamentals of tinsmithing. Students will make a glass-globed hurricane lamp with hand tools.
description_web: A basic but complete course in the fundamentals of tinsmithing. Students will make a glass-globed hurricane lamp with hand tools.
fee_itemization: Includes materials for project and handouts.

name: Pennsic Youth Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 19 to learn period vocal music and perform as part of the Known World Choirs Concert, Thursday War Week.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 19 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella* with Deonna von Aachen. We will rehearse 12-1 pm Sunday, August 6, through Wednesday, August 9. Performance will be part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/10, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.) More information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-youth-choir

name: Rehearsal (Closed): *i Sebastiani*
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: How to Teach Youth to Throw
description_book: For those who facilitate Thrown Weapons, this class will help you learn to teach youths (ages 5-17) to throw.

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn how to throw axes, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit: 25 participants. No experience needed.

name: Come and Get Your Fill
description_book: Take your doumbek rhythms to the next level! This class focuses on playing "fills" and filled versions of popular Middle Eastern rhythms.
description_web:
Take your *darbuka*/doumbek rhythms to the next level! This intermediate class will help you begin to play filled versions of popular Middle Eastern rhythms. Then you will learn to play fills in between phrases/patterns to help you add even more style and texture to your playing.

Knowledge of basic Middle Eastern rhythms (i.e., *maqsoum, malfuf, ayoub, saidi*) and intermediate *darbuka* playing experience/technique are strongly recommended.

name: Interlaced Herringbone / *Kutchwork* / *Marash* II
description_book: Interlaced herringbone medallions and complex borders. Pattern reading and making. Beginning class is required.
description_web: Interlaced herringbone medallions and complex borders. Pattern reading and making. Beginner class or prior experience required.
fee_itemization: Handout packet includes hoop, fabric, needle, floss, instructions, research CD

name: Chocolate in Late Period
description_book: Learn how Spanish explorers brought cacao beans and the Aztec technique of making *xocolatl* or chocolate to Europe.
description_web: In the 16th century, Spanish explorers brought back precious cacao beans and the Aztec technique of making *xocolatl* or chocolate, a bitter drink. Learn the brief history within period of how chocolate was made and used.

name: *Cloisonné* Enameling
description_book: Come learn *cloisonné* enamel reproduction. Will leave with a finished item. Max of 8 participants.
description_web: Come learn *cloisonné* enamel reproduction. We use non-leaded, vitreous enamel on copper discs. We will have some simple Byzantine and Saxon style examples that you may reproduce, or come with a simple design, that would be easy to shape with copper wire. We will use modern tools, but discuss medieval tools. If you have jewelry making tools, please bring them along as we only have a limited supply. You will leave with a finished item. Max of 8 participants.
fee_itemization:
$1 fee for information handout.
$9 recovering costs of enamel and copper and wire

name: How to Run "It Takes My Child to Raze a Village"
description_book: The basics of running a successful family-focused event.
fee_itemization:
$5 - How to Run ITMC booklet
$15 - 3-ring bound book of 50+ Youth Activities including booklet

name: Growing Period Herbs and Vegetables
description_book: Container gardening, raised beds, and furrows. Sunlight and soil needs. It's thyme to grow your own food!
description_web: We will cover how to prepare the soil, plant, and raise all kinds of period herbs and vegetables. Everything from small container gardening for apartments to large beds for homeowners. How to adjust soil pH and NPK, and why the methods used in period have lasted for centuries. We will examine why blood meal, bone meal, and kelp meal are still used widely today.

name: The Basics Of Leather-Working: Getting Started
description_book: Interested in leather-working but not sure how to begin? What tools do I need? Choose the right leather for your project. We'll learn all that here!
description_web: Interested in leather-working but not sure how to begin? What tools do I need? Choose the right leather for your project. We'll learn all that here!
fee_itemization: $1.00 per handout for printing costs.

name: Girona Tapestry, Tapestry of Creation
description_book: Discussion of the mysterious 11th-century Spanish embroidery, its symbolism, how it was made. Learn the stitch with a small kit.
description_web: We will discuss the 11th-century Spanish tapestry (really an embroidery), its symbolism, and how it was made. Bring your embroidery supplies and learn the *Kloster* stitch, the stitch that was used to create this mysterious wall hanging.

name: Viking Penannular Brooches
description_book: A brief history on the Viking penannular brooch. Construction based on historical finds using hand tools and shop-made jig.
description_web: Learn to construct a simple penannular brooch using basic tools in copper using hand tools and a simple shop-made jig
fee_itemization:
Metal 4
Abrasives 1
handout 1

name: Chivalry Then and Now
description_book: The SCA is based on an ideal of chivalry. But how does our idea of chivalry relate to history? We'll talk about what we can learn from the past.
description_web: Chivalry is a key ideal in the SCA. However, different people have different ideas about what chivalry means. The same thing was true in the Middle Ages. We'll spend time learning about some of the debates about chivalry in period and what they can teach us about our own ideals.

name: Blood and Gores: Tailoring the Tunic
description_book: The tunic might be a simple garment, but some tips and tricks of geometric construction can make a tunic fit you just right! All body types welcome.
description_web: The tunic might be a simple garment, but some tips and tricks of geometric construction can make a tunic fit you just right! Come learn some measuring, cutting, and adjusting techniques to get a tunic tailored to you. All body types welcome.

name: Tournament Heralding and List Running
description_book: YouthU class for teens and tweens (and adults) who want to get involved in kingdom tournaments such as Crown Tournament and K&Q Rattan Championships.

name: *Ifriquiya*: Medieval North Africa
description_book: A brief historical overview of North Africa in the Middle Ages, starting with the Muslim conquest to around 1500.

name: Newcomer's Social
description_book: A Social for newcomers to Pennsic and the SCA to meet up and ask questions. Light refreshments will be provided.
description_web: If you are new to Pennsic or the SCA, please join the chatelaines of the Known World as we host a Newcomer's Social just for you. Bring any questions you have for us to answer. Stop by for a few minutes or a few hours. Light refreshments will be provided.

name: Juggling Practice
description_book: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.
description_web: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.

name: Very Old Rounds and Drinking Songs
description_book: People have been singing rounds, singing about drinking, and singing **while** drinking for centuries. A collection of simple, fun (and PG-13) songs!
description_web: Pre-1600 rounds and drinking songs in English, some in Latin. A packet of sheet music and lyrics will be available to keep.

name: How to Teach European Dance: A Workshop
description_book: Come ready to practice teaching a dance. Feedback will be given live on how to work with your students during your dance and after. All welcome.
description_web: Looking to become a more effective teacher? Or, always wanted to teach but not sure where to start? This class will focus on ways to improve your abilities to teach. Beginning dance teachers are especially welcome. You will volunteer to teach during the class and the rest of us will act as your students. As you teach, I will make suggestions with some comments from other students, too. People who are not ready to teach but want to learn are invited to act as dance students for our practicing teachers. Please bring the music and the choreography for the dance you want to practice teaching. We will try and work with as many volunteers as time allows.

name: Nine Man Morris
description_book: A 90-minute class about this well-known period game. History, rules, strategy, tactics, sample game, and time to pair up and play after lecture.

name: Pennsic Arts & Science Display
description_book: Pennsic 46 Arts & Science Display
description_web: Come and be part of the wondrous display of craftsmanship from the Known World! Pennsic 46 brings the 19th annual display of the talents and knowledge of the Known World's Artisans and Craftspeople. The variety and scope of work always create a most excellent spectacle of artistic talents and scientific skills. The display is not a competition. Bring your completed items, works-in-progress, research, and discussion material, so that you may share, inspire, and enrich our Society. See what others in your field are working on, discover a new passion, make new contacts and, most importantly, have fun!

name: Cued Improv, Folkloric Style!
description_book: Learn 3 slow, 3 fast combos of Tribal Odyssey Bellydance "lead-and-follow" format, based on classic Egyptian style; for duets or larger groups.
description_web: Learn three slow, three fast combinations of Tribal Odyssey Bellydance "lead-and-follow" format, based on classic Egyptian style; for duets or larger groups. PDF notes provided online. Finger cymbals optional.

name: Pelican and Protégé Meet-Up
description_book: This is a time for Pelicans and protégés to meet others from across the Known World! A variety of topics will be discussed. Please join us!
description_web: This is a time for Pelicans and protégés to meet others from across the Known World! A variety of topics will be discussed. Please join us!

name: Pennsic Children's Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: Children's Choir is open to children up to age 13 who love to sing. Experience the world of singing medieval and Renaissance music. All are welcome!
description_web: Pennsic Children's Choir is open to all children up to age 13 who love to sing. Experience the world of Renaissance and medieval vocal music. We will rehearse from 1-2 pm Sunday, August 6, through Wednesday, August 9, at the PA Rehearsal tent. We will perform as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/10, in the PAT; further details TBA during regular rehearsals.) Parents must attend rehearsals with children under 12. Music and more information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-children-s-choir

name: *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: Disk, bobbins, string

name: Non-European Chainmail
description_book: Intro class to non-European chainmail. Bring your own tools. Materials provided.
description_web: Intro class to non-European chainmail. Bring your own tools. Limit of 5 participants. Materials provided. $10 materials fee.
fee_itemization: Hand turned & cut enameled copper rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter; sufficient to complete class project

name: What Makes a Good Thrown Weapons Competition
description_book: Open discussion of how to design and run a good Thrown Weapons Competition.

name: Intermediate Middle Eastern Drumming: 6/8
description_book: Add to your rhythm repertoire with those played in 6/8. Moroccan and Persian 6/8 and others are covered, with variations. Beginners welcome.

name: Taking the Pain Out of Period Pigments
description_book: Basic period pigments and problems/solutions mixing and using them. Studio time for practice. Fees optional.
description_web: This is a discussion of the nature of period pigments and problems/solutions mixing them with binders and using them to illuminate. This class is discussion but a studio practicum is being offered at the same time.  Please feel free to bring your own brushes and preferred paper but I will have brushes and some pre-printed blanks on card stock and some scrap perg to play with. Handout on CD, optional. Sample palettes $20, optional and **limited quantities**.
fee_itemization:
$5 for handout on CD
$20 for take-home pallet of colors - LIMITED QUANTITY!

name: Rapier Champions (Melée)
description_book: description added soon
description_web:
TENTATIVE:
Format: Last Man Standing; the side that takes 2 out of 3 bouts takes the point; all three bouts will be fought regardless of outcomes
Number of Participants: 20 person teams
Restrictions: The sitting Crowns of the Middle, East, Aethelmearc, and Atlantia may not participate
Setup: Open Field (traditional space)
Time Limit: Not timed
Number of Run Throughs: 3
War Points: 1

name: Axe Continuous Throw Tournament
description_book: A tournament in which contestants throw axes continually at a single rotation until they miss.

name: Court Organization for Court Heralds
description_book: An in-depth look at the particulars of arranging and organizing SCA Court, from the point of view of the Court Herald.

name: Feastocrat 101
description_book: So you want to be a feastocrat? This is a step-by-step planning class for those who are considering running their first feast! Handouts available.

name: Youth Ideas Matter: Get What You Want From Events
description_book: (YouthU, 11-15) Ever been to an event where it felt like there was nothing at all for people your age to do? Well, you can help fix that!
description_web: (YouthU, 11-15) Ever been to an event where it felt like there was nothing at all for people your age to do? Well, you can help fix that! It can be intimidating to figure out where to start, so we’ll talk about the basic staff an event usually has, how to come up with ideas and put them into a helpful format, and how to volunteer to help make your ideas come to life. We’ll also discuss ways to approach staff you might not already be friends with and how to get them to take you seriously. You can be an important part of making more events friendly and fun for all ages!

name: A&S Competitions for Organizers, Part 1 of 3
description_book: How A&S competition organizers can help to create and encourage fun and educational activities. Part of a series.
description_web: We’ll be talking about how A&S competition organizers can create better experiences for judges and for entrants. Discussion will cover ideas on how to plan better activities as well as how to work with judges and entrants to help everyone have a fun time while also encouraging an educational atmosphere. This class ties in with "A&S Competitions for Judges" and "A&S Competitions for Entrants". You can attend any one or all three.

name: Cultural Stories with a Period Feel
description_book: How to combine the elements of a modern event into a story told by your persona.

name: Indian Persona Meet-and-Greet/Making *Kulhar*
description_book: Come one, come all. Indian personas come together to meet each other. We will talk and share stories, and, while we are at it, we will make *kulhar*.
description_web: Come one, come all. Indian personas come together to meet each other. We will talk and share stories, and, while we are at it, we will make *kulhar(bhar)*, small half-fired disposable clay cups used for drinking *chai* and other teas. We will use these cups at a gathering later in the week.

name: Eight Essential Knots for the SCA Camper
description_book: Hands-on class on how to tie eight basic and important knots that can make your camping life easier and safer.
description_web: Hands-on class on how to tie eight basic and important knots that can make your camping life easier and safer.

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to Gypsy Persona
description_book: Don't know how/where to start with this persona? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a Gypsy persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.

name: Intro to the *Rubul Mujayyab* (Sine Quadrant)
description_book: The Sine Quadrant or *Rubul Mujayyab* was a device used for performing mathematical calculations and determining time.
description_web: The Sine Quadrant or *Rubul Mujayyab* was a device used for performing mathematical calculations and determining time. This class will give the historical context for the device and provide extensive hands-on practical experience in using the various functions. Details at http://astrolabeproject.com
fee_itemization: Fee covers part of the cost of a large (25+ page) handout.

name: Runestone Bardic Circle Practice - Alternate Site
description_book: (Amphitheater hold for "Runestone Bardic Circle Practice" in case of weather; see class for details.)

name: Medieval Harmonies for Bardic Purposes
description_book: Learn the basics of medieval-sounding harmony to help you improvise harmonies at bardic circles.
description_web: Or, How to Sing Along on the Wrong Note and Make It Sound Medieval! If you like to sing in the SCA and attend a lot of bardic circles, you’ve probably wondered how people figure out complex-sounding harmony lines seemingly on-the-fly. Understanding some of the basic music theory behind harmony is helpful in learning to think harmonically, making your harmonies sound medieval, and perhaps more importantly, making them sound **good**. There will be some singing in class; feel free not to sing if you don’t feel ready. You’ll leave the class understanding more about what you hear around the bardic circle.

name: Body of the Mask: The Full *Commedia* Character
description_book: Based on research of Antonio Fava, how to don the whole body of each *commedia* character to connect deeply with the audience with or without words.
description_web: Based on the research of Antonio Fava, how to don the whole body of each *commedia* character to connect deeply with the audience with or without words. Please come prepared to move in comfortable clothing. Each day we will inspect the movement of a different class of character: the lovers, the first and second *Zanni, Capitano, Signora* and house servants, *Pantalone* and *Dottore*.
fee_itemization: 100 page handouts in its own binder. Only needs to be purchased once.

name: Playford Favorites
description_book: *Lord of Carnarvan's Jegg, Scotch Cap*, and *Picking of Sticks*: three English dances that never get old.

name: Heroic Rapier Champions (Single Combat)
description_book: description added soon
description_web:
TENTATIVE:
Format: Last Man Standing; the side with the most bouts won takes the point
Number of Participants: Each side will select 15 Rapier Champions and 2 Cut and Thrust Champions to be paired into bouts. After two double kills the bout will be voided from the total. Each side will have one additional fighter for a final “sudden death” bout in the event of a tie. The tie breaker bout will be fought until there is a victor.
Restrictions: The sitting Crowns of the Middle, East, Aethelmearc, and Atlantia may not participate; the sides shall not have more than 9 members of the Order of Defense as champions within their 15 rapier fighters; Cut and Thrust Champions may be collared or un-collared
Setup: Open Field (traditional space)
Time Limit: Not timed
Number of Run Throughs: 1
War Points: 1

name: Zill Dance from Start to Stage: 3 of 4
description_book: Learn a zill choreography to be performed at the Middle Eastern Dance Expo. Recommended for intermediate dancers who know zill basics.
description_web: Zills, or finger cymbals, add much to a performance. This class series will have the students learning a zill choreography with the option of performing it as a group at the Middle Eastern Dance Expo. Recommended for intermediate dancers who know zill basics as this class will move quickly through the choreography. Performance costuming should consist of a period or peri-oid coat worn over *salwar* or harem pants and a simple hip scarf or belt. Dancers must attend 3 of the 4 sessions including the final one in order to be eligible to perform.

name: *Citole* Solar
description_book: Come play 13th-14th-century polyphony on your *citole, gittern*, or lute (preferably tuned G-d-g-d'). Harps and plucked psalteries also welcome.
description_web: So you bought a *citole* at Pennsic, and now you're wondering what to do with it. Or you've been having fun strumming solo songs, but would like to try something different. In this class we'll play some catchy pieces of 13th- and 14th-century polyphony. Bring your *citole, gittern*, lute, etc., (preferably tuned G-d-g-d') and join in the fun! Although this class is aimed at fretted instruments, harps and plucked psalteries are welcome, too.

name: PA Afternoon Series: *Commedia* Experience
description_book: Come experience *Commedia dell'Arte*! Meet the characters and the actors behind them and learn to act in comic masked style.
description_web: Come experience *Commedia dell'Arte*! Meet the characters and the actors behind them and learn to act in comic masked style (movement, vocalization, express funny ideas). Experienced actors/directors from several well-known *Commedia dell'Arte* troupes will guide you if you're new, or give you free advice that's definitely worth the price to veteran performers!

name: Runestone Bardic Circle Practice at Runestone Park
description_book: Welcome, new, returning, bardic explorers: singers, songwriters, poets, storytellers, and guests! Enjoy gathering in the shade. Bardic Safe Zone!
description_web:
Bardic Safe Zone! (Formally known as "The Peerless Bardic Circle - the Tradition Continues".) Welcome, first timers, rusty returners, nervous performers, and all seeking to enjoy an un-intimidating, low-key bardic circle as performer or audience! We invite all those new and exploring the bardic arts: singers, songwriters, poets, storytellers of all levels including apprentices, journeymen, and also anyone who may want to come listen and enjoy the gathering in the shade of the park near the Runestone. A few disguised Peers have been known to sneak in.
Alternate rain site at the Amphitheater. If you want to learn more about bardic circles and what they're all about, come to Lucia's "Bardic Circles 101" class in AS 9 at 11am in AS9.

name: Beginning to Drum Solo: *Malfuf, Syrto, Chifti*
description_book: An intro to the beginnings of solo techniques for *Malfuf, Syrto*, and *Chiftitelli* rhythms. An intermediate class, but all levels welcome.
description_web: An intro to the beginnings of solo techniques for *Malfuf, Syrto*, and *Chiftitelli* rhythms. An intermediate class, but all levels (including beginners) welcome.

name: Basics of Flexible Weapons Fighting
description_book: Learn to fight with the techniques of the Filipino sarong, covering offensive and defensive techniques. No martial arts experience required.
description_web: Learn to fight with the techniques of the Filipino sarong, which can also be applied to other flexible items such as scarves or belts. Class will cover offensive and defensive techniques including blocks, traps and chokes. No martial arts experience or equipment required.

name: Playtime with Period Pigments
description_book: This is an hour to sit and play with period pigments. I will have my extensive palette with materials, and will field questions as you play.
description_web: This is an hour to sit and play with period pigments. I will have my extensive palette, brushes, pergamenata and Bristol board, plus some pre-printed designs on card stock for those who wish to see what it is all about, and try using the “real thing.” I will be glad to field questions as we paint. Handout on CD, optional. Sample palettes, $20 each, **limited quantities**, optional.
fee_itemization: 5 for OPTIONAL CD of of information, $5 for in-class consumables

name: East - Middle Youth Round Robin Tournament
description_book: Combatants may be split into random pools if numbers warrant it. Sign-ins begin at 2:30 pm.
description_web: Combatants may be split into random pools if numbers warrant it. Sign-ins begin at 2:30 pm.

name: How to Card-Weave Letters and Designs
description_book: Weave letters, numbers, designs! Bring a loom warped with 14, 22, or 42 cards, A&B in one color, C&D in a contrasting color. Observers welcome.
description_web: Learn to weave letters, numbers, or your own designs using the double-faced weaving technique! To fully participate, bring a loom warped with 14, 22, or 42 cards, A&B in one color, C&D in a contrasting color, all S or Z threaded, and shuttle in either color. Fewer cards are easier to work with and recommended for newer weavers. Not a beginner's class; basic knowledge of tablet weaving is assumed. Observers welcome, or bring one loom and share with a friend. Instructor's loom will be available to briefly try out the technique.
fee_itemization: copying costs for 19 page color handout + 7 page pattern package

name: Keep Thee from a Nunnery!
description_book: The options for single women in Renaissance Venice: Marriage isn't as likely as you'd think; what did the other ladies do?
description_web: There is only so much dowry money to go around, and, if you've got sisters, you are likely to end up as Sister Mary on the Shelf. Culled from various sources of advice, learn about the ideal bride and the options if Lord Charming never comes. Spinsters end up in cloisters! What's a girl to do?

name: Egyptian *Nalbinding*
description_book: But isn't *nalbinding* a Viking thing? Not really. We'll discuss the use of *nalbinding* in post-Roman Egypt. Discussion, one hour; one for practical.
description_web: But isn't *nalbinding* a Viking thing? Not really. Class will discuss the use of *nalbinding*/needle-looping in post-Roman Egypt. The first hour is discussion of extant pieces (mainly socks) from 4th-6th century Egypt including variations in stitch type and construction methods. This will be followed by one hour of hands-on practice. Limited number of needles will be available for attendees or you can bring your own blunt yarn needle.
fee_itemization: No Fee

name: Hand-Sewing Eyelets
description_book: Take your garb up a notch! Learn to use an awl and hand-sew eyelets to finish your bodice or doublet.
description_web: Take your garb up a notch! Metal grommets don't have the look, and they result in less-durable clothing. Come learn how to use an awl and needle to hand-sew your own eyelets.
fee_itemization: 1 tailor's awl

name: Kaftan and Gambeson (1 of 2) Construction
description_book: Construction of early period kaftans and the first half of gambeson construction, based on period finds. How to measure and construct.
fee_itemization: Picture heavy handout.

name: Coaching and the Art of Constructive Criticism
description_book: Discover proven NPS coaching techniques to cultivate critique that aids and inspires rather than crushing talent before it can bloom. Coach the Dream!
description_web: We all hear the cries of the populace - or at least the artists-to-be and the volunteers-to-be - that they tried and were rendered low by sharp criticism. Here you can discover proven coaching techniques from a National Park Service Registered Coach. Learn to shape artistic performance and presentation or volunteer service into something that serves the Dream rather than drives people away!

name: Learning to Play the Big Drum (*Tupan/Davul*)
description_book: This class will cover basic and intermediate technique on the *davul*, as well as brief notes about buying or building one. Some loaners available.

name: Introduction to Pavan and Galliard
description_book: Suitable for beginners, this class offers a walk-through of the pavan and galliard, two improvisational dances from the 16th century.
description_web: Suitable for beginners, this class offers a walk-through of the pavan and galliard, two improvisational dances from the 16th century. The pavan is extremely low-impact, but the galliard can rather unforgiving on one's knees and ankles. It can be modified somewhat to reduce impact, however. Please consider wearing close-fitting shoes, such as turn shoes, jazz oxfords, Keds, or ballet slippers, because tennis shoes or boots will impede movement. (In a pinch, you could go barefoot or in socks, but you'll want to be careful of splinters on the wood floor.)

instructor: Sir Sor Ustad Hasan al Hajjii
name: Maghribi and Middle Eastern Rattan and Shields
description_book: Creating period representations of Maghribi and Middle Eastern rattan weapons and shields.

name: Period Card Games: *Losing Loadem*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period, trick-avoidance card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game based on a reconstruction from Francis Willughby’s *A Volume of Plaies* (~1665).

name: *Kyōgenza*: Improvisational Comic Theatre Workshop
description_book: A participatory workshop introducing medieval improvisational Japanese comic theatre. Stock characters engage in parody and satire.
description_web:
A participatory workshop introducing medieval improvisational Japanese comic theatre. Participants will be introduced to stock characters, theatrical devices, and comic theory. Ridicule the powerful. Stock characters engage in parody and satire.

*Kyōgen* is a particularly accessible and easy-to-stage genre of Japanese theatre. *Kyōgen* dates to at least the fourteenth century and is a living theatre today. *Kyōgen* frequently lampooned the powerful people who sat in the audience. Learn about stage geography, scripting, types of plays, types of characters, the rhythmic structure of Japanese theatre, acting conventions, and more. Participants will engage in readings and rehearsal at the end of the workshop.
fee_itemization: The multi-page handout contains synopsis of period plays, character descriptions, stage drawing, and more.

name: Beyond Lucet Basics
description_book: Variations, loops, and monkey wrenches.
description_web: Starts with a basic refresher class for everyone. We then proceed to variations, loops, and monkey wrenches. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. String provided.

name: Beginning Spear Throwing
description_book: Learn to throw spear. This is a hands-on session in which students will have instruction on spear throwing.

name: Exploring the *Riq* with Donovan
description_book: Learn the basics of the *riq*. We will work on basic techniques for getting great sounds out of your drum.
description_web: Learn the basics of the *riq*. We will work on basic techniques for getting great sounds out of your drum.

name: Building Scrolls Without a Book of Hours
description_book: What? No Book of Hours? Yes! Learn how to use period artwork to build scrolls and break into a new area of creativity.

name: Book Heraldry 100
description_book: An introductory class for book heralds, covering topics such as becoming a herald, the organization of the SCA heralds, and the submission process.
description_web: An introductory class for book heralds, covering administrative matters and general principles, including becoming a herald, the organization of the SCA College of Arms, the submission process, and related topics.

name: Medieval Jewish Fighters
description_book: Medieval Jews fought for Jewish, Christian, Muslim, Mongol, Indian, Chinese, and other armies as well as in community self-defense. An overview.
description_web: Medieval Jews fought for Jewish, Christian, Muslim, Mongol, Indian, Chinese, and other armies. They also fought in community self-defense -- sometimes successfully, sometimes not. This class shows when/where such fighters are reliably documented, highlighting those times/places where medieval Jewish fighters and non-fighters had a certain measure of freedom to live as they chose.

name: The Development of Music Through Acoustics
description_book: We'll discuss the development of vocal and instrumental music in relation to changing architecture, new instrumentation, and musical principles.
description_web: We will discuss the development of vocal and instrumental music in relation to changing architecture, new instrumentation, and musical principles.

name: How to Brew a Tree, Part II: Leaves and Flowers
description_book: Three types of tree foliage that can be effectively used in producing alcohol: oak leaves, evergreen needles, and elder flowers; 21 or over.
description_web: When discussing foliage in the brewing process, one is most familiar with the ripened fruits of various trees. However, this oversight ignores the benefits of the other types available to the brewer – leaves, flowers, and even needles of various trees that can be used to achieve interesting if not pleasant beverages. I will discuss three types of tree foliage that can be effectively used in the production of alcohol: oak leaves, evergreen needles, and elder flowers. Many of the principles offered in this class can be applied to the use of other types of plant life, such as heather tips, rose petals, dandelions, etc. Alcohol will be served. IDs will be checked. Must be 21 or over.
fee_itemization: Handout is 7 pages at 0.15 per page (at Staples.)

name: Interkingdom Anthropology
description_book: How do you do things in your kingdom? Tell us, and we'll tell you how we do it in ours. Trust us, we will all learn a lot.
description_web:
How do you do things in your kingdom? Tell us, and we'll tell you how we do it in ours. Trust us, we will all learn a lot. 

If you have ever traveled in the SCA, you know things can be very different from kingdom to kingdom. Even though we have a lot in common, we have differences, too. Let's talk about them.

name: Make and Take Moravian Stars
description_book: The Moravian Church has roots in the SCA time period.  Learn some history and make fun largesse.
description_web: The Moravian Church begins during the SCA time period and is recognizable by their beautiful star icons, easily reproduced with some ribbon and time. While the ribbon stars have no presence in period, they make great tokens to say thanks, or you inspire me.  Bring small, sharp scissors.
fee_itemization: 1 dollar for ribbon

name: *Contentezza D'Amore*
description_book: Come learn *Contentezza D'Amore*, a beautiful 16th-century *ballo* from *Nobiltà*! Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.
description_web: Come learn *Contentezza D'Amore*, one of the most beautiful of the 16th-century *balli*! I will be teaching the version from *Nobiltà di Dame*, Master Caroso's second book, wherein he corrects all the errors of his first; if you think you already know it, be warned! Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.

location: Denys The Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp  EO8)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: Daily meetings for those in any 12-step program such as AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: We welcome all in AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc., who are in any 12-step program to the 4:00 pm daily meeting at EO8 Denys The Decadent's Camp.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWC *Chorulus Pennsicus*
description_book: Closed rehearsals, by audition only.
description_web:
Closed rehearsals by audition only. 
*Chorulus Pennsicus* information available here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/chorulus-pennsicus

name: Moroccan Mayhem: Drumming Clapping Chanting Oh My!
description_book: Moroccan folk music class with drumming, clapping, chanting, singing and a little dancing. Bring your frame drums, *darbukas, riqs* and *qaraqab*.
description_web: In this class we will combine many elements of folk music from Morocco, including layered drum rhythms, clapping, chanting, singing and maybe even a little dancing. We’ll then put all the pieces together for a wild and crazy collaboration. Bring your frame drums, *darbukas, riqs*, and you can try out the *qaraqab* and *tarijaat*.

location: Orluk Oasis (W10, on the lake near the peninsula.)
name: Beginner Steps to *Saidi* Rhythms
description_book: Class will include an easy-to-learn beginner dance to *Saidi*, a popular Middle Eastern rhythm.
description_web: Class will include an easy-to-learn beginner dance to *Saidi*, a popular Middle Eastern rhythm. While it will be taught as a basic choreography, students will also practice improvisational portions and how to use this dance as a framework for creating their own choreography. Live drumming! Refreshments and conversation after! Join us in Orluk Oasis.

name: What Do I Do with This *Oud* or *Cümbüş*?
description_book: Did you get your hands on an *Oud* or *Cümbüş*, but have no idea how to tune it, pluck it, play it? This class will start from the very beginning.
description_web: Did you get your hands on an *Oud* or *Cümbüş*, but have no idea how to tune it, pluck it, play it? This class will start from the very beginning.

name: Known World Novice Championship
description_book: Fighters from all over the Known World, with two years or less experience since their primary authorization, test their skills against each other.

name: *Keum-Boo*: Hot Metal Gilding
description_book: *Keum-Boo*, or hot metal gilding, is gilding on silver, copper or iron with 24-karat gold foil, while the base metal is at 500 degrees Fahrenheit.
description_web: *Keum-Boo*, or hot metal gilding, is gilding on silver, copper or iron with 24-karat gold foil, while the base metal is at 500 degrees Fahrenheit.
fee_itemization: materials/ gold

name: Advanced Storytelling
description_book: How to go beyond merely "telling a story around a campfire".
description_web: How to go beyond merely "telling a story around a campfire". Getting and holding a hall's attention, voice techniques; reading and playing off a crowd, how to take authentic "boring" stories and turn them into stories for modern audiences, and lastly, what to do when it All Goes Wrong.

name: Medieval Harmonies for Bardic Purposes
description_book: Learn the basics of medieval-sounding harmony to help you improvise harmonies at bardic circles.
description_web: Or, How to Sing Along on the Wrong Note and Make It Sound Medieval! If you like to sing in the SCA and attend a lot of bardic circles, you’ve probably wondered how people figure out complex-sounding harmony lines seemingly on-the-fly. Understanding some of the basic music theory behind harmony is helpful in learning to think harmonically, making your harmonies sound medieval, and perhaps more importantly, making them sound **good**. There will be some singing in class; feel free not to sing if you don’t feel ready. You’ll leave the class understanding more about what you hear around the bardic circle.

name: Pennsic Archery Champions Practice/Tryouts
description_book: All archers wishing to make the Pennsic Archery Champions' Teams should attend these practices.
description_web: All archers wishing to be on the Pennsic Archery Champions' Teams should attend these practices. See either the East Kingdom Captain General or the Midrealm Lt General for more details.

name: Archery Marshals Meeting
description_book: There will be two archery marshals meetings, the first on Friday, August 4, at 5 pm and second on Sunday, August 6, at 5 pm.
description_web: There will be two archery marshals meetings, the first on Friday, August 4, at 5 pm and second on Sunday, August 6, at 5 pm. All archery marshals should attend one of these meetings.

name: Bloody Bible Stories: Mar Yaakov HaMizrachi
description_book: Come hear Bible stories as full of action as an Viking Saga or Roman myth. Embroidered with years of Jewish legend, for edge-of-the-seat listening!
description_web: Come hear Bible stories as full of action as an Viking Saga or Roman myth. Embroidered with 2,500 years of Jewish legend, these are not the happy stories you heard in Hebrew Day School or Sunday school! 100% period and guaranteed to have you on the edge of your seat. **Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.**

name: Glass Painting (Thru Æthelmearc Scribal College)
description_book: Learn "Basic Glass Painting", the same technique used for stained glass scrolls. Taught in cooperation with Æthelmearc Scribes' College.
description_web: Learn "Basic Glass Painting", the same technique found to do wording and faces in churches. Also, **scribes**! Learn how to put words on glass. You'll work on a small piece that will get fired onsite. If you've seen any stained glass scrolls given out in court, this is the method I use. (Scribes, please bring a nib holder and some nibs.)
fee_itemization: supplies including glass and glass paint.

name: Known World Party Set-Up
description_book: Set-Up for Known World Party
description_web: The Known World is invited to join Their Sylvan Majesties Timothy and Gabrielle and the citizens of Æthelmearc in celebration of our dream. Join us on the Battlefield as we celebrate what the SCA was, is, and will be.

name: Wildly Weedy Herbs
description_book: Learn about some medieval and Renaissance herbs now growing wild in the U.S. No walking required.
description_web: Interested in learning how to spot some of the herbs known to our medieval and Renaissance forebears that have escaped and become weeds here? Were they weeds at home? How are they/were they used? We'll cover probably 20 herbal invaders. Instructor will strive to bring examples of most, if not all, plants to handle.
fee_itemization: Simple handout with line drawings.

name: In a Fool’s Garden: Fables of John Inchingham
description_book: John Inchingham the Fool sings fantastical tales including dragons, hydras, weaselopes. He spins whimsical yarns of cats, ducks, herring and more!
description_web: Baron John of Illiton, AKA Master John Inchingham the Fool, sings fantastical tales of dragons, giants, trolls, mermaids, hydras, pegasi and weaselopes too! He also spins whimsical yarns of cats, rats, dogs, frogs, beavers, otters, rabbits, ducks, yaks and herring. Come sing along or just sit and listen to an hour’s worth of family-friendly entertainment.

name: Combat of the Thirty
description_book: This is a 30-versus-30 deed of arms inspired by the original Combat of the Thirty between French and English forces that occurred in 1351.
description_web:
This is a 30-versus-30 deed of arms inspired by the original Combat of the Thirty between French and English forces that occurred in 1351. Combat standards are a modified counted-blow scenario that employs rules for capturing opponents and ransoming of captured parties. Participants must be acceptable to the captains of the French and English forces. Armour must be a reasonable attempt at a complete 14th-century harness, and weapons are restricted to ones that closely resemble their medieval counterparts. Final say on weapons and appropriate harness will be at the sole discretion of the captains.
Requirements: All participants must wear a 14th-century kit. Greaves are required and all are encouraged to wear *chausses* and *braies*. All weapons must closely resemble their medieval counterpart and are restricted to bastard swords, polearms of period design (axes, hammers, etc.), spears under 7', daggers and single-handed swords. All participants should be prepared to pay a ransom that they feel is appropriate to their station in the event that they are "captured" during this deed of arms. Rules of combat will be explained to all combatants before the CotT begins.

name: Æthelmearc Scribal College Open Scriptorium
description_book: Open time at the Scribal tents for people who need to work on scrolls or want to consult with experienced scribes and teachers. Use the side gate.
description_web: Open time at the Scribal tents for people who need to work on scrolls or want to consult with experienced scribes and teachers. Use the side gate. We will have tables, chairs, good lighting, and experienced scribes and teachers who can answer questions, help with any issues or direct you to where to get further information on most scribal topics.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: West African Percussion (*Djembe*, *Dunun*)
description_book: History, tradition, context for beginners on the art of West African percussion. Technique, rhythms. Bring your drum. Some extras will be available.
description_web:
History, tradition, and context for beginners on up in the art of West African percussion. 

Daniel has studied and performed *djembe* and *dunun* for over two decades, having had the opportunity to learn from and perform with some of the best players from Guinea, Mali, Senegal and other countries in West Africa. He was once given the name Tegebuson by Abdoul Doumbia which means "whip-hand." He will show you proper technique, demonstrate various rhythms, and get you playing accessible, fun rhythms. 

If you have questions about drum-building or what to do about a broken, rope-tuned hand drum, he can answer those as well.

name: Duke Moonwulf's Annual Pennsic Concert
description_book: Music, stories, hijinks and history, in the concert that's become a Pennsic tradition!
description_web: Music, stories, hijinks and history, in the concert that's become a Pennsic tradition!

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own; class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: weaving materials, string

name: Youth Combat Sword-Building Workshop
description_book: Build a padded rattan sword suitable for use in the Youth Combat List. Materials available for a fee or bring your own. Sponsored by Æthelmearc.
description_web: Build a padded rattan sword suitable for use in the Youth Combat List. You will construct a padded single sword legal for use in all divisions of Youth Combat, and get to take it home with you. Rattan, foam, duct tape, and electrical tape as well as tools will be available for a fee, or bring your own. Youth weapons must use shaved rattan between .75" and 1.25" in diameter. PEX and Siloflex are also permitted. PVC is **NOT** permitted. Class limit 15. Sponsored by the Kingdom of Æthelmearc.
fee_itemization: Fee covers one sword-length piece of shaved rattan, pipe foam, yoga mat foam for reinforcing the striking edges, duct tape, and electrical tape.

name: PW for Parents of Youth with Special Needs
description_book: This class, run by a warranted youth officer and modern-world special education teacher, is aimed at Pennsic-going parents and their children.
description_web: Are you coming to Pennsic for the first time and not sure how to handle your child's circumstances? Is there a new diagnosis on the table that changes how you and your family need to approach Pennsic? Do you have questions? Do you have tips to share? This class with Mistress Kis Marika is designed just for you.

name: Known World Youth Combat Meet and Greet
description_book: An informal get-together with the Society DEM for Youth Combat. Get the latest updates, meet other youth marshals, and ask questions.
description_web: An informal get-together with the Society Deputy Earl Marshal for Youth Combat. Get the latest updates, meet other youth marshals, and ask questions. Includes Youth Rapier marshals.

name: Beginner's Ball
description_book: A ball with every dance taught! All are fun and easy. No partner needed. Pit open to all musicians too. Bring your friends!
description_web: At the Beginner's Ball we teach all of the dances. Never danced? Not a problem! A perfect ball for the eager but still learning. Everyone is welcome. No partner is needed. Bring your friends! All musicians are welcome too! The pit is open! The more the merrier! Led by Master Philip White (dance) and Master Albrecht Catsprey (music).

name: Known World Siege Marshal Social
description_book: A social meeting for informal discussions about siege combat and marshaling.
description_web: To promote convivial dialogue amongst the various groups of siege marshals in the Known World, THL Diccon de Reinport is pleased to announce the 8th Annual Known World Siege Marshal Social to be hosted at the Holt Heroetus encampment. Please join us for informal discussions about siege combat and marshaling, and any other topics of interest.

name: *Guedra*: North African Trance Dance
description_book: Brief instruction in dance followed by participation in *Guedra* ritual. No dance exp needed. Bring water; veil if you want to dance. Women only.
description_web: Dance and chant will be taught, as well as some background info. New information this year, as Mistress Jadi Fatima joins us. 30-45 minutes instruction (men welcome during instruction only) followed by performance of *Guedra*. Until our voices give out, we'll chant the *Guedra* for 1 to 4 dancers at a time. Bring a veil if you think you might want to dance. Everyone must participate in chant; no singing talent required, no dancing experience necessary. Bring water to drink. Avoid wearing large jewelry.

name: Efenwealt Wystle and Aenor d'Anjou: Music & Mirth
description_book: Bring a kazoo, a cardboard cutout of the letter 'W', an emergency mustache, and an interesting hat just in case. Join in the annual concert fun!
description_web: Bring a kazoo, a cardboard cutout of the letter 'W', an emergency mustache, and an interesting hat just in case. They are the best musicians in the world, either for tragedy, comedy, history, pastoral, pastoral-comical, historical-pastoral, tragical-historical, tragical-comical-historical, one-liners, or lutefisk. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

name: Vigil
description_book: Vigil in East-side turret.

name: Known World Party
description_book: The Known World is invited to join Their Sylvan Majesties Timothy and Gabrielle and their citizens. *ID will be checked if alcohol is to be consumed.*
description_web: The Known World is invited to join Their Sylvan Majesties Timothy and Gabrielle and their citizens. *Note: ID will be checked if alcohol is to be consumed.*

name: Lord Carmine and Friends Haﬂa
description_book: Hafla means Party! Bring your instruments and hips. Everyone dances and plays music together.
description_web: Hafla means Party! Bring your instruments and hips. Everyone dances and plays music together. The Middle Eastern tent doesn't always have a place to sit, so bring a chair or something to sit on if you need.

name: *i Sebastiani!*
description_book: *i Sebastiani!* The greatest *commedia dell'arte* troupe in the entire world!
description_web: *Buon giorno!* O, you lucky people! Truly you are blessed among the living, for into your lives has come *i Sebastiani*, the Greatest *Commedia dell'Arte* Troupe in the Entire World! Join us as we improvise, from the thinnest of outlines, a wondrous entertainment in three acts. You will be glad that you did! *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12*.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Basketry 101: Handled Basket
description_book: Create a handled basket from flat reed. Bring scissors for cutting reed and a towel. No experience necessary.
fee_itemization: Oak D handle, dyed basket reed, plain basket reed, rim filler, tool usage and handouts

name: Coffee with Friends of Dr Bob and Bill
description_book: Morning open meeting for those in recovery.
description_web: Morning open meeting for those in recovery.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off-line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Armored Combat Morning Session
description_book: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.
description_web: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.

name: Passing Notes like a Russian with Birch Bark
description_book: 11th-14th-c. Russians had a very literate society. Learn what their notes reveal about their culture and try your hand at writing on birch bark.
description_web: From the 11th to 14th centuries, Russian men, women, peasants, and even children knew how to read and write, and they used slips of birch bark for business and personal correspondence. This class explores what we can learn from these letters about the people of medieval Russia and their lifestyle, and provides some birch bark slips for those interested in testing the medium.
fee_itemization: birchbark slips

name: From Queen Teuta of Illyria to Grainne Ni Mhaille
description_book: We'll explore the rich history of women in piracy: why they took to the sea and how they shaped their own stories.

name: Lucet: Beyond Square Cord
description_book: You can make good square cord; what's next? Flat and multi-strand cords. Bring your lucet. (We can slip a cord off and put it back on after class.)
description_web: You’re comfortable making square cord; what's next? We'll work on flat and multi-strand cords. Please bring your lucet. We'll also demonstrate how to slip a cord off and put it back on after class.
fee_itemization: (4) colors of floss on cards, and handout

name: Healthy Hair Care Then and Now
description_book: We'll be reviewing how people kept their hair clean in the past. Then we'll cover healthy natural hair care in the modern age without shampoo.
fee_itemization: $1 is for a sample hair wash. $2 is for a handout that includes several wash recipes

name: Beginning Hairnets
description_book: A hands-on introduction to creation of 13th/14th-century knotted hairnets. You will learn cast-on, the basic knot, and an increase.
fee_itemization: Fee includes loom, shuttle, gauge, fiber and hand-out. The hand-out fee is only for those who want a hand-out but did not get a kit.

name: A&S Competitions for Judges, Part 2 of 3
description_book: How A&S competition judges can support and encourage entrants to partake in fun and educational activities. Part of a series.
description_web: We’ll be talking about how A&S competition judges can support and encourage entrants to be a part of educational activities while still having fun. Discussion will cover ideas on how to give feedback to entrants. We want to help everyone have a fun time while also encouraging an educational atmosphere. This class ties in with "A&S Competitions for Organizers" and "A&S Competitions for Entrants". You can attend any one or all three.

name: The Bayeux Tapestry
description_book: Construction and history of this embroidered wall hanging from 1066, including hints and tips for making your own tapestry.

name: Irish Language 101
description_book: The Irish language: pronunciation, basic grammar, introductions, counting, ask and answer questions, how to be polite.
description_web: Basic introduction to the Irish language (modern, sorry, not ancient). Learn pronunciation and grammar rules, pronouns and vocabulary, how to introduce yourself and tell someone where you are from, how to count and tell time, how to ask and answer simple questions, and how to politely say a few phrases like "please" and "thank you".

name: Make a Scroll Frame
description_book: Produce a scroll frame that, when finished, will be able to support any number of embroidery projects. Size: approx. 16 x 16 in.
description_web: The scroll frame is used to support embroidery fabric and does not leave tell-tale marks like a hoop does. The student will walk away with a completed frame and the skill-set to make additional frames, supports and the ability to make the more complex slate frame.
fee_itemization: wing nuts ($6), 5/16" washers (4), carriage bolts ($5), 5/8" dowels ($22), tacks ($5?), twill tape ($8), 2"x10"x8' pine board ($12)  Total (not including taxes paid):  $62

name: Knowne World Knitters Meet and Greet
description_book: Meet up with fellow knitters from around the Knowne World. Talk about your past, present, and future project plans with other knitters.
description_web: Whether you have a Laurel in knitting or just picked up knitting needles yesterday, come meet other knitters from around the Knowne World! We can talk about the wide variety of historical knitting projects, things we've done or plan to do, and make connections. Feel free to bring your projects or pictures of projects, and make sure to bring business cards or a notebook to trade contact information with your fellow knitters.

name: Pleatwork Apron Make-and-Take
description_book: Make your own honeycomb-pleated apron similar to those seen in German Ren woodcuts. Bring one yard of linen or buy for $10 (limit 10 available).
description_web: A hands-on, instructional class on smocking, or honeycomb pleatwork, the gathering method commonly seen in German Renaissance clothing (but also popular for hundreds of years throughout Europe). You will make your own apron to wear around camp in style! We'll also discuss pleating in general as we work, and students can read Meisterinne Genoveva's 30-page research paper on historical pleating techniques. Materials available for 10 people, or bring your own medium-weight, **white** linen (1 yard).
fee_itemization: Linen (1 yard), needles, thread - $10

name: Plagues of Europe: Yes - There Was More than One
description_book: Focus is on types of plagues, their origins, biological mechanisms, transmission, physical and psychological impact on the affected populations.
description_web: This class focuses on the types of plagues, their origins, biological mechanisms, means of transmission and their impact on the populations in affected areas. Measles, smallpox, bubonic plague, anthrax and leprosy each had a devastating impact on the population physically, economically, psychologically, spiritually and artistically.
fee_itemization: Documentation of common plagues and discussion of their impact on history, medicine, culture, social structure and the agricultural food supply

name: The Life of John Dee
description_book: A portrait of Johannes Dee: his life, achievements, thoughts, science and magic in the heart of Elizabethan England.
description_web: John Dee was born to a world where a scholar was expected to know as much about magic as science. By the end of his life his association with magic discredited him, to the extent that many of his contributions and achievements were blurred in the history books. Modern scholarship has realized just how influential a role he played in constructing the modern world. More than just a simple history lesson, this class hopes to illustrate the mindset of people who lived in Elizabethan England so that we can understand the people as well as the events of the period.

name: Research Tools for the Independent Scholar
description_book: Fast-paced introduction to free, low cost, or easily available online resources for assisting with your documentation and research.
description_web: You may or may not have a university library at your disposal, but if you want to tackle in-depth historical/material culture research, there are an expanding number of tools and tricks out there to help you find and manage resources. A long time reference librarian and researcher will cram her favorites into this session. Most are free, some are low cost or available through many libraries. Audience participation welcome.

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia* before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.
description_web: Young adults will learn the art of Commedia Dell'arte while practicing and creating skits that will be performed at the end of the week.

name: Populace Archery War Point Practice
description_book: Practice for the archery War points. Come warm up and practice before you score your war points.
description_web: Practice for the archery war points. Come warm up and practice before you score your war points

name: Embroidery
description_book: All things embroidered. Come join us for fun, exploration and learning.
description_web: All things embroidered.  Come join us for fun, exploration and learning.

name: Combat Archery
description_book: Explore whether Combat Archery is for you. Learn how to make arrows, armor and bows to begin or add to your knowledge of this martial art form.

name: Stained Glass
description_book: Presenting the period method of making a stained glass panel.

name: Known World Poetry Competition and Introduction
description_book: Demonstrations of styles of poetry used within medieval and Renaissance times. Come present your poetry, or learn a new form of expression.

name: Dancing for Kids by a Kid
description_book: Come learn a mix of Benjamin's favorite dances. (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)
description_web: Come learn some of Benjamin's favorite dances. Those he will teach are expected to include *Ly Bens, Petite Vriens, Heart`s Ease* and *Rufty Tufty*.

name: Thumb Ring Archery
description_book: Learn how to shoot like a Mongol. Requires a horse bow and arrows at least 4" longer than your finger draw. Some rings will be available for sale.
description_web: Learn to shoot the way Mongols and other steppes and horse archers did. Lord Naran Numuchi, Bow Khan of the Great Dark Horde, Companion of the Order of the Yew Bow (Atlantia), Ponte Alto Baronial Marshal, and many times Archery Champion, has been shooting thumb ring since 1998, and has focused on the use and history of static-eared recurve bows the whole time. High quality stainless steel thumb rings will be available for sale

name: Mass Project
description_book: Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. We will study a plain chant Mass and a Mass by Josquin.
