description_web: Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. We will study a plain chant Mass and a Mass by Josquin. We are going to do a mini-performance at the European Music Expo and a Mass Performance during War Week. Time and Date TBD
fee_itemization: Music Packet

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a narrow strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a narrow strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Class limited to 5 looms. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: cards & string

name: Atlantian 5-Man Rapier Melee Tourney
description_book: Heavy rapier only. Atlantian Conventions. Max of 2 MODs (or vigilants) per team. Bring your auth card and a clever team name.
description_web: In keeping with tradition, Atlantia will be hosting its 5-man melee tourney at Pennsic again this year. Teams of up to 5 rapier fighters allowed, with a maximum of 2 MODs (or vigilants). Fighting will be held with Atlantian conventions. In: DFB, knee walking to engagement, running. Out: Push cuts, tip cuts.

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: List will be open for fighting and instruction from 9 am to noon every day of war week. Pending warpoint battles
description_web: All authorized youth fighters are welcome to participate in the daily activities.  Each day will have different rapier-oriented games and lessons.

name: Youth Beginning Throwing
description_book: A throwing class for individuals 5-17. Parents must be present.

name: Thrown Weapons Marshal in Training: Part 2
description_book: Learn the SCA rules and guidelines to be a Thrown Weapons Marshal. Parts 1 & 2 required with on-the-range training and written test on Friday.

name: Youth A&S Display
description_book: This is a non-judged display open to all youth.
description_web: This is a non-judged display open to all youth. Set-up is 9-10 am with items on display from 10 am -12 pm and clean-up from 12-12:30 pm.

name: Banners Galore
description_book: Come make banners to use in the parade to the Children's Fête!
description_web: Come make banners to use in the parade to the Children's Fête!

name: Figure-Drawing Salon
description_book: Draw from live models in medieval poses. Practice your sketching, get feedback, or just relax and work on your drawing. Bring drawing supplies.
description_web: Draw from live models in medieval poses. Practice your sketching, get feedback, or just relax and work on your drawing. Bring pencils, pastels, charcoal and paper of your choice. Some limited supplies will be available.﻿

name: Beginning Scribes' Track
description_book: In this 5-day track, brand-new scribes will learn everything needed to produce award-worthy scrolls based on a 15th-century French manuscript.
description_web:
In this 5-day track, brand-new scribes will learn the skills (Layout, Gothic Calligraphy, Drawing the Flowers, Gilding, and Painting) needed to create award-worthy scrolls based on this 15th-century French manuscript:  http://gallica.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/btv1b53000324z/f1.planchecontact 

In class, you will create a small project suitable for framing.

Fee includes supplies for all 5 days, plus a starter scribal kit to create an 11 x 14" scroll at home.

Students must commit to attending all 5 sessions. Each session will last 2 hours. A different skill will be covered each session.
fee_itemization: Fee includes handouts and supplies for all 5 days, plus a starter scribal kit to create an 11 x 14" scroll at home.  For a detailed list, contact me at hutchnsn@bucknell.edu

instructor: THL Cellach Dhonn inghean Mhic an
name: Introduction to Crewel Embroidery
description_book: This is a hands-on beginner class. Each kit contains all you need to complete a shoulder bag. Bilingual class French/English.
description_web: This is a hands-on class. Each kit contains all you need to complete a shoulder bag. Different designs to choose from. Bilingual class (French/English) and handout.
fee_itemization: $10 per kit

name: Teaching in the SCA: Panel Discussion Pennsic 2017
description_book: This panel focuses on how teachers can improve their abilities as instructors.
description_web: This panel is particularly useful for beginning teachers but can help polish anyone’s skills. Some of these notes, or best practices as we call them, may seem obvious or come to you naturally. We have tried to break down the process as simply as possible. Some skills are more advanced than others. Do not expect yourself to become skilled with all of these practices at once. Work on the ones that seem most reasonable to you and then start incorporating others as you like.

name: Vinegar: Anti-Brewing
description_book: How to make homemade vinegar, plus a tasting of various vinegars and alcohol. Age 21+.

name: Crafting and Delivering a Good Peerage Speech
description_book: How to make your words for your friend meaningful, memorable and appropriate. Non-Peers are also encouraged to attend.

name: Baba Yaga, the Arch-Villainess of Russian Folklore
description_book: Baba Yaga is a common character in Russian fairy tales. We will discuss the diverse rôles she plays, and look into the origins of the character.
description_web: Baba Yaga is a common character in Russian and Eastern European fairy tales. We will discuss the diverse rôles she plays, and look into the origins of the character. (Some familiarity with Russian folklore is helpful, but not really required.)

name: Overcoming Stage Fright
description_book: Learn from an experienced performer and teacher how to overcome fears about your performance.

name: 16th-Century Western Erotica
description_book: An exploration of the *I Modi* and other erotic works of the 16th century.
description_web: *I Modi* (*The Ways*), also known as *The Sixteen Pleasures*,  a famous erotic book of the Italian Renaissance in which a series of sexual positions were explicitly depicted in engravings. We will examine images from this work and others that explore sexual art for its own sake. There are handouts available. Because of the nature of the class, no one under the age of 18 is allowed to attend.

name: So, I Just Bought an Inkle Loom …
description_book: Learn how to read a pattern, warp a loom and create your first inkle weaving – a three-color band, about 1" wide. Limited rental looms available
description_web: You’ve just bought an inkle loom (or, you’re thinking of buying one!) – now what? You’ll learn about the structure of the inkle loom, how to read a pattern, choosing the yarn for your loom, and how to warp the loom. But most importantly, you’ll create your first inkle weaving – a three-color band, about one inch wide. Bring your new loom and shuttle, and join us all. For those of you who haven’t taken the plunge, a limited number of rental looms and shuttles ($30 through the end of War) will be made available.
fee_itemization: weaving yarn

name: Names from West African Inscriptions
description_book: Learn how to construct a medieval West African name using evidence from Arabic or Berber inscriptions.

name: "Welcome to the SCA"
description_book: An introduction to the dream that is the SCA.
description_web: How to find and be comfortable with your place in the dream that is the SCA.

name: Youth Theatre
description_book: For kids ages 6-12 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through story telling, acting, and producing their very own play!
description_web: For kids ages 6-12 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through story telling, acting, and producing their very own play! Come join us as we build a theatre show from the ground up, giving younger kids a creative outlet for all that pent up camping energy! Children 12 and under must have a parent or guardian present.

name: Tudor Treatments and Trims on a Tight Tab
description_book: We will look at some trims and clothing treatments from 16th-century England, and discuss how to recreate these with maximum impact for minimum cost.

name: Ælflæd, Lady of Mercia
description_book: Exploring the life and deeds of Ælflæd, Lady of the Mercians, co-creator of a unified England in the 10th century.
description_web: The amazing daughter of Ælfred the Great was as instrumental in reconquering and holding the Saxon lands taken by the Vikings as her brother King Edward (the Elder). She ruled Mercia with her husband Æthelred, and alone after his death, extending the *burh* system, and pushing back the borders of the Danelaw.

name: ECD: ABC for Three
description_book: Practice three three-couple English Country dances: *All in a Garden Green, Boate Man, and Chestnut.*

location: Dark Horde Moritu (E09 - Brewers Rd & Chandlers)
name: Goldilocks and the SCA Feast
description_book: A few tips and ideas on portion sizes so everyone's stuffed without having tons of leftovers.

name: *Karnoffel*
description_book: The oldest known card game is a trick-taking with rules seemingly designed to make you mis-play. Come learn and play a round.

name: Japanese Stab Binding: Make a Book in Under 1 Hour
description_book: Make two books in an hour using the stab binding method of Japan. No handout, as we will focus on the craft rather than the history.
description_web: Come make two books in no time at all using the ancient stab binding method of Japan. There is no handout, as we will focus on the craft rather than the history, but a card with reference sites will be available. Supplies are limited to 6.
fee_itemization: Beeswax, Paper for book pages, decorative paper for book covers and linen binding thread.

name: Ottoman Singing
description_book: Learning to sing the 15th-16th-century Ottoman compositions, *Amed nesim-i subh-dem* and *Hem kamer hem zühre vû hem müşterî der âsuman.*
description_web: We will be teaching two Ottoman compositions from the 15th-16th centuries, as well as reviewing songs taught last year. This music is typically performed with singing. As such, we will be teaching a singing class to learn these songs in the original Ottoman Turkish language. What will you learn and experience: 15th-16th-century Seljuk/Ottoman songs and their history; the musical modality *Makam Rast*; pronunciation of Ottoman Turkish and Persian along with a brief history and etymology, learning in the traditional *Meşk* learning style, as well as appropriate Ottoman customs. The five classes will be progressive; however, students may join in when they wish, although attendance at all the classes is strongly encouraged. Students may join the class's Facebook page in advance to orient themselves to the song and class: https://www.facebook.com/groups/398762226986519/
fee_itemization: Handout

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, Thursday, 8/10 (time and place to be determined).

name: Natural Hair Dye: Henna and Beyond
description_book: Use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever. **Bring chairs.**
description_web: **Please Bring Chairs**. Learn how to use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever. We'll focus on henna but explore other herbs to color and protect hair naturally without dangerous chemicals. Some supplies will be available at the class.

name: Pelican Queen of Arms Roadshow
description_book: Are you curious about how heraldic decisions are made? Pelican Queen of Arms will conduct a decision meeting on-site. For heralds and non-heralds.

name: Pennsic Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! Singing in the Choir is an intense and rewarding experience with a concert Thursday War Week.
description_web: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! This year's concert theme is "A Medieval Christmas" The repertoire includes pieces by Hassler, King Henry VIII, Praetorius and Morley, conducted by Lady Siri Toivosdotter. Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on Thursday evening of War Week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is helpful, but not required if you learn the music in advance. Sheet music and audio tracks are available online at https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsicxliiichoirs

name: Fabris and You
description_book: A short introduction to the principles and postures of Italian Rapier as taught by Fabris. Bring mask, gorget, and rapier.

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: Basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 4-part class; different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*
Day 4- *Kashlimah* and other strange stuff

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: A Hand a Day: Early Gothic Calligraphy
description_book: Learn a style of calligraphy used throughout mid-period Western Europe, with emphasis on common strokes and stylistic variations.
description_web: Early Gothic is a hand that every calligrapher should have in their toolbox. It is one of the most universal families of hands, appearing throughout Western Europe in the post-Carolingian era and remaining in use for multiple centuries. As such, it can be used for a wide variety of potential scroll recipients and exemplars. By using the "toolbox" method of learning calligraphic hands, we can quickly and easily deconstruct a sample redaction, learn the common strokes, then explore variations and stylistic differences so that each calligrapher can develop their own signature variation of this style.

name: Lokasenna: What We Learn When Loki Shouts at Gods
description_book: By doing a close reading of the Norse poem, *Lokasenna*, we will talk about Loki and the other gods' characteristics and personalities.
description_web: By doing a close reading of the Norse poem, *Lokasenna*, we will talk about Loki and the other gods' characteristics and personalities.

name: So You Have The Dress, Now What? Accessorize!
description_book: Examine 16th-century Italian accessories, such as *zibellini*, girdles, and handkerchiefs. See how modern materials can make period accessories.
description_web: You've completed your gown, now accessorize! Take a look at 16th-century Italian accessories, such as *zibellini*, girdles, fans, shoes, and handkerchiefs. Get inspiration on how modern materials can be used to make period-looking accessories. Please touch the accessories!
fee_itemization: Handouts

name: Presentation and Display
description_book: Present your A&S to its fullest potential. Learn how to dress it up and present it with confidence. Bring pictures of your displays to brainstorm.
description_web: Present your A&S to its fullest potential. You've put your heart and soul into your Arts and Sciences; make sure everyone else can see how amazing your work is. Learn how to dress it up and present it with confidence. Feel free to bring pictures of displays you have done.
fee_itemization: $1 for handout.

name: Demystifying Fabrics
description_book: An introductory class on fabrics, including pros and cons of common types. How can the same fiber yield many kinds of fabric?
description_web: An introductory class on fabrics. We'll review period-appropriate fibers (and some commonly seen synthetics), and handle samples of various types. Why can't you put wool in the washing machine? How can stiff silk taffeta and filmy silk *crepe de chine* be made from the same thing? For beginning sewers or anyone interested in clothing and fashion.
fee_itemization: Copying fee for handout

name: From Fiber to Garb
description_book: We will discuss fiber, prep, yarn and cloth-making choices in different periods and locations. Emphasis will be on techniques and fiber sources.
description_web: We will discuss fiber, prep, yarn and cloth-making choices in different periods and locations. Emphasis will be on available techniques and fiber sources. Examples will be provided, but please bring your own to share.

name: The Kingdom of Zion in Muenster of 1534
description_book: A lesson on the fascinating story of the spectacular rise and fall of Muenster, Germany, after it was taken over by a radical sect of Anabaptists.
description_web: A lesson on the fascinating story of the spectacular rise and fall of Muenster, Germany, after it was taken over by a radical sect of Anabaptists. Learn about the many controversial religious and social changes made within the city, as well as the *Landsknecht* participation on both sides of the siege. The results of the punishment of the radical leaders can be seen to this day.

name: Uppity Women of the Middle Ages
description_book: Women in the Middle Ages are sometimes seen only as an appendage to men. Meet ladies who prove the adage: "Well-behaved women seldom make history."
description_web: The title says it all. Sometimes we think of women in the Middle Ages as being the lady waiting to be rescued. Meet some ladies who prove the adage: "Well-behaved women seldom make history.”

name: Irish Bardic Tradition
description_book: The Irish Bardic Tradition from pre-Christian times to the Flight of the Earls (1607).
description_web: The Irish Bardic Tradition from pre-Christian times to the Flight of the Earls (1607). Details on the Bardic Schools, status and power of bards, ability to curse through "satire," the epics, praise poems, music, and presentation style.

name: Pulling the Teeth Out of Stage Fright
description_book: We'll pin down this ugly-muggly monster, dissect some elements of anxiety, wrestle common buggaboos, and practice some spook-busting techniques.
description_web: The vast majority of us experience **some** level of stage fright or performance anxiety, whether it's in a bardic space, or the CEO's office. We'll pin down this ugly-muggly monster, dissect some of the elements of anxiety, wrestle our most common buggaboos into the daylight, and practice some spook-busting techniques. Focused on Bardic Arts, but applicable to all performances.

name: Fundamentals of Voice Production
description_book: Intro to basic voice for singers and performers. An active, participatory class for beginners.
description_web: Learn the basics of vocal technique, including methods for dealing with nervousness. This is an active, participatory class for those who have never had a voice lesson. Those who can stand comfortably will be asked to do so for much of the class, but all the activities can be adapted to a seated position.

name: An Analysis of Middle-Eastern Clothing in the SCA
description_book: A discussion of the differences and similarities of clothing worn in the now Middle East in the SCA time periods.
description_web: What is the difference between Ottoman and Persian clothing? What did the Seljuks wear? Did men and women wear the same thing? A discussion of who wore when and where with hands-on example.

name: Hand-Sewing
description_book: Learn to hand-sew hems and necklines, and construct flat-felled seams, for perfect period garb projects that you can work on anywhere! (YouthU, 10-14)
description_web: Machines might be faster, but hand-sewing allows you to make better-looking garments anywhere you want to go! We'll start with how to thread a needle, and avoid making knots where we don't want them, then learn to sew basic hems and seams. We'll move on to flat-felling seams so they don't fray, facing necklines that lie flat, and how to quickly edge veils as time, interest, and skill level allow. Linen fabric, linen thread, needles, and wax, along with a handout with all the details so you can refer to it later, provided free. Geared for youth participants. (YouthU, 10-14)

name: Arabic 101: Speaking and Pronunciation
description_book: Learn to pronounce Arabic words and names, and how to use "Arablish" in your SCA life. Maghreb-focus, but useful for many personas and cultures!
description_web: People all over the medieval world used Arabic language. From China to Mauritania in dar al-Islam, and throughout Europe, Arabic was a part of life. This class focuses on pronunciation of common names and phrases, and gives SCA-friendly phrases useful for research, conversation, and developing a more authentic SCA persona. We will only be using English orthography/alphabet. While the lesson will be useful for personas in all regions and cultures, the dialect and names will skew toward the Maghreb region. This is one of a two-part series; the other focuses on reading and writing. Class guide will be available at: http://www.talaalzahra.com/pennsic-university
fee_itemization: $1 for printing of handouts.

name: Simple Tunic and Pants Pattern
description_book: We will make a simple pattern for a tunic and pants using your measurements.
description_web: We will make a simple tunic and pants pattern using your measurements. We will draw out a very basic pattern for pants and a simple tunic which you will be able to take with you and use at home. Please bring a tape measure for body measurements, a pair of scissors, pen and paper to write down your measurements before making your pattern.
fee_itemization:
1.00 for handout
4.00 for non-paper pattern pieces

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Populace Archery War Point Shoot
description_book: Populace Archery War Point will consist of three challenging shoots: a clout (100 yards), soldier shoot, and castle window (timed).
description_web: Populace Archery War Point will consist of three challenging shoots: a clout (100 yards), soldier shoot, and castle window (timed). Come and score points for your kingdom. Sunday's populace shoot: 11 am to 5 pm; Monday 11 am to 5 pm; Tuesday 11 am to 7 pm; Wednesday 11 am to 5 pm; and Friday 9 am to 12 pm.

name: Beginning *Atlatl*
description_book: How to throw *atlatl* darts effectively.

name: Beginner Dance: 15th-Century Italian
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class starts with basic steps and patterns, then teaches fun, simple dances from 15th-century Italy.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class starts with basic steps and patterns, then teaches fun, simple dances from 15th-century Italy. No partners required.

name: *Game of the Goose*
description_book: Period game in the style of *Chutes and Ladders*. We will review the rules and then play through a game, dice willing.
description_web: Period game in the style of *Chutes and Ladders*. The game is purely deterministic (dice-based) so it is suitable for children, but for adults it is often played with stakes to make repeated play more interesting. We will review the rules and then play through a game, dice willing.

name: Field Battle: The Grant Pageant (Heavy Weapons)
description_book: description added soon
description_web:
TENTATIVE:
Format: Last Man Standing (each battle – the side with the last man standing wins the point for the battle)
Setup: Open Field (traditional space); Field Size 600 x 600 feet (whole field), Starting sides (facing direction East or West TBD); starting lines will be 100 feet the edge of the field so all fighters from both sides can be on the field for the starting cannon
Time Limit: Not timed
Number of Run Throughs: 4; 15-minute reset time between Field Battles
War Points: 4; each Field Battle will be worth 1 War Point for a total of 4 War Points from all Field Battles (NON-Traditional – this is a suggested change)
Marshals Required: Middle, East and Aethelmearc must provide at least 8 marshals each in addition to their Earl Marshal to start the battle.

name: Middle Eastern Dance 101
description_book: An introductory series of classes that explore basic belly dance moves and choreography.
description_web: This series of classes goes back to the very basics of belly dancing, or Middle Eastern Dance. We'll learn about the foundations of Middle Eastern dance, its history, and cultural significance in the North Africa/Middle Eastern regions. Utilizing the "body dictionary" framework, we'll review movements and isolations for each part of the dancer's body, and explore costuming ideas for performing the dance in period. There will be printed handouts with information and belly dance resources for a nominal fee. We'll end the series of dance sessions with a short choreography that illustrates the various movements inherent in this timeless dance. This class is designed for the beginner student of dance.
fee_itemization: Handouts will include historical information, costuming suggestions and resources (reading, music, etc.) for dance students

name: Loom-Woven Pouch
description_book: Create a tabby-woven pouch on a one-piece loom.
description_web: Create a tabby-woven pouch on a one-piece loom. Class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: loom, string, needle

name: Throwing for the Physically Challenged
description_book: Most physical limitations are not a barrier to this martial art. Please join us to learn how to work with people with limitations.

name: Target Construction
description_book: This class will teach the construction of targets for Thrown Weapons.

name: Intro to Celtic Knotwork: 5-Dot Technique
description_book: This is an intro class to get you started down the rabbit hole to creating beautiful Celtic knotwork for any use you can imagine.
description_web: This is an intro class to get you started down the rabbit hole to creating beautiful Celtic knotwork for any use you can imagine. If you have ever wanted to create your own knotwork design for illumination, embroidery, leatherwork, wood carving, bone carving, or just because it is fun, this is the class for you.
fee_itemization: Handout and materials

name: Basic Beginner Illumination Make & Take
description_book: A basic beginner illumination survey class, with an opportunity to dabble with paints and learn more about illumination basics.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to learn more about illuminating but cannot take the beginner track? This course is a basic beginner illumination survey class, with an opportunity to dabble with paints and learn more about illumination basics. This class will not include period pigments or calligraphy, just a chance to play with some paint and take a simple painted piece home with you. All supplies will be furnished, but feel free to bring any scribal equipment if desired. You will have a paint palette and reference handouts to take home.
fee_itemization: $2.00 if handouts only.  $5.00 if supplies & handouts both.

name: Very Basic *Naalbinding*
description_book: Introduction to *naalbinding* for those with no prior experience. I will demonstrate a simple *naalbinding* stitch and discuss basic techniques.
description_web: Introduction to *naalbinding* for those with no prior experience. *Naalbinding* is a craft which creates a stretchy fabric by using a large sewing needle and yarn. This predates knitting and is found in a variety of medieval cultures. I will demonstrate a simple *naalbinding* stitch (Oslo stitch) and discuss the basic techniques.
fee_itemization: No fee

name: Researching and Scripting Peerage Ceremonies
description_book: Sources, approaches, tips and tricks for researching custom peerage ceremonies.
description_web: This class will focus on writing custom peerage ceremonies--one of the best and most meaningful tasks a herald can take on. We will discuss extant period sources, as well as how to use other sources such as law, literature, liturgy, guild statutes, and even artwork as a guide for creating peerage ceremonies for any persona. Do you live in a kingdom with standard or traditional peerage ceremonies? We'll talk about the touches that can be made to standard ceremonies to make them fit various personas. Those who have written peerage ceremonies are welcome to bring samples to share.
fee_itemization: Photocopies

instructor: Baroness Allegra Ginevra Soave d Napoli
name: Beginning Bobbin Lace
description_book: A discussion on the the history and development of bobbin lace, followed by learning and practicing the basic stitches of lace-making.
description_web: Lace has been called fabric poetry. This is a beginner's bobbin lace class for those who haven't made lace before or who are just starting out. We will begin with a discussion of the history and development of bobbin lace, then there will be hands-on time when people can try making lace. Experienced lacers are invited to bring their pillows and stop by with their lace!
fee_itemization: 12 lace bobbins per kit: $7; foam pillow: $1.50; cloth cover; $1; Thread, pins: $.50.

name: Use of Basic Silversmithing Tools
description_book: Silversmithing on a budget. Survey and demonstration of tools for use with nonferrous metals. Soldering and fusing demonstrations will be included.
fee_itemization: $2 for handout

name: Logboats in the Middle Ages
description_book: An examination of hewn or assembled boats (not rafts) made primarily from logs in the Middle Ages and Renaissance.
description_web: The development and spread of fabricated plank hulls for boats surprisingly did not stop people from making boats out of logs. We will discuss a few surviving European examples from the years between 600 and 1600.

name: Passover Foods for a Medieval Seder
description_book: Covers the foods eaten at Ashkenazi Passover seders in the Middle Ages. We'll taste a number of these foods.
description_web: This class will cover the foods eaten at Passover seders in the Middle Ages when matzah was an inch thick and horseradish was only eaten as an ingredient in charoset. We will be looking at the evolution of the rulings about various foods, recipes to make some of them, how some of the practices changed. Includes taste testing.
fee_itemization: to cover cost of handout and foods we taste test.

name: Irish Woman's Dilemma: What Do I Wear?
description_book: An intro to clothing that an Irish woman would wear. Spans from about 500 to 1600. First hour will be pre-1100, second hour post-1100.
description_web: Many want to have an Irish persona because Ireland has a rich and interesting history, beautiful music and stories, and complex and interesting art. Yet when I went to try and make my persona more historically accurate in dress, I found a dearth of concrete evidence and little research of the subject. I decided to find as many sources as I could, compile what I found, and try to present a reasonable approximation of what the Irish would have worn throughout our period. This class will give an overview from early to late period on what I believe a typical Irish woman would have worn, as well as provide a list of resources for you to explore on your own. New this year: the class will be split by the hour with the  first hour being pre-1100, second hour post-1100.
fee_itemization: Cost to offset printing cost of handout(s), will likely be 10+pages

name: The New Bard's Road Map
description_book: A how-to primer for new/aspiring bards. Developing repertoire, finding performance opportunities, seeking mentors and patrons, joining the community.
description_web: A how-to primer for new or aspiring bards. Developing a repertoire, finding performance opportunities, seeking mentors and patrons, gaining visibility, becoming part of the bardic community.

name: Beginning *Pysanky*
description_book: Students will learn the history of the *pysanka*, and have the opportunity to create one of their own.
description_web: Students will learn the history of the *pysanka*, as well as the techniques involved, and have the opportunity to create one of their own. The class is listed as 3 hours to allow plenty of time for writing the shells; it doesn't usually take that long.
fee_itemization: $5 overall, $2 if you just want the handout (but it IS a hands-on class ...)

name: Viking Age Tablet Weaving: Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of the major finds of tablet weaving from Norse sites like Birka, Oseberg, Mammen, Elisenhof, Snartemo and Eura.
description_web: A brief survey of the major finds of tablet weaving from Norse and neighboring sites, including Birka, Oseberg, Mammen, Elisenhof, Evebo, Snartemo, Eura and others.
fee_itemization: 40-page handout

name: Known World Dance and Music Symposium: Discussion
description_book: General discussion about the Known World Dance and Music Symposium. All are welcome
description_web: General discussion about the Known World Dance and Music Symposium. All are welcome. We will discuss past and future bids.

name: A Celtic Introduction to Medieval Music
description_book: Celtic music hasn't changed much in 600 years so it's an excellent starting point for learning medieval music. We'll look at similarities and sources

name: *Ballo del Fiore*
description_book: This simple 16th-century Italian dance has versions for 2, 3, 4 and 5 dancers. Join us as we explore the different combinations. Beginners welcome.

name: Annual Barter Town Swap Meet
description_book: It is time once again to barter. Come enjoy the Barter Bazaar and swap those unwanted items for that lost treasure!
description_web: It is time once again to barter. Come enjoy the Barter Bazaar and swap those unwanted items for that lost treasure!  Everyone is welcome!

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
fee_itemization: materials

name: Middle Eastern Dance for Teens
description_book: A TeenU class. This is a gender-neutral beginners' dance class, focusing on getting young dancers comfortable with dancing at *haflas*.
description_web: A TeenU class. This is a gender-neutral beginners' dance class, focused on getting young dancers comfortable with dancing at *haflas*. We'll be joined by some of the members of Baklava, a Middle Eastern Dance troupe with ages ranging from 11 to 15.

location: Orluk Oasis (W10, on the lake near the Peninsula.)
name: Pennsic Welcome *Hafla* for New Dancers &Musicians
description_book: Join Ziggy & Rajni for a fun *hafla*, or "party," and use the dancing & drumming skills you have been working all. Beginner focused. Open to all.
description_web: Join Ziggy and Rajni for a fun *hafla*, or "party," where you use the dancing and drumming skills you have been working on. All levels welcome, although we will make a special effort for beginners to play music and dance for us. Please bring a light refreshment to share if you are able.

name: Pennsic Youth Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 19 to learn period vocal music and perform as part of the Known World Choirs Concert, Thursday War Week.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 19 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella* with Deonna von Aachen. We will rehearse 12-1 pm Sunday, August 6, through Wednesday, August 9. Performance will be part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/10, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.) More information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-youth-choir

name: *il Titolo Provvisorio* - Closed Dress Rehearsal
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Intro to *Kanzashi* Flowers
description_book: This is an introductory class in making basic *Kanzashi* Flower traditional hair ornaments worn in Geisha hair styles.
description_web: This is an introductory class in making basic 6-petal *Kanzashi* Flowers traditional hair ornaments worn in Geisha hair styles. Each student will be provided with all necessary pre-prepared materials necessary to complete their very own *Kanzashi* Flower in this class.
fee_itemization: All necessary pre-prepared materials necessary to complete a 6 petal Kanzashi Flower in the traditional style.  All necessary tools will be provided.

name: Teaching Beginners to Throw
description_book: For Thrown Weapons marshals and MITs, this class will show how to teach thrown weapons to someone who wants to learn to throw.  Recommended for MITs.

name: Echoes of the Dumbek
description_book: Mark of Orluk Oasis will play a rhythm or phrase and the class repeats. Students may have a chance to "call" a phrase or rhythm if they wish.
description_web: Mark of Orluk Oasis will play a rhythm or phrase and the class repeats. Students may have a chance to "call" a phrase or rhythm if they wish.

name: Wearing My Lady's Favor
description_book: The belt favor is ubiquitous for SCA garb. But is it historically correct? What would a lady give as a favor during period?
description_web: The belt favor is ubiquitous for SCA garb. But is it historically correct? What would a lady give as a favor during period?

name: You, Too, Can Write a Letter of Recommendation
description_book: Any member of the SCA, of any rank, can recommend any other member for any award at any level. Interested? Come to this class and learn how.

name: Where's Lord Waldo?
description_book: A look at the history and trivia of SCA geography.
description_web: A look at the history and trivia of SCA geography.

name: Story Time with Tempus
description_book: This is an hour with Tempus. Good time to have a nap while he rambles on about anything. Adventure, excitement and really wild things.
description_web: This is an hour with Tempus. Good time to have a nap while he rambles on about anything. Adventure, excitement and really wild things... Maybe some hand-kissing and stories of travel; might do some science, or hear about his cabins. Or it may just be a good time for an afternoon nap.

name: Wee Scadians: Find them, Keep Them!
description_book: How to recruit and maintain families with children in your local group, and what to do once you have them!
description_web: Youth and families are essential to the future (and present!) of the SCA. This class will discuss how to recruit and maintain families with children in your local group, and what to do with them once you have them! Children's Activities are fun and all, but there are so many things beyond that to be done to keep children (and their parents) happy, engaged, and excited about their future in the Society. Come get some pointers from a Youth Officer and SCA parent, and bring your own ideas to share! (Children are welcome to attend, and will have their own quiet activity to do during class.)

name: Anglo-Saxon Riddles
description_book: Come learn about the riddles of the Exeter Book and their place in Anglo-Saxon culture, with examples to take to camp and share!
description_web: Come learn about the riddles of the Exeter Book and their place in Anglo-Saxon culture, with examples to take to camp and share!

name: Jewelry Demonstration: Etching Copper Alloys
description_book: Demo and lecture class. Intro to tools and techniques to etch copper, brass and nickel silver with ferric chloride. Various resists will be discussed.
description_web:
In this demonstration and lecture class you will be introduced to the tools and techniques used to etch copper, brass, and nickel silver with Ferric Chloride. Various resists will be discussed with an emphasis on heat transfer resists: PnP Blue and Toner Transfer Paper (TTP). You will be able to adapt these techniques to etch a wide variety of jewelry items, favors, largesse, coronets, belt elements that can be riveted on, armor decorations, scrolls, etc. 

Most of the techniques discussed can be used to etch fine silver and sterling silver using Ferric Nitrate.

The hand-out will be available on my website at: http://ga.crimsonkraken.com/metalSawing.html
fee_itemization: This is a demonstration class.

name: Divination: Palmistry
description_book: History, theory, and practice of one of the most ancient of divinatory arts, palm reading. Hands-on class. Learn to read each other's palms in class.
description_web: History, theory, and practice of one of the most ancient of divinatory arts, palm reading. Learn to read the secrets of a soul, writ upon the hand for only the wise to see. This is a hands-on class where you will actually read each others' palms.

name: Viking Age Textile Tools
description_book: A survey of textile tools found in Norse and neighboring sites, including spinning, weaving, and cutting tools.
description_web: A survey of textile tools found in Norse and neighboring sites. We will look at cards, combs, looms, loom weights, shears, shuttles, skein-winders, smoothing stones, spindles, and whorls from Birka, Coppergate, Dublin, Hedeby, Lund, Novgorod, Oseberg and Ribe.
fee_itemization: 50-page handout

name: 14th-Century Italian Secular Vocal Music
description_book: An overview of the musical and poetic forms of 14th-century Italian secular vocal music. Listening examples will be provided.
description_web: This class provides an overview of the musical and poetic forms of 14th-century Italian secular vocal music. Listening examples will be provided.

name: Norse Mythology: Don't be a Snorri
description_book: When writing the *eddas*, Snorri Sturluson had biases and alternate motives. He tried to make Norse myth mirror the Greeks and seem more relevant.
description_web: When writing the *eddas*, Snorri Sturluson had many biases and alternate motives. He tried to make Norse myth mirror the Greeks and seem more relevant.

name: A Taste of *Maghribi* and Andalusi Cuisine
description_book: Discussion, recipes & tastes from al-Andalus and al-Maghrib, based on two 13th-C. Andalusi cookbooks, *Fadalat al-Khiwan* and "Anonymous Andalusian".
description_web: Discussion of the cuisines of al-Andalus and al-Maghrib, based on two surviving 13th-C. Andalusi cookbooks, the so-called "Anonymous Andalusian" cookbook, and my translation of the *Fudalat al-khiwan fi tayibat al-ta'am wa al-alwan* ("Delights of the Table, the Best Foods & Dishes") by Ibn Razin al-Tujibi. Handout will include recipes, and I will bring a few dishes to sample.
fee_itemization: For photocopying and purchasing ingredients for food

name: How to Get More Involved at Events
description_book: You've been to a few events, but are looking to become more than a spectator. Here are some tips and tricks to getting more involved and staying busy.
description_web: You've been to a few events, but are looking to become more than a spectator. Here are some tips and tricks to getting more involved and staying busy during events.

name: Juggling 101: Beginner
description_book: Learn to juggle three balls in the simplest pattern. Equipment available for use or purchase.
description_web: The most basic 3-ball cascade juggling. Juggling balls will be made available for use by the class and may be bought afterward from the instructor.

location: Argent Fox (Merchant area behind the barn)
name: Harp for Absolute Beginners
description_book: Come learn the very basics of playing harp! Please bring a harp if you have one and a chair if you need one. Prior experience not necessary. All ages.
description_web: A very basic introduction to the fundamentals of modern harp, that is to say **hand position**! Learn how not to injure yourself playing! Please bring a harp if you have one and a chair if you need one; we will be holding the class at Argent Fox and can borrow his harps and chairs, but he only has so many and I don't know how many students will attend. We will review hand position, go over a couple basic exercises to practice with, and I will provide handouts with a simple tune to practice. Ability to either read music or memorize a definite plus, but anyone's welcome to show up, and I'll teach you what I can. All ages emphatically welcomed.

name: *Atlatls* of the World
description_book: *Atlatls* (spear/dart throwers) have been found on every continent except Antarctica. Come see their wide variety and try them out.
description_web: *Atlatls* (spear throwers, *woomeras, speerschleuders*, etc.) have been found on every continent except Antarctica. They have been used from 30,000 years ago up to the present day in some areas. Come see their wide variety and actually try them out on the *atlatl* range. **In case of rain, we will meet in the thrown weapons range classroom tent.**
fee_itemization: A limited number of atlatls and darts will be available for sale to the students who attend this class. Variable costs $15-$50.

name: Basic Tablet Weaving
description_book: Learn to warp the loom and weave a basic pattern. Limited number of small looms and materials available for use and/or purchase.
fee_itemization:
handout: $1.00
loom, cards & shuttle: $20
yarn: $5

name: Introductory Performance Workshop
description_book: Bring a song or story to perform, 5 minutes or less, and receive advice and suggestions from experienced performers in a low-pressure setting.
description_web: Want to participate in a bardic circle or a competition, but don't feel confident in your abilities? Bring a song or story to perform, 5 minutes or less, and receive advice and suggestions from experienced performers in a low-pressure setting.

name: *Kijin-ryōri*: Dining for the Japanese Nobility
description_book: An introduction to the food and food culture of the imperial court and nobility. The culinary calendar. Organization of meals and meal etiquette.
fee_itemization: I have been advised to provide a multipage handout for this class.

name: Penta Pentamere Dances
description_book: Learn five easy dances that require no more than two couples: *Petite Rose, Montarde Bransle, Grene Gynger, Black Alman* and *Rufty Tufty*.
description_web: Learn five easy dances that require no more than two couples: *Petite Rose, Montarde Bransle, Grene Gynger, Black Alman* and *Rufty Tufty*. Buy a step-by-step dance guide and the music if you want or download here: http://www.michiganleftturn.org/Penta-Pentamere-Dances.htm
fee_itemization:
$2 - Dance steps
$10 - 6 song CD
Purchase not required

name: *Xiang-qi* for Beginners (Chinese Chess)
description_book: A 90-minute class in how to play *Xiang-qi* (Chinese Chess). History, rules, strategy and tactics; enough time left for students to play afterwards.
description_web: A 90-minute class in how to play *Xiang-qi* (Chinese Chess). History, rules, strategy and tactics; enough time left for students to play afterwards.

name: Bridge Battle (Heavy Weapons)
description_book: description added soon
description_web:
TENTATIVE:
Format: Timed Battle; at the end of each battle, the bridge flags will be checked; the side with the most flags raised for their color wins the war point for the battle
Setup: 5 bridges with no fording; the bridge lines will be painted on the field prior to Field battle in the morning; we will ask fighters after the field battle to grab one bail and drop it on one of the bridge lines; setup for the bridges should be very quick with that much help available; bridge rules on engagement will be the same as last year. Control of a bridge: the rope flag poles used for other battles will be deployed at the midpoint, south side of each bridge. Control of the bridge is determined by what flag is up at the end of the battle. Bridge Length = 90’, Bridge Width = 27’; distance between bridges 40’ no fording or going around the outer bridges; traditional layout with the bridges facing East/West; each bridge will have a control flag on the north side bridge wall halfway across the bridge (see diagram)
Time Limit: 15 minutes per battle
Number of Run Throughs: 3; 15-minute reset time between Bridge Battles
War Points: 3; each Bridge Battle will be worth 1 War Point for a total of 3 War Points from all Bridge Battles (NON-Traditional – this is a suggested change)
Marshals Required: Middle, East and Aethelmearc must provide at least 8 marshals each in addition to their Earl Marshal to start the battle.
Notes: Combat Archery and Siege will be included in the 1st and 3rd bridges with no Combat Archery and Siege for the 2nd Bridge Battle.
	Combat Archers will not be allowed on the bridges
	Siege Engines must be a minimum of 50’ from the bridge edges

name: Cued Improv with Swords!
description_book: Learn Sword Dance combos & cues, in-hand and balancing, plus how to change leaders. Easier than it looks! PDF handouts online. Dance sword required.
description_web: Tribal sword combos! Learn Tribal Odyssey Sword combinations and cues: turns, shimmies, travel steps, including how to change leaders. Yes, it really is easier than it looks! PDF handouts online. Balanced dance sword required.

name: Pennsic Children's Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: Children's Choir is open to children up to age 13 who love to sing. Experience the world of singing medieval and Renaissance music. All are welcome!
description_web: Pennsic Children's Choir is open to all children up to age 13 who love to sing. Experience the world of Renaissance and medieval vocal music. We will rehearse from 1-2 pm Sunday, August 6, through Wednesday, August 9, at the PA Rehearsal tent. We will perform as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/10, in the PAT; further details TBA during regular rehearsals.) Parents must attend rehearsals with children under 12. Music and more information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-children-s-choir

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own; class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: weaving materials, string

name: East Kingdom Rapier Tournament
description_book: Join us for the East Kingdom Pennsic Rapier Tournament! Tournament plan will be a round-robin followed by a double-elimination.
description_web: Join us for the East Kingdom Pennsic Rapier Tournament! Tournament plan will be a round-robin followed by a double-elimination. Efforts will be made to balance out round-robins. Come show your skill as this tournament returns to the fold. Tournament is open to all qualified fencers from all kingdoms.

name: Cut-and-Thrust Rapier Tournament
description_book: This C&T tourney is intended for complex rapiers and late-period side swords only. Modified points-based rules promote clean and realistic fencing.
description_web: Fight with your rapier the way it was meant to be used! This C&T tourney is intended for late-period rapiers and side swords with complex hilts. Period-inspired conventions and points-based rules prioritize clean fencing and showmanship. Swept hilts, basket hilts, and similar guards required. Permitted styles include single sword, sword and dagger, sword and buckler (14" maximum), and sword and cloak.

name: Byzantine Chainmail
description_book: This style of chainmail was prevalent for several centuries, across multiple cultures, throughout our period in the Mediterranean and European worlds.
description_web: Learn the Byzantine chainmail weave that was prevalent throughout our period across multiple cultures. All hand-prepared materials necessary to complete class project are provided. For those who don't have them, tools are available on a first-come, first-served basis.
fee_itemization: Sufficient hand-turned & cut rings, 12ga 5/8 in diameter, to complete class project.

name: Beyond Axe, Knife, and Spear
description_book: Tent stakes, military shovels, farm implements, pizza cutters, and Deadly Ninja Throwing Chickens. Show and tell: demos pending approval.

name: *Riq* Curious?
description_book: The *riq* (Middle Eastern tambourine) is a versatile instrument and super portable! This class will show the basics for first-timers.
description_web: The *riq* (Middle Eastern tambourine) is a versatile instrument and super portable! This class will show the basics for first-timers. Any tambourine that has jingles and a skin on it will work to get started.

name: It Takes My Child to Raze a Village... Pennsic
description_book: A special Pennsic edition of this very popular series of activities from the Midrealm.
description_web: A special Pennsic edition of this very popular series of activities from the Midrealm.

name: Scribal Tea
description_book: Join your fellow scribes for light refreshments and conversation about all things scribal in the Æthelmearc Royal Encampment Pavilion.
description_web: Join your fellow scribes for light refreshments and conversation about all things scribal in the Æthelmearc Royal Encampment Pavilion.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.
fee_itemization: materials

name: Hand-Sewing
description_book: Instead of talking about final touches, use hand-sewn seams, hems, and facings to give your garment the perfect *first* touches.

name: The Submission Process
description_book: An explanation of the basics of documenting and submitting for registration a name, device or badge, and what happens to it afterwards.
description_web: So, you've worked with a herald to register your name and/or armory. What happens now? This class intends to explain the basics of documenting and submitting a name, device or badge, and what happens to it afterwards.This class is not limited to heralds. Everybody can learn how things happen.

name: Intro to Research: Research like an Academic
description_book: Learn about types of sources, styles of citations, what "peer reviewed" means, how to find good sources, and more! Also, applying it to A&S entries.
description_web: This class will cover a quick introduction to research, including types of sources, styles of citations, what "peer reviewed" means, how/where to find good sources for your topic, and more. We will also look at how to apply your research to A&S entries. Taught by a university faculty member, this class is open to researchers of any level, but targeted towards beginning researchers.
fee_itemization: $1 for printing costs

name: Bizarre Religious Practices of the Middle Ages
description_book: Some medieval people flogged themselves, licked lepers, or got advice from bits of bone. Learn why these things made sense to the people we emulate.
description_web: Medieval Europeans had some religious practices that were downright weird. However, even the most outlandish behaviors were honest attempts to find spiritual connections or improve the world. Learn a bit about the context of some of the strangest religious practices of the medieval period. Due to time, we'll focus on western Christianity. (This is an updated version of the class taught in previous years, with a new handout.)

name: Herbalism and Botanical References
description_book: Come find out about period texts on herbalism, horticulture, botany, and agriculture, from the Romans to 1600.
description_web: Come find out about period texts on herbalism, horticulture, botany, and agriculture, from the Romans to 1600. We will discuss texts, cultures, and the evolution of data within SCA period.
fee_itemization: $2 for handout.

name: Cordials: Of *Aqua Vitae* and Alchemy
description_book: What were cordials in period? What's the difference between *Aqua Vitae, Aqua Composita*, and a Cordial Water? How do we redact one?
description_web:
What were cordials in period? How can a SCAdian enter a period cordial in an A&S competition if we're not allowed to distill? What's the difference between *Aqua Vitae, Aqua Composita*, and a Cordial Water? Are cordials a product of brewing or alchemy?
Join Lady Zillah al Sighira al Hurra and her husband Vladimir on a voyage of discovery.

name: Making a Hare Net
description_book: We will apply the ancient technique of knotting to the creation of a purse net that is used in Europe to catch large rabbits or hares.
description_web: We will apply the ancient technique of knotting to the creation of a purse net that is used in Europe to catch large rabbits or hares. Use of the net will be explained, as well as the use of the netting knot for other applications such as fishing nets, corrals, hair nets, and lacis fabric. Kits will be available for purchase or you can bring your own. Do not bring netting needles/spacers for hair nets, as the scale is too small.
fee_itemization: netting kit  - estimate

name: Let's Make a Mumming or Masque!
description_book: In this workshop, we'll learn how to build a theatrical mumming or masque script by experimenting with grab bags of options created by the class.
description_web: Mummings and masques are entertaining and period theatrical ways to praise someone or commemorate an event. However, period scripts aren't usually adaptable for many SCA purposes. You'll need to construct your own. In this workshop, we'll build the outlines of performances using grab bags of options created by the class.

name: Roundtable: LGBT-Friendliness in SCA Dance
description_book: A conversation about LGBT issues in period dance and the SCA dance community. Anyone is welcome, regardless of dance experience or LGBT status.
description_web: Join a conversation about LGBT issues in period dance and the SCA dance community. Anyone is welcome, regardless of dance experience or LGBT status.

name: Teaching in the SCA
description_book: Want to share what you know and feel good about it afterwards? Covers planning, preparation, presentation, problems, publicity, and "post-mortem”.
description_web: Nervous about teaching? Want to share what you know and feel good about it afterwards? Covers planning, preparation, presentation, problems, publicity, and "post-mortem". For those who would like to improve their classes, as well as those who have never taught but want to. Instructor has 30+ years of classroom experience.
fee_itemization: handout is 16 pages

name: East Kingdom Herbalists & Apothecaries' Guild Meet
description_book: Interested in getting involved with others in the East working with period herbal practice, research on medicine in period, medieval gardening, etc.?
description_web: Interested in getting involved with others in the East working with period herbal practice, research on medicine in period, medieval gardening, etc.? Join us for a meeting to revive the Guild! Discussions of period practices welcome, though practical organization will be a main focus.

name: North African Coffee
description_book: Learn how to make the perfect cup of coffee, then enjoy a cup or two in class!
description_web: "Coffee," from the Arabic word *qahwah*, became popular in the Maghreb by the 16th century. From beans to cup, we will roast green coffee beans together, then learn the techniques you need to make the perfect brew. We will look at *bunna*, Ethiopian coffee, for comparison. Come thirsty! There is an option to go home with the tools you need to make coffee, as I will have 10 kits available while supplies last.
fee_itemization: handouts

name: SCA 101
description_book: Are you new (or new-ish) to the SCA? Trying to figure out how things work? Join us for "so this is an event... now what do I do?"
description_web: Are you new (or new-ish) to the SCA? Trying to figure out how things work? What all those odd terms in an event announcement mean? Or, what there is to do that you might be interested in? Come to SCA 101 to get the basic information you'll need to have the most fun you can have! What to expect at an event, etiquette, and answers to questions you might have been shy about asking before.

name: Fool's School Meet-Up
description_book: Meet up to talk about the future of Fool's School. We're not doing a performance or everyday classes this year.
description_web:
Past years: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool's School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. 
This year we're just going to discuss what everyone wants out of Fool's School and where it should go. Please attend if you ever participated in Fool's School!

name: Learn to Read, Write, and Sing Byzantine Notation
description_book: Learn the basics of this simple but beautiful style of music notation used from early period to modern day. Music experience welcome but not required.
description_web: Master musician or *neume* newbie: This class is for everyone! See how a simple system can be used to depict relative and absolute pitch and learn how to translate some medieval and modern day "hits" into this beautiful style of notation.

name: Body of the Mask: The Full *Commedia* Character
description_book: Based on research of Antonio Fava, how to don the whole body of each *commedia* character to connect deeply with the audience with or without words.
description_web: Based on the research of Antonio Fava, how to don the whole body of each *commedia* character to connect deeply with the audience with or without words. Please come prepared to move in comfortable clothing. Each day we will inspect the movement of a different class of character: the lovers, the first and second *Zanni, Capitano, Signora* and house servants, *Pantalone* and *Dottore*.
fee_itemization: 100 page handouts in its own binder. Only needs to be purchased once.

name: Beginner Dance: Absolute Beginner
description_book: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the ball!
description_web: Never danced before? This is the class for you! We’ll start from the very basics and soon you'll be on your way to the ball! No partners required.

name: Zill Dance from Start to Stage: 4 of 4
description_book: Learn a zill choreography to be performed at the Middle Eastern Dance Expo. Recommended for intermediate dancers who know zill basics.
description_web: Zills, or finger cymbals, add much to a performance. This class series will have the students learning a zill choreography with the option of performing it as a group at the Middle Eastern Dance Expo. Recommended for intermediate dancers who know zill basics as this class will move quickly through the choreography. Performance costuming should consist of a period or peri-oid coat worn over *salwar* or harem pants and a simple hip scarf or belt. Dancers must attend 3 of the 4 sessions including the final one in order to be eligible to perform.

name: Music in the Italian *Novelle*
description_book: Read some 14th-16th-century Italian music mentioned in literature of the time and discuss the authors' depictions. All instruments and voices welcome.
description_web: Several 14th-16th-century Italian works of literature survive which contain descriptions of music performances. We'll read through some of the surviving music mentioned in these works and compare what we do to how the authors describe the musical performances. All instrumentalists and vocalists are welcome.

name: PA Afternoon Series: Bardic Arts Exhibition
description_book: Come and enjoy an amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of bardic arts and artists from around the Known World!
description_web: Come and enjoy an amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of bardic arts and artists from around the Known World!

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn how to throw axes, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit: 25 participants. No experience needed.

name: Exploring the Frame Drum with Donovan
description_book: Learn the basics of the frame drum. We will work on basic techniques for getting great sounds out of your drum.
description_web: Learn the basics of the frame drum. We will work on basic techniques for getting great sounds out of your drum.

name: Sewing Flat-Felled Seams
description_book: Flat-felling is a sewing technique that keeps your seam allowances from fraying, makes your garments hang better, and can even make them last longer.

name: Commenting on Letter of Intent
description_book: Heraldic letters of intent (in and out of kingdoms) can always benefit from both trained, and less-experienced, commenters. How can you help?
description_web:
Commenting on letters of intent: How I learned to stop worrying and love heraldry.
Heraldic letters of intent (in and out of kingdoms) can always benefit from both trained, and less-experienced, commenters. We will discuss how to provide helpful commentary. For heralds or aspiring heralds.

name: Building a Household: An Oldcastle Model
description_book: There are many kinds of households in the Society. We will discuss several of them, focusing primarily on Clan Oldcastle, the one I know best.

name: Known World Webminister Social
description_book: A roundtable discussion and forum for Known World webministers to exchange ideas and discuss issues related to the office.
description_web: A roundtable discussion and forum for webministers from around the Known World. Discuss issues related to the office as well as exchanging ideas and suggestions.

name: Basics of Running a Gate
description_book: Running the Gate at an event isn't complicated *with* some advance planning. How to prep, staffing, setup, and paperwork.
description_web: Running the Gate at an event isn't complicated *with* some advance planning. How to prep beforehand, staffing, what materials are needed at the event and how to set up, and sorting out the paperwork afterwards.
fee_itemization: handout

name: How To Carve A Viking Horse
description_book: Learn the basics of whittling by making a Viking toy horse in the Trondheim style.
description_web: Learn the basics of whittling by making a Viking toy horse in the Trondheim style. We will also discuss Viking tools, techniques and sharpening. All tools and materials will be provided. Warning! Very sharp knives are involved. Students must be at least 14 years old and have their mother's or wife's permission to attend. Bandages will be provided.

name: 16th-C. Working Class Women's Garb Across Europe
description_book: What's the difference between 16th-century Italian, German, Lowlands, and English garb, head to toe? What's similar among all of them?
description_web: What's the difference between 16th-century Italian, German, Lowlands, and English garb? What's similar among all of them? We will walk you through the pieces of a typical working woman's ensemble head to toe.

name: Bardic Symposium 1: Meet & Greet, Those Darn Words
description_book: The Bardic Symposium is an open gathering for special forums, topics, and discussions for the Bardic Community. Day 1: Meet and Greet, Memorization.
description_web:
The Bardic Symposium is an open gathering for special forums, topics, and discussions for the Bardic Community. 
Day 1: Introductions, Meet & Greet: Meet your fellow bards. While many of us already know each other, this is a time to say hello to returning friends and give newcomers a chance to match names to faces. Host: Provost, Master Cerian Cantwr.
Those Darn Words:
Memorization can be one of the more challenging aspects of our art. It is a skill that is very different from both the creation and performance of our works. While some places are accepting of performers holding lyrics, in others it’s taboo. How can we make the words stay in our brain? What can we do if they don’t? What can we do if Kingdom custom toward non-memorized work is to say, “Harrumph?”
Confirmed Panelists: Mistress Amelie d’Anjou, Lady Dearbhforgaill an Chomhaidh, THL Brendan O Corraidhe, Mistress Fiana of Clare.

name: Creating a Basic Leather Mask with Water Forming
description_book: Create and take home a basic leather mask using the *cuir bouilli* (water forming) technique. Learn how to create your own leather mask.
description_web: Create and take home a basic leather mask using the *cuir bouilli* (water forming) technique. Learn how to create your own leather mask.
fee_itemization:
$1.00 per handout for printing
$8.00 per student (limited to 10 total students per class) to offset the cost of the leather for the mask the student will make and take home.

name: Interkingdom Brewers' Guild Competition
description_book: Brewers and vintners: Have your beverages evaluated by experts from across the Known World. Up to two entries per category. Over 21 only.
description_web: An opportunity for brewers and vintners to have their beverages evaluated by experts from across the Known World. Up to two entries per category (wine/mead, beer, cordials/others) per participant. IKBG masters are asked to help judge. Entrants are responsible for the temperature/condition of their beverage(s) as it may be some time before a particular beverage is judged. Documentation is encouraged. Over 21 only.

name: Interkingdom Brewers' Guild Roundtable
description_book: This roundtable is designed to serve as both a place to discuss period beverages as well as hang out for the IKBG. Over 21, please.
description_web: This roundtable is designed to serve as both a place to discuss period beverages as well as hang out until your beverage is called to be judged with the IKBG. It is being held in conjunction with the IKBG. All entrants are asked to wait in this area. Someone will come call you when your entry is ready to be judged. Please bring something to do/drink/discuss until your entry is called. Over 21 only.

name: Dead Men Walking
description_book: Discussion of period methods (apotropaic measures) of dealing with bothersome dead, known as revenants.
description_web: This class discusses the medieval dangerous dead, their origins and methods of their prevention and disposal, as based on recently discovered archaeological evidence.

name: No Sh*t, There We Were: SCA Stories
description_book: How to collect and tell SCA stories. We'll also have time for participants to tell stories.
description_web: This will be a two-part class. We will talk about collecting and developing the telling of SCA stories, and we will spend some time telling those stories. If you have stories, come prepared (with notes if necessary) to tell them. Perhaps we will hear such famous punchlines as "I'll see your six, and raise you thirty-five!"; "We thought you were a story they made up to scare us"; "He says he's a duke; what does that mean? It means they can't beat him, either"; and "Is that your king you're beating with a traffic cone?" "Why yes, yes it is." "Y'all must be from Calontir." "Why yes, yes, I am."

name: Failing with Style
description_book: When on stage the best laid plans gang aft agley. This class will address tips and tricks in keeping the show moving forward.
description_web: When on stage the best laid plans gang aft agley. This class will address tips and tricks in keeping the show moving forward. This will be an interactive class to work on getting your performance back on track.

name: Beginning to Drum Solo: *Maqsum and Ayoub*
description_book: An intro to the beginnings of solo techniques for *Maqsum* and *Ayoub* rhythms. An intermediate class, but all levels welcome.
description_web: An intro to the beginnings of solo techniques for *Maqsum* and *Ayoub* rhythms. An intermediate class, but all levels welcome.

name: Beginner Dance: 15th-C English Dance (Gresley)
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Class starts with the basics of walking and rhythm, then introduces fun, simple dances from the War of the Roses.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with the very basics of walking and rhythm, and then introduces you to fun, simple dances from the time of the War of the Roses.

name: *Alquerque*
description_book: Period game from the Middle East in the family of checkers-style games. We will review what is known, the rules, and the play through some games.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
fee_itemization: Material

name: Known World Recorder Ensemble
description_book: Recorder players intermediate and above invited to join this ensemble for second Pennsic appearance. Join us in having fun making music together!
description_web: Recorder players of Intermediate and above abilities are invited to join this ensemble for its second Pennsic appearance. Join us in having fun and making music together! We will meet for three rehearsals: Monday - Wednesday. We'll prepare for a brief concert, 6 pm, Thursday, 8/10, in the PA Tent. Age limit: 12 and up. A limited number of soprano and alto recorders are available for loan; contact instructors by July 10 to reserve one. If you play more than one instrument, bring them all, and be prepared to play something other than soprano. Please bring a music stand if you have one, or you may need to share.  Sheet music (easy to advanced) will be provided. $3 for music packet, or free PDFs available prior to Pennsic found on the Facebook group Known World Recorder Ensemble. Email the instructors: Lady Jolicia atte Northclyfe <Washington.julie@gmail.com> and Lady Siri Toivosdotter <JoniSyngs@aol.com>
fee_itemization: Sheet music

name: *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: Disk, bobbins, string

name: Greybeard Fencing Tourney
description_book: The return of the Greybeard Fencing Tournament! Open to all fencers 55 years of age and older.
description_web: The return of the Greybeard Fencing Tournament! Open to all fencers 55 years of age and older.

name: The Tadcaster Militia Gauntlet Arcade Extravaganza
description_book: Run the gauntlet! Fight Tads! Win fabulous tickets! Purchase prizes! Run it again and again! We're open all week so stop back & save up your tickets!
description_web:
The Tadcaster Militia presents the Amazing and Wonderful Tadcaster Arcade Gauntlet and Tournament! Win fabulous tickets and also prizes!

Fencers will face a gauntlet of bouts against members of the Tadcaster Militia.  Victories will earn tickets that can be exchanged for prizes.  

But wait, there's more!

You can run the gauntlet as many times as you can stand! 
Save up your tickets for bigger prizes! 
We'll also be running this gauntlet throughout the week, so come early and come often, and save up big!

name: Adventures with Sourdough
description_book: Learn how to grow and maintain sourdough culture used to bake bread in period. Take home some starter for your own baking.
fee_itemization: To cover cost of handout, bread and starter.

name: An Introduction to Indian Rhythms
description_book: Learn about Indian rhythm instruments, their history, how they are played; how to play with them. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.
description_web: Learn about Indian rhythm instruments, their history, how they are played and how to play with them. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.

name: A Walkabout of the Poisons at Pennsic
description_book: Wandering throughout Pennsic identifying poisonous plants.

name: Introduction to Irish Frame Drum, the *Bodhrán*
description_book: Basic instruction in *bodhrán* including most-used rhythms, session etiquette. Bring a drum if you have one; some loaners available.
description_web: Learn how to choose and care for the *bodhrán*; what makes a good tipper; tune and set structure, how to identify and play jig, reel, hornpipe, slip jig, polka rhythms; etiquette; jokes. Learn secret arcane hand gestures to amaze and stun your listeners. Demonstration of how to adapt *bodhrán* drumming to period music. Bring a *bodhrán* if you have one. A few loaner drums will be available. Teens and older welcomed.

name: Youth Armored Combat Afternoon Session
description_book: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.
description_web: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.

name: Using Common Name Sources
description_book: Examples on how to use some of the commonly used name sources used by heralds to document names.

name: How to Brew a Tree, Part III: Nuts
description_book: The use of nuts in brewing is not common, given the fat and protein content. There are ways to make them work... Must be 21 or over.
description_web: The use of nuts in brewing is not common, given the fat and protein content. There are ways to make them work... Alcohol will be served. IDs will be checked. Must be 21 or over.
fee_itemization: Handout is 7 pages at 0.15 per page (at Staples.)

name: A&S Competitions for Entrants, Part 3 of 3
description_book: How A&S competition entrants can support and encourage others to partake in fun and educational activities. Part of a series.
description_web: We’ll be talking about how A&S competition entrants can get the most fun out of entering an A&S competition while also getting feedback and creating an educational experience for others. We want to help everyone get the most out of their time and effort in working on their arts and sciences projects. This class ties in with "A&S Competitions for Organizers" and "A&S Competitions for Judges". You can attend any one or all three.

name: Viking Age Furniture: Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of the major finds of Viking Age furniture, with help to interpret the finds to make accurate reproductions.
