description_web: A brief survey of the major finds of Viking Age furniture, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make reasonably accurate reproductions. We will cover digs at Norse sites such as Oseberg, Gokstad, Birka, Dublin, Hedeby, etc.
fee_itemization: 45-page handout

name: Beyond the Notes
description_book: A practical look at taking polyphonic choral music past just singing the notes, with tips for singers and directors to turn notes into music.
description_web: A practical look at taking polyphonic choral music past just singing the notes, with tips for singers and directors to turn notes into music. Text painting, vowel modification and other techniques will be explored.
fee_itemization: Handout fee (if you choose to take it with you).

name: Whose Line Doth It Be? Open Auditions
description_book: Think you are a great improviser? Here's your chance to audition for "Whose Line Doth It Be?" Performance slots are limited.
description_web: Think you are a great improviser? Now here's your chance to audition for the improvisational show, "Whose Line Doth It Be?", taking place at 7:00 pm in the Amphitheater. Performance slots are limited, so sharpen your wit!

name: Cued Improv with Finger Cymbals: Want to Play?
description_book: Learn the 6 finger cymbal patterns of Tribal Odyssey and the dance combinations they go with: 2-2-5, 3-3-7, *beledi* and more. Intermediate level.
description_web: Learn the 6 Tribal Odyssey finger cymbal patterns and the dance combinations they go with. It's cued (follow-the-leader) combos featuring finger cymbals. We'll start with the cymbal patterns, then add the moves. With Atesh (of "Kawakib Finger Cymbal Solo" renown).

name: Three-Couple English Country Dance
description_book: See just how creative Playford could be when you learn these dances for three couples! Dancers of all levels welcome.
description_web: See just how creative Playford could be when you learn these dances for three couples! Dancers of all levels welcome.

location: Denys The Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp  EO8)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: Daily meetings for those in any 12-step program such as AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: We welcome all in AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc., who are in any 12-step program to the 4:00 pm daily meeting at EO8 Denys The Decadent's Camp.

name: C&T *Pas d'Armes*
description_book: A celebration of cut-and-thrust combat in the style of a period *Pas*. We will be following the style of the *Pas* held at Gulf Wars.
description_web: A celebration of cut-and-thrust combat in the style of a period *Pas*. We will be following the style of the *Pas* held at Gulf Wars. Weapons will be limited to those with a simple guard (cross hilt). There will be some available to borrow.

name: Games Gathering: *Tables*
description_book: A time set aside for *tables* (*nard*, backgammon) players to join us and find an opponent.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWC *Chorulus Pennsicus*
description_book: Closed rehearsals, by audition only.
description_web:
Closed rehearsals by audition only. 
*Chorulus Pennsicus* information available here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/chorulus-pennsicus

name: Belly Dance with Hadia!
description_book: Learn belly dance movements, techniques, muscle isolations and combinations. Classes are for men and women. Drummers are always welcome!
description_web: Learn Middle Eastern belly dance movements, techniques, muscle isolations, and combinations while gaining strength, balance, flexibility, stamina, coordination, body awareness and basic movements. We will organize dance patterns, learn to improvise, and use mini-combos for any form of belly dance. Loose clothing encouraged. Hip scarves, shimmy belts, full skirts, etc., are all optional and very helpful for movement awareness. Class is open to everyone who desires a review of basic belly dance movements and technique.

location: Orluk Oasis (W10, on the lake near the peninsula.)
name: Beginner Steps to *Saidi* Rhythms
description_book: Class will include an easy-to-learn beginner dance to *Saidi*, a popular Middle Eastern rhythm.
description_web: Class will include an easy-to-learn beginner dance to *Saidi*, a popular Middle Eastern rhythm. While it will be taught as a basic choreography, students will also practice improvisational portions and how to use this dance as a framework for creating their own choreography. Live drumming! Refreshments and conversation after! Join us in Orluk Oasis.

name: An Introduction to "Contrafact"
description_book: How to find the best "tunes" from period sources, and add/replace lyrics, as well as slight modifications of the tune.
description_web: How to find the best "tunes" from period sources, and add/replace lyrics, as well as slight modifications of the tune.

name: Advanced Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn advanced forms of throwing. A hands-on session is included. Should have experience using thrown weapons. Limit: 20 participants.

name: Care, Making, and Feeding of Thrown Weapons
description_book: How to maintain and repair thrown weapons.

name: An Introduction to Indian Rhythms: *Dhol*
description_book: An introduction to *Dhol*: the history, playing technique and common beats of this Indian drum. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.
description_web: An introduction to *Dhol*. Learn the history, playing technique and common beats of this Indian drum. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.

name: 10-Man Unbelted Melée Tourney
description_book: Sargents of Saint Aiden 10-Man Unbelted Melée Tourney.
description_web: The Sargents of Saint Aiden are honored to sponsor the Ten Man Melée Tourney. The fight will be for the Sargents' chest. Each year the coat of arms of the winning team is added to the chest. At this time Atlantia and Æthelmearc are the two kingdoms on the Chest. Will one of these two Kingdoms be the first to form a Dynasty in this tourney, or will a new kingdom emerge as champion this year?

name: Healthy Projection and Professional Presentation
description_book: Discuss breathing, resonance, and acoustics for the active voice herald, story teller, or singer from an operatic perspective. Masterclass-style.
description_web: Discussion of breathing, resonance and acoustics for the active voice herald, landed baron(ess), story teller, or singer from an opera singer's perspective, with a lecture followed by a masterclass-style session with any willing participants.

name: Experimental Mead-Making (1): Ale Yeast Trial
description_book: Covers making mead with a variety ale yeasts. There will be samples of two mead recipes each made with multiple types of ale yeast. Age 21+.
description_web: This class will cover making mead with a variety ale yeasts. There will be samples of two mead recipes, each made with multiple types of ale yeast. The first mead recipe is a simple traditional mead made with basswood honey, lemon, and French oak cubes. Five versions of this recipe have been made with British and Belgian ale yeasts. The second recipe is also a traditional mead made with wildflower and buckwheat honey, lime, and French oak cubes. Five versions of the recipe have been made with two British ale yeasts and three high-gravity Belgian ale yeasts. Age 21+.

name: Pennsic Archery Champions Practice/Tryouts
description_book: All archers wishing to make the Pennsic Archery Champions' Teams should attend these practices.
description_web: All archers wishing to be on the Pennsic Archery Champions' Teams should attend these practices. See either the East Kingdom Captain General or the Midrealm Lt General for more details.

name: Intermediate Middle Eastern Drumming: 6/8
description_book: Add to your rhythm repertoire with those played in 6/8. Moroccan and Persian 6/8 and others are covered, with variations. Beginners welcome.

name: Meet-the-Dance-Faculty Social
description_book: Teachers and staff, please come and be social! Proto-teachers and dancers also welcome. There will be light refreshments and a group picture.
description_web: Everyone is invited to meet the people who make the Pennsic School of European Dance happen! This event is open for all students and dancers to meet this year's faculty and staff, and is a relaxing social event for our faculty and experienced dancers. We encourage all to attend. Light refreshments will be provided and a group picture of staff and teachers will be taken.

name: 5th Pennsic Period Bow Shoot
description_book: Period handbow and crossbow competition. Period-style equipment only; no arrow rests, pistol grips, or plastic nocks. Requires one rubber blunt.
description_web:
Competition with period archery equipment only. No attached or built-in arrow rests, no pistol grips, no plastic arrow nocks. Longbows (includes Yumis), static-eared recurves ("horsebows"), other period recurves, if any, and crossbows. 
Bow types will shoot against the same category. Flight Shoot (best of your six arrows/bolts), Roving Clout, Manchu Tunken (five concentric circles pressure fitted inside one another target. A clean shot will knock out only the bulls-eye. Requires one (1) 3/4" rubber-blunted arrow or bolt), Turkish *puta*, wands or wreathes. Full period RR shoot. 
Garb and archery kit must match for time period and culture, i.e., **no** Vikings shooting Yumis. Prizes for each bow type and a prize for Best Ensemble of garb and archery kit.

name: Orlando di Lasso: the Wit and the Weirdness
description_book: Orlando di Lasso (1532-1594), famed sacred and secular choral composer. Come learn, sing, and/or listen!
description_web: Come learn about Orlando di Lasso (1532-1594), one of the most prolific sacred and secular choral composers of the Renaissance, writing in every major language and every major style -- music that choirs from high schools to professional sing all the time today. Students will listen to/sing some of his music.

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. No fee. String provided.

name: A Little Knight Music
description_book: Join M. Rosalind Jehanne, M. John Lyttleton and their Bardic Friends in original songs of chivalry, humor, history, and a few bawdy ones as well.
description_web:
Please join Mistress Rosalind Jehanne, Master John Lyttleton and their Bardic Friends in original songs of chivalry, humor, history, and a few bawdy ones as well. Be careful what you say in front of a bard!
*Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12*.

name: SCA Librarians' Roundtable
description_book: A gathering for librarians, library fans and bibliophiles. First half hour to be devoted to swapping research tips.
description_web: A gathering for librarians, library fans and bibliophiles. First half hour to be devoted to swapping research tips.

name: Known World Players' Annual Meeting
description_book: KWP's annual meeting. Company members and newcomers alike are invited to hear officer reports and discuss KWP's future.
description_web: The Known World Players' annual Guild meeting. Company members and newcomers alike are invited to come share ideas about the company's future, hear officers' annual reports, and discuss future productions.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magick.
description_web: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.
fee_itemization: There's a free handout, and a bigger optional "manual" available.

name: Æthelmearc Scribal College Open Scriptorium
description_book: Open time at the Scribal tents for people who need to work on scrolls or want to consult with experienced scribes and teachers. Use the side gate.
description_web: Open time at the Scribal tents for people who need to work on scrolls or want to consult with experienced scribes and teachers. Use the side gate. We will have tables, chairs, good lighting, and experienced scribes and teachers who can answer questions, help with any issues or direct you to where to get further information on most scribal topics.

name: Medieval Foolery, Efenwealt Wystle - Amphitheater
description_book: Medieval Foolery: An in-persona "Trunk Show" experience by Efenwealt Wystle at the Amphitheater. *Audience members should bring seating.*
description_web: Medieval Foolery: An in-persona "Trunk Show" experience by Efenwealt Wystle at the Amphitheater. *Audience members should bring seating.*

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: Whose Line Doth It Be? Performance in Amphitheater
description_book: The improv comedy show where anything can happen! Audience members should bring seating. Would-be contestants selected from Auditions at 4 pm.
description_web: Welcome to 'Whose Line Doth It Be?', the improv comedy competition where anything can happen. Audience members should bring seating. Would-be contestants must attend the Auditions at 4 pm. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12*.

name: *Seishin-ryū Mushin-an Chaseki*: The Taste of Tea
description_book: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothes with white socks or tabi, and bring a fan if you have one.
description_web: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothing with white socks or tabi, and bring a fan if you have one. Please do not wear any jewelry or weapons in the tea room. This is a participatory recreation of a sixteenth century *wabi*-style tea gathering.
fee_itemization: Cost of tea and sweets - 12 per sitting.

name: Hunter's Home Youth Polearm Tourney
description_book: Youth Polearm Tourney to be held at the Youth Combat List. It will run as a bear pit-style fighting.
description_web: The Shire of Hunter's Home will be hosting its 4th Annual Youth Polearm Tourney. It will be conducted under a bear pit-style tourney with a break. The winner will be determined by the youth fighter with the most points. Points are determined by receiving two points for a win and one point for a loss.

name: The Debatable Choir
description_book: The Debatable Choir performs perform songs of love and laughter by such luminaries as Palestrina, Gastoldi, Nannino, Morley, and Josquin.
description_web: The award-winning Debatable Choir returns, bigger and better than ever, to perform songs of love and laughter by such luminaries as Palestrina, Gastoldi, Nannino, Morley, and Josquin.

name: Family Stories in the Bog
description_book: 8 pm - 8:45 pm: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.
description_web: 8 pm - 8:45 pm: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.

name: Drake Oranwood: Troubadour Next Door
description_book: Drake Oranwood returns to the Pennsic stage with songs (and friends) new and old, including material from the compilation CD "Sing for the East".
description_web:
Drake Oranwood returns to the Pennsic stage with songs (and friends) new and old, including material from the brand-new compilation CD "Sing for the East".
*Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

name: Under the Sea Ball
description_book: Join us for an "Under the Sea"-themed ball with dances from across Europe and across skill levels. All with the goal of having fun!

name: *i Genesii*
description_book: *i Genesii*: Love! Money! Greed! Sex! Murderation! Overwhelming beauty! Underwhelming intelligence! All in one magnificent *Commedia dell'Arte* show!
description_web: Love! Money! Greed! Sex! Murderation! Overwhelming beauty! Underwhelming intelligence! All in one magnificent *Commedia dell'Arte* show, as only *i Genesii* can do! Join us for an evening of wondrous wackiness, fabulous funniness, and tenuous tastefulness! *Show Contains Adult-Themed Content*.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Coffee with Friends of Dr Bob and Bill
description_book: Morning open meeting for those in recovery.
description_web: Morning open meeting for those in recovery.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off-line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Armored Combat Morning Session
description_book: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.
description_web: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.

name: Glass Cutting: Any Level
description_book: Want to learn how to cut glass? Know how to cut glass and wish to take your skills to the next level? Take this class! And wear closed-toed shoes.
description_web: Want to learn how to cut glass? Know how to cut glass and wish to take your skills to the next level? Make time for this class! And wear closed-toed shoes, please. This is a rolling-style class, meaning it **will not** take every person 1.5 hours, but, as I have limited cutters and tools, each person will get about 10 minutes of one-on-one time to learn how to cut glass.
fee_itemization: Cost offsets glass used to practice on.

name: Irish *Brehon* Law
description_book: Irish law principles to include details on honor price, injury, sick maintenance, rights of women.
description_web: Irish law principles to include details on honor price, injury, sick maintenance, rights of women. Examples of the application of the law in traditional Gaelic Ireland. Details on where to find information on the law tracts and the sort of research they can support.

name: Closing Your Clothes
description_book: Survey of period clothing closures and how to use them. Covers antiquity to 1600, and all the cultures that I have time for.
description_web: Survey of period clothing closures and how to use them. Covers antiquity to 1600, and all the cultures that I have time for. Includes information on where to purchase these items. I will pass around actual closures and demonstrate their use.
fee_itemization: $3 for handout

name: 871 +/- 2: A History of the Settlement of Iceland
description_book: The class will cover the settlement of Iceland to the year 1000.
description_web: The class will cover the settlement of Iceland to the year 1000. Topics include the geography of the island, the development of the social structure, the Althing, the conversion to Christianity, and some kind of cool things along the way.

name: Roman Roundtable
description_book: Come talk about all things Roman with other Romans from around the Known World. Share your research on food, clothing, daily life, armor, and more.
description_web: Come talk about all things Roman with other Romans from around the Known World. Share your research on food, clothing, daily life, armor, and more.

name: Cheesemaking: How Hard Is **Your** Cheese?
description_book: Basic introduction into ingredients and supplies needed to make rennet-based cheeses.
description_web: Ever want to make cheese at home but not sure where to start or what you need to make cheese? This class will go over basic equipment and ingredients and where to find it all. Discussion will also include an overview of what you need for different types of cheeses. Basic recipes will be included in the handout as well.

name: Glove Affair: Making Gloves
description_book: Gloves are not just an accessory. Come and find out what I have learned about gloves in the 30 years I have been making them.
description_web: The class will delve into every aspect about the period article, whether it be leather, wool, linen or silk. I will share my construction techniques and a pattern I created from a study that has extended over 30 years. We will review the timeline of gloves. I will have many examples on hand to examine. A portion of the class will be dedicated to hands-on, and sewing supplies will be available to experience sewing leather. Materials, stitches, techniques and decoration will all be discussed. Bring your questions.
fee_itemization: Sewing Kit that includes leather needle, sharp needle, silk thread, linen thread and 5" X 5" piece of leather to sew.

name: *Kute-uchi*: Japanese Hand Loop Braiding
description_book: Learn the basic techniques of this period Japanese loop-manipulation braiding technique to create a sampler with three five-loop braids.
description_web: This period Japanese braiding technique was "lost" to the general population as a closely-held secret until modern research "re-discovered" it. *Kute-uchi* is similar to other methods of loop braiding, except the loops are lined up on the hands instead of held by the fingers. This enables experienced braiders to create braids using more than ten elements, with no additional equipment. Learn the basic techniques of *kute-uchi* to create a sampler with three five-loop braids.

name: Bardic Etiquette
description_book: Do's and don'ts of performance in SCA bardic situations.
description_web: This class will discuss some of the practices and principles of conduct in the bardic arts. We will cover consideration of place, time, and appropriate occasions for performing. Preparation, introductions, and how to help make the performances of others welcome, will also be discussed. Time permitting, we will talk about some good sources for appropriate piece selection. For YouthU.

name: Egg Recipes from Scappi
description_book: We will explore the place of egg recipes in the menus of Scappi and some of the many recipes.
description_web: Scappi's 15th-century Italian cookbook has an entire section on egg recipes, from fritters to *frittata*, from fried to boiled to stuffed, and everything in between. In this class we will first explore where in the year and when in the menu these recipes appear, then explore them in greater detail.

name: Tools of the Flame
description_book: Discussion course designed to aid the beginning beadworker. Includes the tools, equipment and materials needed to begin making glass beads.
description_web: Discussion course designed to aid the beginning beadworker. We will discuss the tools, equipment and materials needed to begin making glass beads. Perfect for someone who may be thinking of flamework as a hobby, but unsure of the tools needed and their costs.

name: Deeper Look at Textiles & Trim of Viking Age Dress
description_book: By investigating extant textiles, this class will aid in making informed choices for selecting fabrics and adding details to Viking Age garments.
description_web: By looking deeper at both the textiles and the details from extant items, this class aims to help individuals make informed choices for crafting their garments. Textile examples will clarify the weaves and weight of period fabrics and there will also be discussion of possible modern substitutions. Additionally, practical details for finishing or embellishing garments will also be explored and their history investigated. The goal of this class is to help the individual understand how daily life during the Viking Age could affect how textiles were crafted and worn.
fee_itemization: Handouts burned to CD are $1.  Hardcopy will be $20 (60 page document that is mostly in color that is bound with indexed tabs).

name: Medieval Surgery 101
description_book: Discussion of the some of the gruesome and often deadly surgical procedures of the Middle Ages. A three-part series. Ages 16 and over.
description_web:
Discussion of some of the gruesome and often deadly surgical procedures of the Middle Ages. A three-part series.
Period depictions, some of private parts. Ages 16 and over.

name: *Or Nué*: Colored Goldwork Embroidery
description_book: Learn the basics of *Or Nué* embroidery by creating a small piece. Beginners welcome. Kits provided.
description_web: Learn the basics of *Or Nué* embroidery by creating a small piece. *Or Nué* (shaded gold) embroidery was done in Europe, particularly in Belgium, France, Netherlands, and to high levels in Italy and Flanders from roughly 1400 – 1550s. The technique uses different colored silk threads to couch gold or silver threads strategically placed to form patterns, designs, figures or narrative scenes. This class is for beginners and kits will be provided.
fee_itemization: gold thread, silk thread, linen, embroidery hoop, needles, handout (inc. in material fee)

name: Basics of Waxed Leatherwork
description_book: Hands-on class on how to work with leather and wax to harden items for drinking vessels and armor.
description_web: Learn the very basics of making leather cups, caudels, jacks, and bottles. Class covers a brief history as well as instructions on how to work with leather, leatherworking on a budget, and hardening leather using beeswax. Class includes a hands-on portion making a leather cup.
fee_itemization:
Leather for cups
Needles
Thread
Wax

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia* before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.
description_web: Young adults will learn the art of Commedia Dell'arte while practicing and creating skits that will be performed at the end of the week.

name: Populace Archery War Point Practice
description_book: Practice for the archery War points. Come warm up and practice before you score your war points.
description_web: Practice for the archery war points. Come warm up and practice before you score your war points

name: Everything *Paternosters*
description_book: A day designed to show folks how to make tassels and choose beads to give your *paternoster* a more medieval look and feel, based on research.
description_web: This day is designed to show how to choose your beads to give your *paternoster* a more medieval look and feel based upon research. Replicas of *paternosters* will be shown and you are invited to join and show off your own research and designs.

name: Create a Mead Over an Open Fire
description_book: Ever wondered what it would be like or how to make a mead over a camp fire? The Abbey of St. Ægir can show you how it is done.
description_web: Ever wondered what it would be like or how to make a mead over a camp fire? The Abbey of St. Ægir, part of the brotherhood of brewers and the East Kingdom Brewers Guild, can show you how it is done. Includes everything from heat control to whether a boil should or should not be used.

name: Children's Dance: *Italian Chaos*
description_book: Come learn very simple dance steps that are all one needs to know to do a dance. (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)
description_web: This is a chance to learn very simple dance steps that are all one needs to know to do a dance. They can be as simple or as complicated as the dancers desire. Knowing these allow the students to dance at balls and are starting points to learn other dances. (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)

name: Mass Project
description_book: Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. We will study a plain chant Mass and a Mass by Josquin.
description_web: Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. We will study a plain chant Mass and a Mass by Josquin. We are going to do a mini-performance at the European Music Expo and a Mass Performance during War Week. Time and Date TBD
fee_itemization: Music Packet

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: List will be open for fighting and instruction from 9 am to noon every day of war week. Pending warpoint battles
description_web: All authorized youth fighters are welcome to participate in the daily activities.  Each day will have different rapier-oriented games and lessons.

name: Baronial Armored Champions' Tournament
description_book: Open to all Baronial adult and youth Armored champions. Schedule is 8-9 setup; 9-12 adults; 12-1 youth.
description_web: A day to celebrate the Baronial Combat Champions of the Known World. Landed Barons and Baronesses are encouraged to bring their chairs and portable pavilions to help us choose the Pennsic 46 Baronial Champions' champion. Open to all Baronial adult and youth Armored champions. Setup at 8:00-9:00 am; adults' tournament at 9:00 am - 12:00 pm; youth tournament at 12:00-1:00 pm.

name: Throwing Tourney for the Physically Challenged
description_book: Tournament for those with physical limitations.

name: The Cornett and the Serpent: Renaissance Brass?
description_book: Made of wood, played with a brass-type mouthpiece and fingered like a recorder. A hands-on discussion about the cornett and serpent. Bring a chair.
description_web: Once a favorite of composers and now obscure, the cornett is a musical instrument with a trumpet-type mouthpiece that is made of wood and fingered like a recorder. The larger serpent, which filled the need for a bass instrument, is a late-period ancestor of the modern tuba. Are they brass or woodwind? Join in for a hands-on discussion about these instruments, information on where to buy, and how to play. Several instruments will be available to try. Bring a chair.

name: Æthelmearc Day
description_book: All sorts of Adventures!
description_web:
All sorts of Adventures!
Watch this space for more details!

name: Beginning Scribes' Track
description_book: In this 5-day track, brand-new scribes will learn everything needed to produce award-worthy scrolls based on a 15th-century French manuscript.
description_web:
In this 5-day track, brand-new scribes will learn the skills (Layout, Gothic Calligraphy, Drawing the Flowers, Gilding, and Painting) needed to create award-worthy scrolls based on this 15th-century French manuscript:  http://gallica.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/btv1b53000324z/f1.planchecontact 

In class, you will create a small project suitable for framing.

Fee includes supplies for all 5 days, plus a starter scribal kit to create an 11 x 14" scroll at home.

Students must commit to attending all 5 sessions. Each session will last 2 hours. A different skill will be covered each session.
fee_itemization: Fee includes handouts and supplies for all 5 days, plus a starter scribal kit to create an 11 x 14" scroll at home.  For a detailed list, contact me at hutchnsn@bucknell.edu

name: Begining Fabris
description_book: Introduction to Italian rapier and Fabris.
description_web: Interested in checking out a bit of historical rapier? Come learn about the Italian style, and specifically the style of Salvatore Fabris. You don't have to be as bendy as a willow branch, but it certainly doesn't hurt. We will go over basic stance, movement and blade-work, as well as his basic concepts. Fencing gear suggested; we will be working drills.

name: Clay Oven / Hearth Oven Cooking
description_book: Compare techniques and recipes for cooking in a clay oven or hearth oven. Learn cooking methods and share your tips.

name: Feastocrat 101
description_book: So you want to be a feastocrat? This is a step-by-step planning class for those who are considering running their first feast! Handouts available.

name: Enameling 101
description_book: Basic intro to enamel. Create a pendant; learn about wet inlay and layering of transparent glass through the sifting enamel technique.
description_web: Very basic intro to enameling. We'll address the techniques of wet inlay using heraldic colors and layering of transparent glass through the use of sifting enamels. Students will leave with a self-created pendant. Ages 12 and up preferred due to materials used in the class.
fee_itemization: Enamel 10 colors, 20 copper blanks, sifters, paper towels, water, eye droppers, spoons,

name: Parenting Connection Group
description_book: If you are pregnant or breastfeeding, interested in using baby carriers, this is for you. IBCLC, La Leche leaders, LCs, counselors. Late is okay.
description_web: All families welcome. If you are interested in breastfeeding support or if you would like to learn how to use a baby carrier, come join us. If you are a support person or educator, come and hang out and help each other with parenting trials and overcoming issues. Sometimes we all need help when we are working through issues like heat, growth spurts, teething, first foods and weaning, getting a good back carry. This is a casual group. If you have learned something about breastfeeding and baby-wearing, and you think it would benefit others, please feel free to share it. If you are an IBCLC, LC, Support Counselor, educator, La Leche League leader or associate, please come and provide your support. Bring your favorite baby carriers to show others. We can also talk about weaving carriers and traditional baby-wearing.

name: Modern Media & the SCA: Making Them Work Together
description_book: How to connect with modern media to share the SCA on a larger scale and provide a good story for the news.
description_web: Reaching people who are interested in the SCA can be difficult; reaching a large number at once even more so. In this class, Æthelmearc Media Liaison and broadcast journalist Lord Arias Beltran del Valle discusses how to reach out to modern media and share activities and events with them, while also adhering to Society media policies, as well as what to do (and not to do!) when the media arrives at an event. Included in the discussion will be suggestions on how to make an event more interesting to news outlets. We'll touch on rights given to the reporters and to participants. We'll also discuss who should be involved in preparations for meeting the media at an event, and how to present the best face for your group!

name: The Oxburgh Hangings
description_book: An overview of embroidered wall hangings associated with Mary, Queen of Scots, including the glimpse they offer into Elizabethan history and culture.
description_web: The Oxburgh Hangings, embroidered by two of the most exciting women in Elizabethan-era England, provide a rich and detailed glimpse into their lives and the culture of the day. But they also offer an enigmatic mystery regarding their creation. Whether you are interested in embroidery, Elizabethan culture, or doing historical detective work, this class has something for you!

name: What the Heck Do I Do with My Hands??!!
description_book: Want a more polished and natural performance? This is a series of improvisation exercises designed to help you increase your physical confidence.
description_web: Want a more polished and natural performance style? This class will help you open up physically and feel less self-conscious. Whether you are an actor, musician, storyteller or singer, this series of relaxation exercises and improvisations will enhance your delivery. All floor exercises can be adapted to chairs. Dress comfortably!

name: Brew Like a Viking: All Natural Mead
description_book: Modern and medieval brewing techniques and tips for a truly period mead. Includes a demo on using comb honey, and the egg float test.
description_web: Modern and medieval brewing techniques and tips for a truly period mead. Honey is one of the most forgiving ingredients to work with, making mead the perfect concoction for the new or inexperienced brewer. Much of the information I will go over is general, and focuses on natural brewing instead of depending on using store-bought additives, including yeast. I will demonstrate how to extract crystallized comb honey, and how to measure the sugar density of the must, both using medieval techniques. Includes a detailed handout.
fee_itemization: copying costs

name: Introduction to *Pysanky*
description_book: Learn about the rich history of Ukrainian embellished eggs, and try your hand at this "Queen of Folk Arts". Lecture, discussion, and make 'n' take.
description_web: *Pysanky* are highly embellished eggs used for centuries in Easter and Vernal Equinox celebrations in many Slavic nations, including modern Ukraine, Poland, and Russia. Come learn about the history, symbolism, and significance of this "Queen of Folk Arts," and make your own *pysanka* to take with you. All materials and tools will be provided. The dyes are permanent, so wear old garb!

name: Medieval Women Warriors
description_book: We will discuss women who donned armor, picked up weapons, and fought alongside their male counterparts.
description_web: We will discuss women who donned armor, picked up weapons, and fought alongside their male counterparts. Were they really so unusual? Why did they choose to forgo traditional women’s roles? What’s fact and what’s fiction? Come and hear their stories and learn more about these wondrous warrior women.

name: Court Heraldry for Teens
description_book: What's it like to be a court herald? Explore the details of setting-up and running a court, as well as reading scrolls and more. YouthU, Ages 13-17.
description_web: What's it like to be a court herald? We'll explore the details of setting-up and running a court, as well as reading scrolls, tricky names, non-English scrolls, improvisations and other behind-the-scenes aspects of court. Youth University, Ages 13-17.

name: Simple Tunic and Pants Pattern
description_book: We will make a simple pattern for a tunic and pants using your measurements.
description_web: We will make a simple tunic and pants pattern using your measurements. We will draw out a very basic pattern for pants and a simple tunic which you will be able to take with you and use at home. Please bring a tape measure for body measurements, a pair of scissors, pen and paper to write down your measurements before making your pattern.
fee_itemization:
1.00 for handout
4.00 for non-paper pattern pieces

name: Youth Theatre
description_book: For kids ages 6-12 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through story telling, acting, and producing their very own play!
description_web: For kids ages 6-12 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through story telling, acting, and producing their very own play! Come join us as we build a theatre show from the ground up, giving younger kids a creative outlet for all that pent up camping energy! Children 12 and under must have a parent or guardian present.

name: *Atlatls* of the World
description_book: *Atlatls* (spear/dart throwers) have been found on every continent except Antarctica. Come see their wide variety and try them out.
description_web: *Atlatls* (spear throwers, *woomeras, speerschleuders*, etc.) have been found on every continent except Antarctica. They have been used from 30,000 years ago up to the present day in some areas. Come see their wide variety and actually try them out on the *atlatl* range. **In case of rain, we will meet in the thrown weapons range classroom tent.**
fee_itemization: A limited number of atlatls and darts will be available for sale to the students who attend this class. Variable costs $15-$50.

name: Introduction to Basket Weaving
description_book: Learn to weave either a rectangular or round basket using flat reeds. Weave at your own pace. Takes about 3-5 hours, depending on style.
description_web: Learn to weave either a rectangular or round basket using flat reeds. Weave at your own pace and relax in our friendly camp environment. Baskets take about 3-5 hours to complete, depending on style and level of period authenticity. We will have about 6-8 youth-friendly weaving kits on hand suitable for ages 8 and older, but children must be accompanied by a parent.

name: Introduction to Fire Tending
description_book: Practical training in how to properly and safely start and maintain a cook fire to assist your camp cook in making feast. Theory and demonstration.
description_web: Practical training in how to properly and safely start and maintain a cook fire to assist your camp cook in making feast. Theory and demonstration. Participants will learn basic fire safety, axe handling, hatchet handling, and how to lay and feed a fire.
fee_itemization: Printing

name: *Seishin-ryū Sadō Okeiko*: Practice the Art of Tea
description_book: Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners.
description_web:
Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners. Please come to as many classes as possible. 

*Okeiko* means "honorable practice". This is a multi-part workshop intended for beginners who wish to learn how to participate in tea gatherings. Both the role of the guest and the role of the host will be introduced. You will learn something new in each workshop. We will begin with walking and bowing and progress to the rudiments of preparing and consuming a bowl of *matcha*. Limited materials will be available for student use during the workshop. 

If you are interested in purchasing materials for long-term personal use, then you should acquire a guest kit and a *fukusa*: 
A guest kit for men can be acquired at: http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-man339.html
A guest kit for women can be acquired at: http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-woman339.html
A *fukusa* for men can be acquired at: http://www.teadogu.com/fumepunu9si.html
A *fukusa* for women can be acquired at: http://www.teadogu.com/fuworenu9si.html
While it is possible to save money by ordering directly from Japan, doing so requires dealing with Japanese online storefronts. A note about *fukusa*. A number #9 *fukusa* is much easier to manipulate than *fukusa* with lower numbers. Paying extra is worth the price. A *fukusa* and a fan are what  you need to practice during class. I have an extremely limited number of loaner *fukusa*. You can substitute a number of items  for a fan. Please read the online descriptions of the fans carefully if you choose to provide a substitute or acquire a fan from another source.

There are a number of ways to acquire a 袱紗 *fukusa*. You can even try to make one, but please don't until you know what they are supposed to be like. There is some controversy over just how old they are. Today, men use slightly larger *fukusa* than women do. Further, men always use purple *fukusa* and women typically only use purple *fukusa* after they have become senior instructors. Regardless, here are purchase options. (1) You can always try ebay. (2) You can order online from any of several tea supply stores in Japan through rakuten.co.jp. (3) You can order one from a fellow in Portland http://www.teadogu.com/fukusa.html (Yes, they really are that expensive.) I will try to pick up a couple of loaners (I currently have one) between now and Pennsic. Regardless, the fan is the symbol of the guest, and the *fukusa* is the symbol of the host in the world of tea.
fee_itemization: This class will include a multi-page printed handout.

name: Body Mechanics for Beginning/Intermediate Dancers
description_book: All levels welcome! A survey of nonverbal cues and body mechanics to enhance everyone's dance experience. We'll learn a dance along the way!

name: The *Game of the Goose*
description_book: Period game in the style of *Chutes and Ladders*. The game is dice-based so it is suitable for children, but can be adapted to a fun game for adults.

location: Good Friends Camp (Usually N-01 on St. Lawrence Way)
name: 16th-Century Ledger-Type Book Binding
description_book: Make a 16th-century leather ledger-style book. Some embroidering skills needed.
description_web: A start-to-finish 5-hour class to make a 16th-century leather ledger style book. Some embroidering skills needed. Students are encouraged bring their own cutting board, rotary cutter/X-acto, and metal ruler, if they have them. (Binding tools will be loaned if needed, however.) A 30- to 45-minute lunch break will be allowed.
fee_itemization: Fee includes leather for the cover, a detailed color hand-out, paper for book, and linen thread.

name: Topics in Basic Heraldry
description_book: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory skills for consulting at Pennsic Herald's Point. Dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point.
description_web: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory submission skills necessary to consult at Pennsic Herald's Point. Exact dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point at the beginning of the War. All newer heralds are strongly encouraged to attend at least one of these classes prior to volunteering at Herald's Point.

name: Japanese Stab Binding: Make a Book in Under 1 Hour
description_book: Make two books in an hour using the stab binding method of Japan. No handout, as we will focus on the craft rather than the history.
description_web: Come make two books in no time at all using the ancient stab binding method of Japan. There is no handout, as we will focus on the craft rather than the history, but a card with reference sites will be available. Supplies are limited to 6.
fee_itemization: Beeswax, Paper for book pages, decorative paper for book covers and linen binding thread.

name: Ottoman Singing
description_book: Learning to sing the 15th-16th-century Ottoman compositions, *Amed nesim-i subh-dem* and *Hem kamer hem zühre vû hem müşterî der âsuman.*
description_web: We will be teaching two Ottoman compositions from the 15th-16th centuries, as well as reviewing songs taught last year. This music is typically performed with singing. As such, we will be teaching a singing class to learn these songs in the original Ottoman Turkish language. What will you learn and experience: 15th-16th-century Seljuk/Ottoman songs and their history; the musical modality *Makam Rast*; pronunciation of Ottoman Turkish and Persian along with a brief history and etymology, learning in the traditional *Meşk* learning style, as well as appropriate Ottoman customs. The five classes will be progressive; however, students may join in when they wish, although attendance at all the classes is strongly encouraged. Students may join the class's Facebook page in advance to orient themselves to the song and class: https://www.facebook.com/groups/398762226986519/
fee_itemization: Handout

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, Thursday, 8/10 (time and place to be determined).

name: Henna History and Application
description_book: Learn how and why henna was used in period, and how you can use it yourself. We will mix some henna in class; everyone gets some to try.
description_web: Learn how and why henna was used in period, including traditions, materials, and techniques, and how you can use it yourself today. We will mix some henna in class, which for me (becoming a professional artist) was the hardest part to learn; everyone gets some to use and take.
fee_itemization: One cone of fresh henna paste. You may also take the class without this, or bring your own.

name: Pennsic Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! Singing in the Choir is an intense and rewarding experience with a concert Thursday War Week.
description_web: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! This year's concert theme is "A Medieval Christmas" The repertoire includes pieces by Hassler, King Henry VIII, Praetorius and Morley, conducted by Lady Siri Toivosdotter. Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on Thursday evening of War Week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is helpful, but not required if you learn the music in advance. Sheet music and audio tracks are available online at https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsicxliiichoirs

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own; class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: weaving materials, string

name: Cooking a Feast over a Fire: Part 1
description_book: Learn how to lay-up and maintain a fire, prep and spit a large roast, cook bread in a Dutch oven
description_web:
Learn how to lay-up and maintain a fire, prep and spit a large roast, cook bread in a Dutch oven.
This is part 1 of 3; you can stay for one or all three. The third class is making sourdough bread.
Participants can join us for dinner at 6:00 pm.
fee_itemization: Donations to cover the cost of food

location: Speckulian (W10 - Roman Road - Next to the large ROME Camp.)
name: Meditation, Emotional Freedom and Self Empowerment
description_book: Learn simple proven meditation techniques for emotional freedom, joy, and self empowerment.
description_web: Learn simple proven meditation techniques for emotional freedom, joy, and self empowerment. Practical breathing, mindset, and self-actualization methods will be presented, along with a group practice and energy session.

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: Basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 4-part class; different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*
Day 4- *Kashlimah* and other strange stuff

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: *Katana* for SCA Combat
description_book: This is a non-armored class to show how Japanese single sword can be used in SCA armored combat.
description_web: This is a non-armored class to show how Japanese single sword can be used in SCA armored combat. Topics such as defense, attack, movement and proper thought will be covered.

name: A Hand a Day Gothic in 45 Minutes or Less
description_book: Learn this staple late-period calligraphic hand, as well as how to deconstruct calligraphic examples to learn new hands.
description_web: Gothic Blackletter (also known as Textura) is a late-period style of calligraphy used throughout Western Europe. Come learn this hand using a method designed not only to effectively and quickly learn this alphabet, but also to train your eye to more easily learn further calligraphic hands to increase your calligraphic repertoire.

name: Forge-Fired Enameling
description_book: *Cloisonné* enameled copper discs, fired on a charcoal-fired forge
description_web: We will be demo-ing how to fire *cloisonné* enameled copper discs on a charcoal-fired forge! We will use non-leaded, vitreous enamel on copper discs and fire them in a muffle furnace (like the one described by Theophilus). If time and space allows, we may have a few people try to make their own.
fee_itemization: copper and glass materials fee $5

name: Estrogen and Axes Tournament
description_book: Ladies of the Known World: This is an axes-only tournament just for you; no men allowed.

name: Lyric-Writing Workshop
description_book: Bring work in progress for discussion and feedback. *Contrefait* (filk) or original lyrics.
description_web: This workshop is for gentles working on new songs (or poems) seeking feedback and critique on their work in progress. We'll discuss scansion, tone, word choice, clarity, and anything else the author wants to talk about. Expect to spend 10-15 minutes on each piece. If you have a long work, we may not be able to work on more than a portion of the piece. Bring paper and pencils or pens for notes.

name: Choosing Your Name and Heraldry
description_book: Before you go to Herald's Point, learn the basic rules of registration. Class is 75% shield design and 25% names. Worksheets and markers provided.
description_web:
This class explains the basic rules of name and device registration. It is intended for newcomers as well as veterans who have not yet registered their names and device/arms, heraldry/badge. As a Heavy List fighter, I teach with pictures and small words.

Class handouts can be found on my blog:
https://vedardottir.wordpress.com/2016/10/14/whats-in-a-heraldic-name/
https://vedardottir.wordpress.com/2016/10/24/choosing-your-heraldry/
fee_itemization: Class handout.

name: Largesse
description_book: Largesse that is greeted with smiles and largesse that gets quizzical looks. I recommend taking this class before giving gifts to royalty.

name: Get the Most Out of Judging and Entering A&S
description_book: Techniques and philosophy for giving and receiving feedback, and how to leverage these skills in the rest of your life.
description_web: Entering or judging an A&S competition can be a daunting prospect. How do I give good feedback? How do I receive feedback without taking it too personally? How can this whole experience be fun and educational, for entrants **and** judges? Giving and receiving feedback and learning from each other is not just key to the SCA A&S experience, but can be useful in the rest of your life. We'll go over how to prepare for entering and judging, how to read criteria, feedback techniques, philosophy and application. Instructor will bring a sample to play the role of "entrant", but feel free to bring a piece and be a "guinea pig" in class, time permitting.

name: Tailoring the Elizabethan Doublet
description_book: Construction techniques for 16th-century menswear.

instructor: THL Cellach Dhonn inghean Mhic an
name: Quilted Mamluk Pillbox Hat
description_book: This is a hands-on class. Each kit contains all you need to do a quilted silk and linen Mamluk pillbox hat. Bilingual class: French/English.
description_web: This is a hands-on class. Each kit contains all you need to do a quilted silk and linen Mamluk pillbox hat. Bilingual class: (French/English) and handout. Some embroidery stitches that can be added to the hat will be taught.
fee_itemization: $10 per kit, different color of silk and linen to choose from

name: Divination by Sortilege One: Casting of Lots
description_book: Divination by sortilege: Interpretation of randomized symbols, such as tossed coins, runes, dice, and bibliomancy.
description_web: Intro to sorcery, aka sortilege, or interpretation of randomized symbols, such as coins, dice, runes, cards, pages of books. We will cover everything from flipping a coin to the Church practice of using dice to obtain answers directly from God. Stay for Part Two, with cards, including tarot.

name: Viking Age Clothing: Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of the major finds of Viking Age clothing, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make accurate reproductions.
description_web: A survey of the major finds of Viking Age clothing, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make reasonably accurate reproductions. We will cover Birka, Damendorf, Eura, Hedeby, Mammen, Thorsbjerg, Viborg, and other finds.
fee_itemization: 45-page handout

name: If Looks Could Kill: Evil Eye Amulets
description_book: The history of amulets used against the Evil Eye through many cultures and time periods.
description_web: The history of amulets used against the Evil Eye through many cultures and time periods. Discussion of the amulet types plus scholars' deductions of why those amulets are the size, shape or color and style. *Class for adults only.* Reason: Some amulets are phallic in nature. Some discussion of male and female anatomy. Photos and objects of a phallic nature.

name: How to Make a Medieval Sword Scabbard
description_book: The DIY process of making historically-accurate sword scabbards for the entry-level scabbard maker.
description_web: The objective of this 2-hour class is to give the entry-level scabbard maker an overall appreciation for the Do-It-Yourself process of making historically-accurate European medieval sword scabbards, using modern tools. Making a scabbard is not as difficult as one might imagine, and so the hope is that this class will encourage you to eventually jump in and try it yourself. Class will cover specific resources, materials, tools and techniques. Course fee is $15 for a booklet.
fee_itemization: Instruction booklet

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Populace Archery War Point Shoot
description_book: Populace Archery War Point will consist of three challenging shoots: a clout (100 yards), soldier shoot, and castle window (timed).
description_web: Populace Archery War Point will consist of three challenging shoots: a clout (100 yards), soldier shoot, and castle window (timed). Come and score points for your kingdom. Sunday's populace shoot: 11 am to 5 pm; Monday 11 am to 5 pm; Tuesday 11 am to 7 pm; Wednesday 11 am to 5 pm; and Friday 9 am to 12 pm.

name: The Anglo-Saxon Warrior
description_book: Weapons, armor, group fighting styles and defensive systems; what your persona needs to know.
description_web: The topic could fill books, but we’ll cover as much about the armor and weapons of the Anglo-Saxon warrior: swords, shields, spears, and of course, the *seax*, as we can. We’ll also cover fighting styles in groups like the *fyrd*, and defensive systems like the *burgs*. The time range covered will be from invading the British kingdoms, through the Viking wars, folding in some of their techniques to fighting the Normans.

name: Canary with NO Training Wheels
description_book: Canary dance structure, basic steps and combinations, and making your solos. Improvised does not mean unrehearsed!

location: Dark Horde Moritu (E09 - Brewers Rd & Chandlers)
name: Carpentry and Building in Imperial China
description_book: A discussion of *Lu Ban jing*, a 15th-century book on the world of carpenters and joiners in Late Imperial China. This is not a "how to" class!
description_web: *Lu Ban jing* is a book compiled between 1425 and 1550 in Imperial China on the construction of buildings and furniture, which covers practical things such as leveling building sites, felling trees, joinery, and the favorable days to undertake each task. This is a discussion and not a "how-to" class! (I make fine firewood and exquisite sawdust.)

name: Multiplayer Period Chess
description_book: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.
description_web: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.

name: Rapier Field Battle
description_book: description added soon
description_web:
TENTATIVE:
Format: Last Man Standing (each battle – the side with the last man standing wins the point for the battle)
Size of Field/Location: Whole field, subject to change by principal Rapier Commanders 
Deployment points/lines: Normal edges of field
Direction of deployment: East/West
Resurrection points/lines: No resurrection
Number and type of flags: None
Hold specifics (local/general/stop the clock?): All holds are general
Number of marshals needed for coverage: 10 marshals provided by each principal kingdom (Mid, East, and Aethelmearc) for a total of 30 marshals. 
Timing:
	Overall time for scenario: N/A
	Number of iterations: 4
	Time between iterations: 10 minutes 
	Time check window(s): N/A
	War Points: 4; each Rapier Field Battle will be worth 1 War Point for a total of 4 War Points from all Rapier Field

name: Middle Eastern Dance 101
description_book: An introductory series of classes that explore basic belly dance moves and choreography.
description_web: This series of classes goes back to the very basics of belly dancing, or Middle Eastern Dance. We'll learn about the foundations of Middle Eastern dance, its history, and cultural significance in the North Africa/Middle Eastern regions. Utilizing the "body dictionary" framework, we'll review movements and isolations for each part of the dancer's body, and explore costuming ideas for performing the dance in period. There will be printed handouts with information and belly dance resources for a nominal fee. We'll end the series of dance sessions with a short choreography that illustrates the various movements inherent in this timeless dance. This class is designed for the beginner student of dance.
fee_itemization: Handouts will include historical information, costuming suggestions and resources (reading, music, etc.) for dance students

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.
fee_itemization: Sticks & string

name: Color Theory Workshop
description_book: Experiment with modern and period color theory through the creation of color wheels, color schemes and value scales. Materials provided.
description_web:
Experiment with modern and period color theory through the creation of color wheels, color schemes and value scales. Materials provided, or bring your own!

Period color theory methods are based on Cennini's *Il Libro Dell' Arte* ["The Craftsman's Handbook"], a 15th-century Florentine treatise on artistic practice.
fee_itemization: Handout (two pages, cardstock color scheme painting surface and informational sheet)

name: Crossing Cultures in Storytelling
description_book: We'll discuss moving stories across cultures. I will focus on my character, Isu Odinnson, and the steps I took to create his stories.
description_web: This class will discuss moving stories across cultures. I will focus on my character, Isu Odinnson, and the steps I took to create his stories.

name: Scribal Workshop: The Armenian Gospels of Gladzor
description_book: This 4-part, 4-day hands-on Intermediate to Advanced workshop will cover the skills necessary to create a scroll based upon the Gladzor book.
description_web: This 4-part, 4-day hands-on Intermediate to Advanced workshop will cover the skills necessary to create a scroll based upon the Gladzor book: a fascinating combination of zoomorphic images, whitework, gold and inkwork. A faux script has been created to compliment this workshop.
fee_itemization:
Kit Includes:
Black and White handout/Typed
Color copies of the Gladzor book carpet pages  1 per student
1 sable paintbrush, size 1
1 sable paintbrush, size 2
Palette with all paint needed for class
Arches Watercolor paper 8x10 - personal piece
Arches watercolor paper 11x14
Colored inks, red, blue, black
Quill tip nibs
Arabic gold paint

name: On the Evolution of Jewish Names
description_book: Traces the evolution of Jewish names from the Biblical period through the medieval era, with references for a variety of cultures.
description_web: This class shows how Jewish names evolved from the simple names used in the Hebrew Bible (Old Testament to Christians) through the Greco-Roman period and into a variety of European and Middle Eastern cultures. The class is intended for persons trying to develop a registerable Jewish name and for heralds as a help with clients working with clients who want a Jewish persona.
fee_itemization: The five dollar cost is for an 18-page handout, complete with tables and footnotes.

name: Cartidge Pleating 101
description_book: Detailed instruction in padded pleating techniques for men's and women's clothing during the Renaissance and later periods.

name: Cloisonné 101
description_book: Basic intro to cloisonné. Create an enameled pendant and learn basics of wire forming and cloisonné technique.
description_web: Very basic intro to cloisonné technique of enameling. We'll address the techniques of wet inlay and wire forming of different shapes. Students will leave with a self-created pendant. Ages 12 and up preferred due to materials used in the class. Completion of a piece typically takes about 2-2.5 hours. The additional time is scheduled for "open studio time" if students need additional time to work.
fee_itemization: Enamel, copper blanks, cloisonné wire, scooper tools (for inlaying enamel),  paper towels, baby wipes, water, eye droppers, paint trays, spoons, pliers

name: Cultural Perspective of Middle Eastern Music
description_book: Cultural and historical perspective of Middle Eastern music within the modern world. Also Middle Eastern music perspective within the SCA.
description_web: An overview of the modern cultural and historical background of Middle Eastern music presented by Lady Melissa of Orluk Oasis. Also in the presentation, a synopsis of Middle Eastern music at Pennsic.
fee_itemization: Handouts

name: Leather Stitching for Construction and Decoration
description_book: Learn the types and styles of stitching used in leather construction and how to use stitching as a decorative element.
description_web: Learn the types and styles of stitching used in leather construction and how to use stitching as a decorative element.
fee_itemization: $1.00 per-handout printing cost

name: Intermediate Topics in Brewing
description_book: Emphasizing all-grain brewing, this class will cover different grain types, adjuncts, hops and gruit, yeast, and beer styles, plus lagering.
description_web: Emphasizing all-grain brewing, this class will cover different grain types, adjuncts, hops and gruit, yeast, and beer styles, plus lagering. Common problems and how to prevent them will be addressed, and period beer styles will be introduced.

name: Basketry 101: Handled Basket
description_book: Create a handled basket from flat reed. Bring scissors for cutting reed and a towel. No experience necessary.
fee_itemization: Oak D handle, dyed basket reed, plain basket reed, rim filler, tool usage and handouts

name: Divination by Sortilege Two: Cards Including Tarot
description_book: Fortune-telling theory and practice with regular 52 and tarot decks. Attending Part One is recommended but not required.
description_web: Imagine a storybook with 52 pages, but with the spine removed, and the pages reordered by Dame Fortuna to tell each person's life story. That book is a deck of cards, and this class will teach you how to read it. Fortune-telling theory and practice with regular and tarot decks.

name: The Medieval Tavern in an SCA World
description_book: A brief history of taverns, inns, and alehouses in the medieval world, followed by *how* you can bring those elements to the SCA. Age 21+.
description_web: A brief history of taverns, inns, and alehouses in the medieval world, followed by *how* you can bring those elements to the SCA. Will include tips, tricks, and anecdotes from the SCA 50 Year tavern as well as ideas on how to run a tavern to showcase local home brewers. Please bring a mug. Age 21+.

name: Arabic Calligraphy and Inscriptions In The Maghreb
description_book: A survey of Arabic calligraphic styles from North Africa. Students will learn to identify different styles and copy period samples.

name: Cups, Coifs, & Coins: Accessories for Newcomers
description_book: Do you have a Vessel with a Pestle? A very cunning hat? We'll talk about how to round out your garb with some awesome accessories and necessities!
description_web: Welcome to the SCA! So you have a tunic and you look great! But do you have a Vessel with a Pestle? A very cunning hat? We'll talk about some accessories and necessities that you can add to your garb, kit, or camping gear to make your event easier and more enjoyable.

name: Period Bread
description_book: Learn about bread and bread-making in Europe in SCA periods.
description_web: Bread and bread-making in Europe throughout SCA periods. Includes discussion of replicating period flours and breads.

name: Early Period Arts & Sciences Day in Preachain
description_book: Early Period A&S Day is a celebration of the arts and traditions of the cultures of Europe and the Mediterranean that existed prior to 1000 AD.
description_web: Clanne Preachain's 25th Early Period Arts & Science Day is a celebration of the arts and traditions of the cultures of Europe and the Mediterranean that existed prior to 1000 AD. Come join us for classes and demonstrations, or just bring a project to work on.

name: Playford's Insanity: *Argeers*
description_book: Whatever was Playford thinking when he wrote this dance? Doubles, siding, arming? Nope, this is *Argeers*! ECD experience helpful but not necessary.

name: Youth Archery Tournament
description_book: Hosted by Ealdormere. Due to changes regarding minors, all youth are required to have their parents with them at the range.
description_web: Hosted by the Kingdom of Ealdormere. Due to changes regarding minors, all youth are required to have their parents with them at the range.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
fee_itemization: materials

instructor: Viscountess Kamiilah al Sudanii um Zoom
name: Middle Eastern Line Dances
description_book: Come and learn Middle Eastern line dances!

name: Perfect Medieval Spindle and Distaff Workshop
description_book: Match spindle and distaff to your persona and time period in Europe. Lecture and hands-on.
description_web: Match a spindle and distaff to your persona and time period in Western Europe. Lecture and hands-on class to experience different types of removable whorl spindles and distaves (hand, waist & floor) and which goes with which.  Early period (Roman/Viking), Middle Ages up to Early Modern. **Not a beginner's class**; some spinning experience expected. Students are encouraged to bring their own spindles and distaves for show-and-tell. Kits as well as loaners are available. Other spindles, whorls and distaves are available for purchase from the vendor (Minerva’s Spindle) where this class is held during and after class, but only if student desires.
fee_itemization:
Handout - paper copies
Materials - Each kit contains 1 perfectly ordinary medieval wood spindle and removable pottery whorl (seconds) as well as sample wool to spin.

name: Pennsic Youth Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 19 to learn period vocal music and perform as part of the Known World Choirs Concert, Thursday War Week.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 19 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella* with Deonna von Aachen. We will rehearse 12-1 pm Sunday, August 6, through Wednesday, August 9. Performance will be part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/10, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.) More information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-youth-choir

name: Rehearsal (Closed): *Sans Nomen* Dress Rehearsal
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Beginner Dumbek Technique
description_book: This class covers everything you need to know to get comfortable with your dumbek. We will cover basic rhythms. Come on by! Don't be shy!
description_web: This class covers everything you need to know to get comfortable with your dumbek. We will cover basic rhythms. Come on by! Don't be shy!

name: Rapier Ruins Battle
description_book:
or 30 min. after Rapier Field.
description added soon
description_web:
(or 30 minutes after Rapier Field Battle)
TENTATIVE:
Format: Timed Battle (see additional notes below)
Size of Field: 600’ N-S x 300’ E-W between deployment/resurrection lines, utilizing the fort - only entrance is front gate, dead may exit anywhere
	Obstacles and obstacle placement:
	Size/location of tower: 30’x30’ (approx. 10 haybales), approx. 50’ South from gate of fort
	Doorways: 2 9’ foot doorways, E-W along the line from main fort gate
	Wall: Extending from center of southern wall of tower, in line with fort main gate, 30’ long
	Dispersal of “broken” field: random scattering to south of wall, extending approx. 40’ south, made of sets of three bales making “corners.” Bales are assumed to be trees, and cannot be fought over.
	Deployment points/lines:
	Deployment Lines: ~125 feet in from overall field boundaries.
	Direction of deployment: East/West
	Resurrection points/lines: Same as deployment lines
	Flags
	Number of Flags: Five flags, pulley type - capture is determined by a flag being at the topmost point
	Flag placement: One flag in fort, one in tower, one 60’ south of tower flag - to the south of the wall - in “orchard”, and two in open field to the south of the orchard (60’ apart)
	Non-physical Parameters:
	Resurrection/Non-resurrection:  Resurrection
	Limited/Unlimited:  Unlimited for both sides
	Hold Specifics: Non-medical holds are general and do not stop the clock.  Medical holds are battlefield-wide and stop the clock.
	Number of marshals needed: one marshal provided by each side per nine combatants
	Timing:
	Overall time for scenario:  55-65 minutes (60 minutes +/-5), Majority of flags takes each time check, each time check is worth 1 war point.
	Number of iterations:  1, At the midpoint of the battle (directly after the second time check), a hold will be called and the armies will switch sides of the field, redeploying from their new Rez lines. 10 minute break after switching sides.
	Time check window(s): Two in first “half,” one after side-switch - marshals will meet before battle to choose three times
	War Points: 3;  This entire Rapier scenario is worth 3 War Points

name: *De Lapidibus*
description_book: A class on gemstones, taught in (Muslim) persona, based on period sources.
description_web: A class on gemstones, taught in (Muslim) persona, based on period sources.
fee_itemization: no materials, probably a one page handout. No fee for handout.

name: The Real Fibonacci Sequence
description_book: Greatest mathematician of the Middle Ages, Fibonacci didn't write much about his famous sequence. Learn about the numbers he was really interested in.
description_web: Many people today know about the "Fibonacci Sequence", 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13...  Today we know a lot of interesting information about this sequence and its relationship to nature and other mathematics and science. Many wonder how much of that Fibonacci knew. The evidence suggests he didn't know much; what he really cared about were the congruent numbers. Learn about this sequence, what Fibonacci knew about it, and what we know about it today.
fee_itemization: $1 for photocopies

name: How to Sharpen A Knife
description_book: A beginning class on how to sharpen a knife using simple tools.
description_web: A dull knife is dangerous and hard to use. With just a little of time, you can have a sharp knife that is ready to use. This class is for wood workers, but is useful for any knife user. Warning! Very sharp knives should be involved. Students must be at least 14 years old and have their mother's or wife's permission to attend. Bandages will be provided.

name: The Basics Of Leather-Working: Getting Started
description_book: Interested in leather-working but not sure how to begin? What tools do I need? Choose the right leather for your project. We'll learn all that here!
description_web: Interested in leather-working but not sure how to begin? What tools do I need? Choose the right leather for your project. We'll learn all that here!
fee_itemization: $1.00 per handout for printing costs.

name: Help Me, Tempus, You’re My Only Hope!
description_book: Two hours with Tempus, anything sewing. Trouble-shooting, problem-solving, garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Maybe learn to sew...
description_web:
(Garb Troubleshooting/Q&A Workshop)
This is a trouble-shooting and problem-solving class; garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Bring to the class garb that went “wrong” or garb that didn’t “work” for you. We'll talk; it can be fixed. If you don’t have the garb here, bring your questions; we’ll do our best to solve your garb troubles. We’ll talk about gussets and how to use your seam ripper, too. This class can go on longer if needed. Also, this class will be offered next year.

name: *Midrash* and *Aggadita*: A Bible Story Supplement
description_book: *Midrash*: Jewish stories about Biblical characters. *Aggadita* deals with Talmudic sages. Both make excellent sources for period Jewish stories.
description_web: Odds are good, if you have ever listened to a traditional Jewish story, you were getting a story from the *Midrash* or the *aggadita*.
