5.The team with highest number of points in each youth division wins. Prizes will be awarded in each division.

name: Insular Scrolls: Beyond Knotwork
description_book: So you have a handle on knotwork and want to make better Insular-style scrolls. This class will talk about designing a Insular-style scroll that feels
description_web: So you have a handle on knotwork and want to make better Insular-style scrolls. This class will talk about designing a Insular-style scroll that feels period accurate. We will discuss layout, color choices, and ways to cheat when you don’t have the time or ability to design your own knotwork/zoomorphs/keywork. The focus will be Kells-style scrolls, but will touch on Lindisfarne and a few others.
fee_itemization: Several page full-color handout

name: Women and Medicine Before 1650: An Introduction
description_book: A basic introduction. Evidence of women in period theory and practice of medicine as practitioners and patients. Sex will be mentioned.
description_web: What evidence is there regarding pre-1650 medicine and women in medical theory? Women as medical practitioners? Women as patients? The practice of midwifery, obstetrics and gynecology? Women as medical attendants, etc.? This outline touches on what we do know, some historiographic myths, and where to find out more. Primarily focused on mainland European history. Attendee discussion welcome. Age of discretion warning: gender, sex, and gynecology will be discussed.
fee_itemization: Long photocopied handout

name: Food Safety for SCA Cooks
description_book: Preparing an SCA feast is different from preparing a family dinner. Learn about the food safety practices needed to ensure a safe event.
description_web:
Preparing an SCA feast is different from preparing a family dinner. Learn about the food safety practices needed to ensure a safe event.

Students will learn the causes of food-borne illness as well as safe food handling practices related to these:
Preventing Cross Contamination
Controlling Time and Temperature
Good Personal Hygiene
Cleaning and Sanitizing
Planning a Successful Food Event

Whether you are a new event cook, or you and your kitchen staff have been doing this for years, it is important to be up to date and knowledgeable about food safety.
fee_itemization: $2 for class handout

name: It's All Fun and Games...Medieval Board Games
description_book: Easy to learn, hard to master. Learn *Rota, Nine Men's Morris*, and *Fox and Geese*. Everything you need to play these two-player games. Youth&TeenU.
description_web: Most medieval and classical board games are fairly simple to learn to play, but hard to master. Attendees will learn how to play *Rota, Fox and Geese*, and *Nine Men's Morris*. All attendees will leave with copies of the rules and game boards for each game, and enough game tokens to play all three games. This class is for Youths and Teens ages 11-17.

name: Twelve Plants through the Ages: Year 2
description_book: Follow twelve plants through time from Celsus to the modern day. How plants were used for medicine in period, and how that is supported today.
description_web: Follow twelve plants through time from Celsus to the modern day. What plants were used medicinally in period, and which of these uses have been proven by contemporary science. I am covering 12 plants this year, and plan additional material in following years. This is a historical overview of uses, and does not constitute medical advice.
fee_itemization: Handout costs $3.

name: Beginning Netting
description_book: Create that final piece of 14th-century bling, a netted hairnet. Learn how to cast on a circular net, use a gauge stick, and tie the netting knot.
description_web: Create that final piece of 14th-century bling, a netted hairnet. I'll teach how to cast on a circular net, use a gauge stick, and tie the netting knot. Netting can be scaled down to make hairnets of silk, or scaled up to make fish nets or tote bags using a sheet bend knot.
fee_itemization: The material fee covers the cost of the prewound netting shuttle, the gauge stick, and the base rod.

name: Peer-Like Qualities
description_book: A discussion on the nebulous characteristics to develop along your path to peerage.
description_web: A discussion about certain characteristics and traits to consider developing on your path to peerage. Different concepts to work on and consider.

name: How to Brew a Tree, Part IV: Roots and Bark
description_book: We will examine some of the more common types of bark and roots used in brewing. Age 21 or over.
description_web: One doesn’t often think of tree bark or tree roots when one thinks of beer, wine, or mead. However, the ancient and medieval periods are rife with evidence of such things being prepared for ingestion, principally in the realm of medicine. Recall that many recreational beverages we enjoy today also started out as medicinal in nature. There are also a small number of examples of bark in particular being used in beer making itself. Alcohol will be served. IDs will be checked. Must be 21 or over.
fee_itemization: Handout is 7 pages at 0.15 per page (at Staples.)

name: Making Couscous by Hand
description_book: Learn to make couscous by hand following a 13th-century North African recipe, using a method that hasn't changed in 8 centuries.
description_web: Fresh, hand-made couscous is very different from the instant stuff available at most grocery stores. The earliest documented couscous recipe dates from the 13th century and describes a process that is still followed in North Africa with very little change. We'll be following that recipe to make couscous from scratch. If all goes well, attendees will have some hand-made couscous to take with them at the end of the class. Limited to 10 hands-on participants, but others may come to watch.
fee_itemization: Pays for raw ingredients.

name: The History of Clan Blue Feather
description_book: Come learn the 28-year history of the SCA's LGBT+ research and social group.
description_web: Clan Blue Feather is the research, social, networking, and support group for the SCA's lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and related gender and sexual minorities communities and their allies. Started in 1989, the Clan has since become a vibrant and important part of the SCA throughout the entire Society, from local groups to Pennsic and more. Come learn about what's been happening over the past 28 years.

name: Juggling 101: Beginner
description_book: Learn to juggle three balls in the simplest pattern. Equipment available for use or purchase.
description_web: The most basic 3-ball cascade juggling. Juggling balls will be made available for use by the class and may be bought afterward from the instructor.

name: Medieval Fan Fiction
description_book: A discussion of how "fan fiction" was produced and used in the Middle Ages, and how we can produce it and use it in our Society.
description_web: A discussion of how "fan fiction" was produced and used in the Middle Ages, and how we can produce it and use it in our Society. Topics will include the definition of fan fiction, its modern and pre-modern history, and its techniques and authors.

name: Dances for Any Number
description_book: Learn dances that can modified to include more couples participating so no one is left out. Dances will tend to be English Country Dances.
description_web: Dance is Fun so we try to include everyone during dance practices and events; yet what happens if your dance calls for three couples but there is one more couple left out? In this session we will learn dances and variations that allow additional couples to dance. Additional variations and conversations are welcomed and encouraged. Dances will tend to be English Country Dances. No previous dance experience necessary.

location: Denys The Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp  EO8)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: Daily meetings for those in any 12-step program such as AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: We welcome all in AA, NA, OA, SA, Alanon, etc., who are in any 12-step program to the 4:00 pm daily meeting at EO8 Denys The Decadent's Camp.

name: Games Gathering: Chess
description_book: A time set aside for chess players to gather and find an opponent.

location: Gunnery Point on Mt Eislinn (Top of Mt Eislinn)
name: Period Black Powder Firearms: Safety and Handling
description_book: Firearm safety, handling, and shooting procedures for small arms and artillery, 1320-1600. Powder and match supplied by teacher. Ages 18+.
description_web: Firearm safety, handling, and shooting procedures for small arms and artillery, 1320-1600. Owners of period arms are requested/encouraged to bring them and help with coaching newer shooters. Powder and match are supplied by instructor. Ages 18+. Handouts for all classes: http://www.3fgburner.net/#info.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWC *Chorulus Pennsicus*
description_book: Closed rehearsals, by audition only.
description_web:
Closed rehearsals by audition only. 
*Chorulus Pennsicus* information available here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/chorulus-pennsicus

name: Belly Dance with Hadia!
description_book: Learn belly dance movements, techniques, muscle isolations and combinations. Classes are for men and women. Drummers are always welcome!
description_web: Learn Middle Eastern belly dance movements, techniques, muscle isolations, and combinations while gaining strength, balance, flexibility, stamina, coordination, body awareness and basic movements. We will organize dance patterns, learn to improvise, and use mini-combos for any form of belly dance. Loose clothing encouraged. Hip scarves, shimmy belts, full skirts, etc., are all optional and very helpful for movement awareness. Class is open to everyone who desires a review of basic belly dance movements and technique.

name: Known World Players: Open Auditions, Pennsic 47
description_book: Known World Players are seeking actors for Pennsic 47, "Hector of Troy", Elizabethan-styled adaptation of "The Iliad". Audition materials provided.
description_web: Known World Players are seeking actors for Pennsic 47. A noble family, war, unearthly forces and death are sturdy pillars of late-period tragic theater. What if Homer's "The Iliad" had been adapted by an Elizabethan playwright? "Hector of Troy" is an attempt to accomplish such, with mortals speaking in prose, gods conversing in iambic pentameter; honor, betrayals and misfortunes. And death. From the pen of R.S. Mandel, known in the Society as Lord Tarmach ben Yehuda al-Khazari. Come audition to take part in this! Audition materials will be provided.

name: An Introduction to Indian Rhythms: *Tassa*
description_book: An introduction to *Tassa*: the history, playing technique and common beats of this Indian drum. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.
description_web: An introduction to *Tassa*. Learn the history, playing technique and common beats of this Indian drum. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.

name: Beginner Russian Calligraphy
description_book: The basics of medieval Russian calligraphy. Learn the basics of writing the Old Church Slavonic alphabet.
description_web: The basics of medieval Russian calligraphy. Learn the basics of writing the Old Church Slavonic alphabet. There will also be a handout for Russian-style English alphabet. The hands-on portion of the class is limited to 15 people. Please bring your calligraphy supplies if you have them. I will have a limited amount of loaner nibs and/or markers and paper.

name: *Niello*: The Making and Applying
description_book: *Niello* is an ancient enamel-like material, applied to silver and gold work as metal decoration.
description_web: *Niello* is an ancient enamel-like material, applied to silver and gold work as metal decoration. It is used for background and highlighting engraving work.
fee_itemization: Cost of the Silver

name: Distance Tournament
description_book: A tournament that is rotation-based: 2, 3, 4 and 5 rotations. This tourney is open to anyone.

name: Female Fighter Meet-Up
description_book: A meet-up for all female fighters, their significant other, and their trainers to get together and talk about training, mind-set, combat, armor, etc.
description_web: The female fighter was initially not allowed in our Society and, as it has become more common, both in participation and interest, we have set up a meeting for female fighters of all persuasions (heavy, rapier, combat archery/siege). This is not exclusionary however. Females interested in fighting, their spouses/significant others, and those interested in teaching the female fighter are welcome to attend. While there is no rigid format for this meeting, we hope that we will have constructive discussions about training, mind-set, philosophy, combat, etc., so that we can all walk away with something to take back home and apply in our area. No cap on attendance. All are welcome.

name: Moving Me Softly
description_book: Belly dance has so many slow and smooth moves. We will explore them in depth from novice level and up. Circles and 8s and beyond!
description_web: Belly dance has so many slow and smooth moves. We will explore them in depth from novice level and up. Circles and 8s and beyond! We'll explore direction changes, level changes, weight changes and more. This will be applicable in "around the fire," *hafla* **and** performance situations.

name: Four-Couple English Country Dance
description_book: Many of Playford's most interesting dances are done with four couples. Come and learn a few! Dancers of all levels welcome.
description_web: Many of Playford's most interesting dances are done with four couples. Come and learn a few! Dancers of all levels welcome.

name: East Kingdom Brewers' Guild Meet and Greet
description_book: The East Kingdom Brewers' Guild invites you to join us for an evening of socializing and learning. Come spend quality time with your fellow brewers!

name: Battlefield Set-Up
description_book: **Volunteers are needed** to set up the Battlefield. Come out and be part of the magic; be a Hay Bale Hero!
description_web: Ever wonder how the Battlefield is magically set-up prior to each War Point? Be part of the action! Volunteers are needed to set-up the Battlefield. Come out and be part of the magic; be a Hay Bale Hero!

name: *il Titolo Provvisorio*
description_book: Come and see a show full of Conflict, Cunning, and Cantaloupe. We call upon you to be confused as we present "The Miraculous Misconception!"
description_web: Come and see the Youngest *Commedia Dell'arte* Troupe in the Known World perform their **second** (yes, we're back!) show at Pennsic War. A show full of Conflict, Cunning, and Cantaloupe. We call upon you to be confused as we present "The Miraculous Misconception!"  *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

name: Master Edmund the Lame Memorial Two-Hander Tourney
description_book: Another year has passed, and we invite you to join us in celebration of the joy of two-handed swords and friendship.
description_web: Another year has passed, and we invite you to join us in celebration of the joy of two-handed swords and friendship. The format of the tourney will be determined on site by the number of participants, but our goal is to offer everyone the chance to fight as much as their heart desires. Combatants can play by cut-and-thrust rules, as long as both agree in advance.

name: Period Shoes for Armored Combat
description_book: We will cover period footwear suitable for SCA armored combat, along with some modifications to complement their use in this function.
fee_itemization: The fee is to cover the cost of printing for the handout.

name: Ansteorra Court
description_book: Royal court for the Kingdom of Ansteorra.

name: Early Period Whistle Workshop
description_book: Learn to craft an early period whistle out of bone using a few simple hand tools. Based on 10th-century finds in England and Sweden.

name: Werewolves in the Middle Ages
description_book: Covering lore and various views of shapeshifters, especially werewolves, from Rome to the Renaissance, from the Baltic to the Mediterranean.
description_web: I'll cover shape shifters and lycanthropes from the Norse berserkers to the witches of the early Renaissance, focusing on what different attitudes were in different times and places. What would your persona have heard and believed about those tales? What was written by scholars in different times and places?
fee_itemization: free handout, but optional booklet available

name: Atlantian Royal Court
description_book: Atlantian Royal Court

name: David Anthony, The Creepy Bard
description_book: Gather round to hear as The Creepy Bard regales you with songs of drinking, roving, fighting, and things to keep secret from mother.
description_web: Gather round to hear as David Anthony, The Creepy Bard, regales you with songs of drinking, roving, fighting, and things to keep secret from your mother. You will laugh, cry, blush, and wonder where you left the whiskey. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12*.

name: The Ancient Celtic Field Sport of Hurling
description_book: Celtic game of hurling: history, rules, drills. One-hour, hands-on scrimmage depending on available loaner equip. A contact sport; 18 or older.
description_web: Hands-on class on the Celtic game of hurling: history, rules, drills. One-hour scrimmage depending on available loaner equipment. A contact sport; 18 years old or older only. BYO pads, cup, hockey helmet, etc., at own discretion. Bring your own water/sports drink. Hurley stick/ball available for purchase.

name: Æthelmearc Scribal College Open Scriptorium
description_book: Open time at the Scribal tents for people who need to work on scrolls or want to consult with experienced scribes and teachers. Use the side gate.
description_web: Open time at the Scribal tents for people who need to work on scrolls or want to consult with experienced scribes and teachers. Use the side gate. We will have tables, chairs, good lighting, and experienced scribes and teachers who can answer questions, help with any issues or direct you to where to get further information on most scribal topics.

name: Shenanigans with *Vagando Stolti* (in Ampitheater)
description_book: Bring out the fools! *Vagando Stolti*, The Wandering Fools, invite you to laugh-worthy shenanigans! Join us for fun, foolish times! Bring a chair.
description_web: Bring out the fools! *Vagando Stolti*, The Wandering Fools, invite you to laugh-worthy shenanigans! Join us for fun, foolish times. We promise that we will be "better than you expected!"  Bring a chair and join us at the theater on the green!

name: *Atlatl* Battle
description_book: *Atlatl* Competition

name: Historical Brewing Roundtable
description_book: A chance to show off and discuss brewing, vintning, and potables, emphasizing period recipes, techniques, and styles. Learn from others.
description_web: This is not a competition, but a forum where we can focus on period drinks. Not restricted to alcoholic beverages. Are you just starting out, and want honest, gentle feedback? Come join us! Proud to have brewed all-grain for the first time, but want to take it to "the next step" in period-ness? Come and join us! Redacted a period recipe, and want others to see and sample? Come join us! Age 21 and over.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: John Inchingham, Cerian Cantwr & House Sans Nomen
description_book: John Inchingham, Cerian Cantwr, and Household! Come ye all from hither and yon prepared for two hours of music, mayhem, and merriment of the odd kind!
description_web: Listen to the mad tunes and tales of Master John Inchingham, Master Cerian Cantwr, and their household. Sing along with some of the Midrealm's best-known (or more infamous) bards - and Northshield's Master Dahrien Cordell too!  Come ye all from hither and yon prepared for two hours of music, mayhem, and merriment of the odd-kind!

name: Darkyard Tree Ceremony
description_book: Private event

name: Lanea verch Kerrigan at the Ampitheater
description_book: Lanea will perform her original translations, original pieces, and early period favorites. Bring a chair to sit on! **Adult content.**
description_web: Lanea will perform her original translations, original pieces, and early period favorites. Bring something to sit on to enjoy the show on the green! **Show contains adult-themed content.**

name: Family Stories in the Bog
description_book: 8 pm - 8:45 pm: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.
description_web: 8 pm - 8:45 pm: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.

name: Open Dancing
description_book: Join us all evening for dancing by request. Open band! Musicians, please come have fun with us!
description_web:
Balls are fun, but what if you miss your favorite dance because you took too long getting ice cream after dinner? Come to open dancing, and request it! (Period dances, please, during official hours.)

Musicians! We are happy to have you join the open band tonight. "Pennsic Pile" compilations will be available.

name: Mistress Marian and Friends Bardic Concert!
description_book: Mistress Marian shares a special concert of songs and stories from her travels, along with several bards from around our Known World!
description_web: Well-known bard Mistress Marian of Ealdormere has spent more than a decade travelling to all corners of our Current Middle Ages. Join her on the pilgrim's road as she shares a lively bardic retrospective of her travels. Everyone is welcome; bring friends and show them why the bardic arts are truly the lifeblood of our Society. And be prepared to take Marian's bardic enthusiasm home with you!

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP Tech and Lighting
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Coffee with Friends of Dr Bob and Bill
description_book: Morning open meeting for those in recovery.
description_web: Morning open meeting for those in recovery.

name: Youth Armored Castle Battle
description_book: Scenarios will be run in the Gate, Tower, and Sally Port. Muster: 8:00 am at YC area. Previous attendance at the Youth List this Pennsic **required**.
description_web: Scenarios will be run in the Gate, Tower, and Sally Port. Muster is 8:00 am at Youth Combat area. Previous attendance at the Youth List this Pennsic is **required**.

name: Arts and Sciences War Point
description_book: Artisans from the combatant Kingdoms display their work. Pennsic attendees may view and vote for their choice(s) to determine two War Points.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off-line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Armored Combat Morning Session
description_book: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.
description_web: Sparring instructions and melées for youth combatants, ages 6-17. Under 12 must be with responsible individual.

name: How to Teach in the SCA
description_book: As a college educator, I aim to bring together modern-day knowledge to help SCA artisans present a more effective class.
description_web: I teach professionally in the mundane world (college) and have noticed that there is a strong overlap between effective education in my professional life and my hobby life. In this class I will talk about the methodologies used in the professional sphere that lend themselves well to the SCA and how they may be applied. This class can be applied to any art or science as I will be talking about general teaching techniques (pedagogy). This class is ideal for those wishing to share their knowledge within the SCA but are unsure how best to do it. Also welcome are other fellow professional educators to share their knowledge.

name: Heraldry for Scribes
description_book: A discussion of heraldry and the language of the blazon for scribes to render arms properly.
description_web: A discussion of heraldry and the language of the blazon for scribes to render arms properly. We will look at basic heraldic terminology and how to read a blazon to be able to render a proper emblazon.

name: Viking Civil Engineering: Theory and Practicum
description_book: A survey of large-scale archaeological features in the Viking landscape. Learn about their metrology, and survey for a scale circular fortress.
description_web: A survey of large-scale archaeological features in the Viking Age landscape of Scandinavian-controlled areas. First hour is lecture; learn about evidence for metrology, and construction of defensive barriers, canals, bridges, and fortifications. Second hour is hands-on, with surveying exercise on laying out a scale version of a circular fortress.

name: Intermediate Glass Beads
description_book: Intermediate techniques in glass beads: twists, presses, and other issues. Must be familiar with torch and handling glass.
description_web: Intermediate techniques in glass beads: twists, presses, and other techniques. Must be familiar with torch and handling glass. Bring your own torch or we can provide. More torches will mean more fun. We can talk about issues and explore solutions. Youth may attend but must meet experience requirements.
fee_itemization: Glass, gas, slip etc.

name: Bread Roundtable
description_book: Bread bakers and would-be bakers, come join a discussion of what you have been making. Share your successes and get suggestions and advice.
description_web: Bread bakers and would-be bakers, come join a discussion of what you have been making. Share your successes and get suggestions and advice. Bring recipes to share.

name: The Knitted Purses of Sion
description_book: Learn about the 14th-century knit purses found in Sion, Switzerland.

name: Cheese Selection: Green, New, Old and Others
description_book: An overview of how to select the proper type of cheese for your recipe redaction. Recipe made with different cheeses will be available for tasting.
description_web: Ever read a recipe that calls for "Green Cheese" and have no idea what they are talking about? This class will go over common terms found in recipes used to describe cheeses and what would be a good selection. We will also discuss the different results of using different cheeses in recipes. Samples of a redacted dish using different types of cheeses will be available for tasting. Bring your questions and let's figure it out! Class will focus on European recipes.

name: What the Irish Ate
description_book: What was eaten in traditional Gaelic Ireland.
description_web: What was eaten in traditional Gaelic Ireland, based on historical accounts (to include the "Annals"), *Brehon* law tracts, bardic tales, and archaeology.

name: Aphrodisiacs and Other Edible Delights
description_book: Finger foods and other edible delights, particularly ones that are camp-friendly or no-kitchen-needed. Period and locale-based aphrodisiacs.
description_web: Finger foods and other edible delights, particularly ones that are camp-friendly or no-kitchen-needed. Period and locale-based aphrodisiacs. Italian and European Renaissance drinks and morsels designed to entice, to please, to enhance. This class will focus on recipes that are perfect for making prior to an event and bringing along with minimal fuss or that can be easily kept at food-safe temperatures. There will be samples and a pamphlet of recipes. Due to sexual topics that may come up, this class is recommended for those 16 and older.
fee_itemization: $1 per 20-page pamphlet if attendees want one

name: Youth Coordinators: Tips and Tricks
description_book: Learn different ways to help youth be a part of our society, and discuss ways Youth Officers can help outside the classroom!
description_web: Learn different ways to help youth be a part of our society, and discuss ways Youth Officers can help outside the classroom!

name: Landed Baronesses and Barons: A Roundtable
description_book: Considering running for Baron or Baroness? Is your group considering going Barony? What does it all mean? Come join our discussion!
description_web: For Baronies - and any group considering going Barony - there exist roles which are covered by no handbook, training is often minimal, and there are no deputies allowed. Landed Barons and Baronesses are as different as the groups they represent and, while we in the East have House Runnymede, which consists of all current Landed Barons and Baronesses, we may be uncommon in that regard. Come with your traditions, perceptions, expectations, ideas *and* an open mind, to consider how others might see or do the job themselves. This isn't limited to current territorials; former and potential Baronesses and Barons; all are welcome!

name: Medieval Surgery 103
description_book:
A demonstration of period cataract removal on bovine eyes. Not for the squeamish. 
Part 3 of a three-part series.
description_web:
A demonstration of period cataract removal on bovine eyes. Not for the squeamish. 
Part 3 of a three-part series.

name: A New Way to Wire Weave: Anglo-Saxon Interweave
description_book: Discussion and hands-on of a wire weaving technique unique to Anglo-Saxon areas. Knowledge of "Viking" wire weaving is assumed but not required.
description_web:
This will be a discussion of a historical wire weaving pattern and its differences from the Baltic area examples often called "Viking" wire weaving. We will be discussing the archaeological evidence for its construction and use. Ten kits will be available for $5 on a first-come basis for interested participants to practice the method and take home the materials to finish a chain. Observers are welcome.
The Baltic method, commonly known in the SCA as "Viking" wire weaving, will be discussed but not directly taught.
fee_itemization: Kits include wire spool and tool for hands-on practice

name: Wildly Weedy Herbs
description_book: Learn about some medieval and Renaissance herbs now growing wild in the U.S. No walking required.
description_web: Interested in learning how to spot some of the herbs known to our medieval and Renaissance forebears that have escaped and become weeds here? Were they weeds at home? How are they/were they used? We'll cover probably 20 herbal invaders. Instructor will strive to bring examples of most, if not all, plants to handle.
fee_itemization: Simple handout with line drawings.

name: Known World Chatelaines Meeting
description_book: A meeting open to all the Chatelaines of the Known World. Refreshments will be provided.
description_web: Please join the Chatelaines of the Known World for a meeting to discuss trends, topics and issues relevant to all Chatelaines in the SCA.  Refreshments will be provided.

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia* before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.
description_web: Young adults will learn the art of Commedia Dell'arte while practicing and creating skits that will be performed at the end of the week.

name: Pennsic Archery Champions Shoot
description_book: Pennsic Archery Champions where the best from the East, Middle and Ealdormere will compete against the Known World.
description_web: Pennsic Archery Champions where the best from the East, Middle and Ealdormere will compete against the Known World.

name: Lacemaking
description_book: Come see and experience the grace and beauty of lace in all its forms: bobbin lace, needle lace, *teneriffe*, *reticella* and more.

name: Leatherwork
description_book: Leatherworking techniques explored.

name: Children's Ball
description_book: All dancing is fun...but never more so than when it is a party! Come join us for music, refreshments and dance!

name: Known World Baronial Rapier Champions' Tourney
description_book: Open to all Baronial adult and youth rapier champions. Tentative schedule is Adults - 9:30-11:30 am; Youth - 11:30 to 12 pm.
description_web: A day to celebrate the Baronial Rapier Champions of the Known World. Landed Barons and Baronesses are encouraged to bring their chairs and portable pavilions to help us choose the Pennsic 46 Baronial Champions' champion. Open to all Baronial adult and youth rapier champions. Set-up is at 9. Tentative schedule is Adults - 9:30-11:30 am; Youth - 11:30 to 12 pm.

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own; class limited to 10 looms.
fee_itemization: weaving materials, string

name: Youth Rapier Activities
description_book: List will be open for fighting and instruction from 9 am to noon every day of war week. Pending warpoint battles
description_web: All authorized youth fighters are welcome to participate in the daily activities.  Each day will have different rapier-oriented games and lessons.

name: Known World Baronial Rapier Champions' Tourney
description_book: Open to all Baronial adult and youth rapier champions. Tentative schedule is Adults - 9:30-11:30 am; Youth - 11:30 to 12 pm.
description_web: A day to celebrate the Baronial Rapier Champions of the Known World. Landed Barons and Baronesses are encouraged to bring their chairs and portable pavilions to help us choose the Pennsic 46 Baronial Champions' champion. Open to all Baronial adult and youth rapier champions. Set-up is at 9. Tentative schedule is Adults - 9:30-11:30 am; Youth - 11:30 to 12 pm.

name: Champions' Throw
description_book: TENTATIVE:The Champions' Tourney is a War Point. As usual, the format will be revealed at the time of the competition.
description_web: TENTATIVE: The Champions' Tourney is a War Point. As usual the format will be revealed at the time of the competition. The Champions' Tournament will consist of teams of 12 throwers taken from each side. This throw is open to champions from all the realms.

name: Gathering of the Louds
description_book: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Loud Renaissance instruments with a different focus each day such as *intradas*, polychoral works. Bring chair.
description_web: Shawms, sackbutts and curtals, oh my. Players of loud Renaissance instruments gather just for fun to play different styles of music at each session such as *intradas* and other instrumental processionals and polychoral music. Not sure what these instruments are? Come listen or try one. Instruments will be available to share, but a reading knowledge of music is necessary. Bring a chair, music stand and clothespins.

name: Interpreting *Cantigas* on Your Own
description_book: You can learn to read the original notation of the *Cantigas de Santa Maria*! Learn how to make your own transcriptions, or check others for errors.
description_web: The *Cantigas de Santa Maria* are a well-known music source, but can you read the original notation yourself? Yes! By learning just a bit of medieval notation, you can check current transcriptions or even do your own! Why? Because some of the current versions out there are arguably wrong, and because it's fun. [*cantigas* #100, 166, 1, 340, 77]
fee_itemization: for handout

name: Early Irish Roundtable
description_book: Bring your favorite resources, projects, ideas, and questions, and meet with others who share your interest in early Irish history and culture!

name: Intermediate Netting for Hairnets
description_book: Take your existing netting skills further in this hands-on class, learn to net in the round, and learn the common period increase.
fee_itemization: The material fee includes handout, shuttle, gauge, and thread. The handout fee is only applicable for folks who did not get a kit but want a handout.

name: Bidding the Bedes: Introduction to Paternosters
description_book: The history and development of western European Christian prayer beads as well as information on making your own replica.
description_web: In the 13th-16th centuries in western Europe, prayer beads were a ubiquitous accessory. This class discusses the history and development of the paternoster, as well as information on making your own replica. Kits will be available to make a glass paternoster.
fee_itemization: Beads, silk thread, needle, terminal pendant, bead tip

name: *Tate Eboshi*; Japanese Formal Headgear
description_book: How to make and wear those standing Japanese hats that were worn in the medieval period, and still worn formally today.
description_web: I have been making some kinds of *eboshi* hats for years, but during my recent trip to Japan I visited the last remaining workshop in Japan where *tate eboshi* are still made entirely by hand by an 85-year-old master and his 37-year-old apprentice. I've been guessing about things, and now I know the facts from these traditional craftsmen. There are 30 steps to the making of *tate eboshi*, and they involve things like antique paper, rice paste, fermented persimmon juice, hot irons, and cashew lacquer. If you are interested in Japanese formal wear, or hats of any kind, you will be interested in this class.

name: Ravished by God: The Female Poet Saints of India.
description_book: An introduction to the *Bhakti* poetry of Mirabai, Lal Ded and others. Come hear the longing and passion of Indian poets in love with the Divine.

name: Seeþing Sope: Or, How to Boil Medieval Soap
description_book: Turning drip lye and oils into period soap using period techniques. I will go over leaching lye and boiling soap using 16th-century manuscript info.
description_web: Turning drip lye and fats into period soap using period techniques. This class will go over leaching lye, rendering fats and boiling soap as directed by 12th- and 13th-century guild recipes and their updated 16th-century counterparts.
fee_itemization: copy costs

name: Learn to Knit!
description_book: Want to learn to knit? In this class, we will learn to cast on, garter stitch, and how to bind off. Geared for youth participants. A YouthU class.
description_web: Want to learn to knit? In this class, we will learn to cast on, garter stitch, and how to bind off. Geared for youth participants.
fee_itemization: Practice needles and practice yarn the students can take home.

name: Adult Doll Meet
description_book: This class is geared towards adults that collect or want to collect dolls. Please bring your favorite doll to the meet.
description_web: This class is geared towards adults that collect or want to collect dolls. Please bring your favorite doll, as we will be making something special for them. Adults only because doll hobbies can be expensive.

name: Beginning Vocal Technique
description_book: Whether singing, reading aloud, or trying to be heard on the field, you need to know how to use your voice right. (YouthU, recommended for age 10-13)
description_web: Whether you are singing, reading aloud, or trying to be heard on the field, you need to know how to use your voice right. This class will cover the basics of breathing and sound production for both speaking and singing. Participants will work both in groups and individually to practice good breath control and projection. Time permitting, we can apply the principles to pieces they know or want to try. (YouthU, recommended for age 10-13)

name: Build a Crossbow for 25 Bucks
description_book: If you bring 25 bucks, you can walk out with a crossbow that you made with hand tools and a drill. This is an actual crossbow for use on the range.
description_web: If you bring 25 bucks, you can walk out with a crossbow that you made with hand tools and a drill. This is an actual crossbow for use on the range. It will be ugly, but you can make it pretty or change it later now that you know how this works.
fee_itemization: Wood, Screws, Crossbow Prod

name: Youth Theatre
description_book: For kids ages 6-12 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through story telling, acting, and producing their very own play!
description_web: For kids ages 6-12 interested in exploring their creative and theatrical sides through story telling, acting, and producing their very own play! Come join us as we build a theatre show from the ground up, giving younger kids a creative outlet for all that pent up camping energy! Children 12 and under must have a parent or guardian present.

name: Drafting and Distaff
description_book: How you treat your fiber will change what type of yarn you end up with. Come experiment with drafting methods and using a distaff.
description_web: How you treat your fiber will change what type of yarn you end up with. Come experiment with a distaff and discover how silly modern spinners are for not using one. Try out cards vs combs and see the different preparations they make. Try different drafting methods and see how yarns behave differently. Attendees should know how to spin. Spindle and fiber will be provided, but feel free to bring any spinning implement or fiber you may already possess.

name: *Seishin-ryū Sadō Okeiko*: Practice the Art of Tea
description_book: Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners.
description_web:
Learn the rudiments of *wabi*-style tea including both the role of the host and the role of the guest. This is a multi-part workshop for beginners. Please come to as many classes as possible. 

*Okeiko* means "honorable practice". This is a multi-part workshop intended for beginners who wish to learn how to participate in tea gatherings. Both the role of the guest and the role of the host will be introduced. You will learn something new in each workshop. We will begin with walking and bowing and progress to the rudiments of preparing and consuming a bowl of *matcha*. Limited materials will be available for student use during the workshop. 

If you are interested in purchasing materials for long-term personal use, then you should acquire a guest kit and a *fukusa*: 
A guest kit for men can be acquired at: http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-man339.html
A guest kit for women can be acquired at: http://www.teadogu.com/guest-starter-kit-woman339.html
A *fukusa* for men can be acquired at: http://www.teadogu.com/fumepunu9si.html
A *fukusa* for women can be acquired at: http://www.teadogu.com/fuworenu9si.html
While it is possible to save money by ordering directly from Japan, doing so requires dealing with Japanese online storefronts. A note about *fukusa*. A number #9 *fukusa* is much easier to manipulate than *fukusa* with lower numbers. Paying extra is worth the price. A *fukusa* and a fan are what  you need to practice during class. I have an extremely limited number of loaner *fukusa*. You can substitute a number of items  for a fan. Please read the online descriptions of the fans carefully if you choose to provide a substitute or acquire a fan from another source.

There are a number of ways to acquire a 袱紗 *fukusa*. You can even try to make one, but please don't until you know what they are supposed to be like. There is some controversy over just how old they are. Today, men use slightly larger *fukusa* than women do. Further, men always use purple *fukusa* and women typically only use purple *fukusa* after they have become senior instructors. Regardless, here are purchase options. (1) You can always try ebay. (2) You can order online from any of several tea supply stores in Japan through rakuten.co.jp. (3) You can order one from a fellow in Portland http://www.teadogu.com/fukusa.html (Yes, they really are that expensive.) I will try to pick up a couple of loaners (I currently have one) between now and Pennsic. Regardless, the fan is the symbol of the guest, and the *fukusa* is the symbol of the host in the world of tea.
fee_itemization: This class will include a multi-page printed handout.

name: Introduction to *Go*
description_book: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.
description_web: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.

name: Japanese Stab Binding: Make a Book in Under 1 Hour
description_book: Make two books in an hour using the stab binding method of Japan. No handout, as we will focus on the craft rather than the history.
description_web: Come make two books in no time at all using the ancient stab binding method of Japan. There is no handout, as we will focus on the craft rather than the history, but a card with reference sites will be available. Supplies are limited to 6.
fee_itemization: Beeswax, Paper for book pages, decorative paper for book covers and linen binding thread.

name: Allied Champions Battle (Heavy)
description_book: description added soon

TENTATIVE:
